text: And she loves them. They are easy to find in the tall grass/rough, and there is no mistaking them for the Callaways or Titleists that her friends use. These are now our standard birthday, Christmas, and Mother's Day gift to her! BTW, she likes the blue, pink, and purple ones best because they are easier than the others to find on the course.

This is exactly what I was looking for. It's nice and thick, water-based, and sticks like super glue. Better get placement right the first time, though, because it's pretty difficult to peel off the pad to move it (initially)--and forget about just sliding it over real quick-like. Your best bet is to wait for your skin to warm it up a little to loosen the gel, and then try to move the pad by sliding it a bit or peeling it off completely. I like to add more gel if I'm going through the bother of peeling it off.Clean up on the skin is easy--plain water or soap and water. My other (runnier) TENS adhesive cleans up with soap and water and then alcohol to pick up any residue. Tensive doesn't respond to alcohol clean up (I ended up with sticky, gross balls of the stuff all over my neck and hair), so I don't recommend using isopropyl alcohol with this product.

but they don't LOVE them because they aren't shiny. I wanted Kamik boots because they are supposed to be super durable, and my girly-girl daughters require bows or belts or some kind of blingy-flare type of embellishment on all of their clothes/shoes. The Raindrops Rain Boots have buckles, but the matte finish on them didn't impress my princesses. My older daughter, 1st grader going into 2nd grade this fall, thinks they are fine but my younger daughter prefers the shiny polka dot boots with hot pink bows on them that do not match her red raincoat.I actually love the boots and would wear them myself if I could stuff my old-lady, size 9 foot into them!

He is totally into all things Pokemon, and I had no idea what was already on his bookshelf. I bought the set, wrapped it, and dropped it off at the party after telling his mom that I could return the set if he didn't like it or already had the books. HE LOVED THE SET. He'd read 3 of the books by the time I called at 9pm that evening and didn't want to sleep because he was working on the 4th book.Highly recommend for Pokemon enthusiasts!

I purchased this product with the sole intent of lightening melasma patches on my cheeks. After 2 uses, I noticed that the spots have lightened a little. Other reviewers have mentioned that this product burned their skin: everyone's skin is different, and that is why it is important to do a small test patch before applying to your whole face!The Lactic Acid peel has a VERY tingly, minty feel to it--so much so that my eyes started to water shortly after applying the peel. The product is viscous enough (about as thick as Elmer's school glue) that I didn't have to worry about the stuff running into my eyes or nose, so I knew the watery eye-thing had to do with the herbal additions. After a few minutes I rinsed thoroughly and applied moisturizer: no burning or excessive tightness (in contrast to the Glycolic Peel, which continues to sting for about an hour after rinsing). I didn't notice lightening of the age spots until I performed another Lactic Acid Peel at the end of the week. PLEASE BE REALISTIC IN YOUR EXPECTATIONS OF ANY PEEL--this isn't laser treatment! No miracles, just slow and steady improvement over time.I have used the Salicylic Peels (in two different concentrations) and Glycolic Peels in this product line for over a year and have noticed that my skin responds very differently to each of the peels. I wait at least 10 days between using different types of acid. All of their acids improve my skin texture--tighter pores, firmer appearance, and fewer lines--but I noticed that the salicylic helps with breakouts the most, while the glycolic peel seems to help with the age spots and deep lines around my mouth and between my eyebrows. I have the least experience with the lactic acid peel, but I did notice that it seemed to lighten my age spots even more than the glycolic acid mix. The spots are still there, but they are more easily covered by foundation/powder, and the color has shifted from dark brown-charcoal to a light brown freckle-ish tone in just a couple of treatments.I highly recommend all of the peels in the Perfect Image line. I have tried a few peels from other manufacturers with less success and more than a little trepidation regarding their quality control/safety.

***5/19/14 UPDATE***Trays arrived via USPS today--just in time for some pre-vacation whitening!I received all 3 sets of trays (one came with the kit and I bought 2 extra) in one case that is identical to my husband's plastic retainer case. The trays fit my mouth PERFECTLY. I repeat, THEY ARE PERFECT. I love them and believe they are worth every penny.I'll be honest: I had no idea when the trays would show up, so I tried a couple of other reviewers' suggestions for application (sans trays) over the weekend.1. I simply wiped the peroxide solution onto my front teeth (top and bottom) with a Q-tip and left on for about 10 minutes. This resulted in some really messy drooling, sore lips and a sore tongue. Not good. I attempted to buffer these softer tissues with cotton balls, but the cotton balls became soaked with saliva and peroxide and resulted in the same discomfort and mess.2. Applied peroxide solution in the same manner as #1, but held the solution in with Saran Wrap. No offense to the person who suggested this in his review, but it was truly a terrible idea. The stuff ran out of the wrap and onto my gums and tongue--I ended up swallowing some of the solution, and the wrap fell out of my mouth and onto my pajamas. Yuck.Needless to say, I did not get good results using the application methods above. My teeth may have lightened just a bit, but not enough to justify the considerable physical and mental irritation.OK, regarding my new trays--they are WONDERFUL. They are like tooth-gloves. The rubbery material is very thin and just barely touches my gum lines. I squirted a very thin line of product from the syringe into the "valley" of each tray and slid the trays onto my upper and lower teeth. What a difference. I was able to bark out instructions to my kids, wash my face, wash the dishes, and change into PJs. I didn't leave trails of drool all over the place, my tongue and lips remain unmarred, I don't have soggy Q-tips lying all over the sink, and my teeth look about a half shade lighter after 10 minutes. It was SO EASY. I feel stupid for jury-rigging the contrivances mentioned above.I did a little online research to see how Whiter Smile Labs prices ranked among other custom tooth whitening systems and found that their pricing is on the low- to middle end. Another company sells essentially the same kit (actually, it seems identical, but I don't know about the efficacy of their whitening solution or fit of the trays, I just read the product description) for $109--$20 more than Whiter Smile Labs. Other places sell similar kits, but you end up with bulky one-size-fits all trays, some of which require some dipping in hot water to "mold" the product to your teeth. I have tried these molds with no success.I'll post some pictures of my trays. I am so glad I got 3 of them... I bought some re-mineralization gel from another vendor, so one of my trays is a dedicated post-whitening, re-mineralization tray and the others are whitening trays. I am a very, very pleased customer.***5/12/14 UPDATE***Picked up my order from the post office today. It actually arrived on Saturday, May 10, 2014; however, I was not home to sign confirmation of order receipt, so the post office left a note. Items were well packaged in multiple padded envelopes--no boxes like what is shown in the Amazon.com photos, but there really wasn't a need for them. This is what was included:--Three (3) peroxide syringes--Three (3) putty packets (containing one white roll and one purple putty roll that have to be kneaded together for use)--Two (2) hard plastic mold forms--Paperwork requiring name/address and option to order additional dental trays for $26 per tray (you don't have to order additional trays). I am throwing caution to the wind and ordering 2 additional trays in case my kids take off with the one that comes with the kit.--VERY DETAILED instructions on how to use the molds/mold putty and how to return everything to Whiter Smile Labs.--The additional peroxide syringes I had paid for separatelyEverything was very professionally done, and contact information was included in the paperwork in the event I had questions or problems with the order.I mixed the putties, rolled them, inserted them into the forms, and placed the forms on my teeth. I waited 3-4 minutes until they "set" and ran cold water over the putty (per instructions). Putty really did harden pretty well. I didn't need the extra putty, but it was nice that they included it just in case. I placed the trays containing the hardened putty molds into the little padded envelope along with the (completed) portion of the instruction page requiring my name/address/phone and additional tray order.Even though they paid for the return postage, I am in a time crunch and will overnight express ship the molds tomorrow... even USPS priority shipping to Wisconsin will take 3-4 days and I want to get started on this before we leave for the beach.My previous negative review is below... a manager from Whiter Smile Labs was very quick to respond via "comment," and another rep, Paul, from Whiter Smile Labs responded via email at 1:00 am, just a few minutes after my initial review went live. Based on the quick and professional response I received from this company after the initial problems and delay in receiving my order, I really do believe at this point that the issues I had were a fluke. I am eagerly anticipating the arrival of my finished trays so I can get started!INITIAL REVIEW: 5/8/14***THIS REVIEW ONLY COVERS CUSTOMER SERVICE & SHIPPING SINCE PRODUCT STILL HAS NOT ARRIVED***Please note that this is a real review from a real person--you can look at the 100+ other Amazon.com reviews I've written for other products over the past 6+ years.I purchased this product from the company's website over 2 weeks ago with the hope of brightening my teeth for our family vacation.  Based on the company's claim that they usually ship orders within 24 business hours, I thought that giving myself about a month lead time would be plenty... boy, was I off the mark.They clearly state on the Amazon page and their website that they usually ship the product within 24 business hours. After a week of checking my order info online (via the link in the order confirmation email), there was still no tracking information available. I completed the online contact form through their website requesting tracking information and waited for a response. No response. On day 12, I called the customer service line and pressed "2" for "tracking"--the polite auto responder indicated that tracking was not available for my order and I should wait for the beep to leave a message. I left a brief message with full name and contact info. In my vain attempt to get through to a human, I called again and pressed "1" for sales (there's always someone staffing the sales line, right? WRONG!) The same polite auto responder indicated that a sales associate was not available and I should wait for the beep to leave a message. I left another message on the sales line.After about an hour of waiting for a response, I emailed "support@whitersmilelabs.com" and requested the status on my order since it had been 12 days since I placed the order and still didn't have tracking info. Two hours later, I received the following response: "Thank You for contacting Whiter Smile Labs. We will answer your email within 24 hours. We value you as a customer and will try and get back sooner. Thank You again for contacting Whiter Smile Labs." Twenty minutes later, I received another email:  "Hello, I will look into this in the next 30 minutes and as soon as I find out what the isse is, will contact you... You should be able to track it in 2 hours."I waited 4 hours and received neither email nor phone call follow up (how about a quick, "sorry for your inconvenience" email follow up?) I did, however, check my order status that evening and tracking information was finally available. I had imagined that a company that prides itself on speedy service would expedite shipping in some way--hah! no luck. First class USPS service for me and my $100+ order. According to USPS.com tracking, I should expect my order on Monday, May 12, more than 2 weeks after I placed my order.We leave for our first-ever family trip to the beach on the 24th. Even if I overnight the imprint of my teeth to the WhiterSmileLabs.com,  I have little to no hope that I will receive my customized dental tray before we leave. To say that I am disappointed in my experience thus far is a gross understatement. The only way for them to redeem themselves at this point is to provide me with an AMAZING product that is well worth the aggravation of ordering from a company with this level of poor communication and customer service.I will update this review after I receive my order and use the product.

We've added eucalyptus oil to the multitude of other measures we are taking to combat indoor allergy issues. I put quite a lot of it in my fragrance-free laundry detergent along with tea tree oil and lavender oil to combat dust mites (as an alternative to my much-beloved Demite additive, which doesn't smell quite as nice). I also add it to my ADMS Anti-Allergy spray along with lavender oil and spray it on rugs, carpets, bedding, and curtains. I do not spray this mixture onto wood surfaces since I do not know how the oils will react with the various finishes on our furniture, cabinetry and floors.We've also added eucalyptus oil to our special mix of essential oils we put in our detangling solution to prevent lice--both of my girls are in classrooms where there have been lice outbreaks, and we've managed to remain lice-free since they started public school last year. Yea! The anti-lice solution is as follows: approximately an eighth teaspoon of eucalyptus oil, an eighth teaspoon of tea tree oil, and a couple drops of peppermint oil in one bottle of Fairy Tales Rosemary Repel® Conditioning Spray (8 oz.) Shake well and spray liberally on hair EVERY DAY.I really like the Now brand of eucalyptus oil--it is very concentrated (unlike a couple of other brands I've used), and it pours rather than drops out of the bottle (I despise those little dropper caps). The price is also very good, but I would buy it even if it weren't as competitively priced since I am convinced it works for my purposes.

Pretty much the only cracker-type food I am not allergic to is rice. Most other gluten/wheat-free cracker manufacturers sneak things like corn, sesame seeds, soy product, nut products, etc., all of which elicit an allergic response. This cracker is made of brown rice. That's about it.I really enjoy eating these with salted butter for a snack. They are also nice with cream cheese or honey. They are G*d-awful with guacamole or salsa. They do not go well with the following cheeses: Brie, Edam, smoked gouda, plain gouda, sharp cheddar, mild cheddar, fresh mozzarella, Parmesan, bleu, Swiss, colby-jack, and pepper-jack. I will hazard a guess and say that they probably do not go well with most cheeses other than cream cheese.The price is pretty good for the 12-pack case. One case lasts me about a month. I cannot find these crackers anywhere locally, so the price is really pretty irrelevant in my case (if I want to eat crackers without suffering through hives and other problems).

Yes, I have an Earth Fare within 5 miles of my house and in in a perfect world I'd tootle on over there, buy my flour, and support local businesses. HOWEVER, as we all know, it's not a perfect world, I use a ton of this flour, and dragging my kids to Earth Fare is on par with getting a Brazilian bikini wax (i.e., not a good time).Now on to the product itself. Anyone cooking with rice flour knows that it can produce a somewhat gritty texture in baked goods. The finer the flour, the less gritty the product (usually). I have made sugar cookies, chocolate chip cookies, almond cookies, berry cobbler, and a vegetarian pot pie with this flour. The cookies were the "grittiest" of these foods. The pot pie was the least gritty--the crust was just extra-firm, yet still buttery and tasty. One needs to adjust her expectations when going grain- and nut-free. I get wild and occasionally add some tapioca and potato flour into my baking mix, but the bulk of it is brown, white, and sweet white rice flour.In conclusion, this flour is the probably the best rice flour I've used for baking thus far.

Pros:Covers up all cooking/doggie/children smellsAllergen neutralizer works well enough in hallways/livingroomTidy little bottle and good spray/misterCons:Allergen neutralizer not strong enough for bedrooms of those with severe dust mite/pet allergiesFragrance REALLY strong if product is used in quantities sufficient to control allergy symptoms (and my bedding ends up soggy)I use this product in conjunction with the not-as-fragrant ADMS Anti-Allergy spray (http://www.amazon.com/ADMS-Anti-Allergen-Spray-32-oz/dp/B0010DLYR4/ref=sr_1_1?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1398535801&sr=1-1&keywords=adms+anti-allergen+spray). The combination of these products takes care of the allergy issue and the weird chemical issue of the ADMS spray. Another reviewer indicated that he sprayed it on his return vents after a kegger to freshen up the house. While I am at least 20 years beyond the demographic that enjoys that style of bacchanalian festivity, I agree with the latter part of his statement wholeheartedly--the spray will definitely freshen the house when sprayed liberally on return vents.If the allergen reducing properties of this spray were just a little better, I'd have given this product 5 stars.

This is a lovely case. LifeProof makes great cases. I bought this for myself but could not use it because I have an iPad mini 4. It ended up being an excellent gift for my niece who has a mini 2.DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE A MINI 4!
Fantastic rug! Love it love it. Looks as shown. Is soft and comfortable. Very happy with this purchase!

I like the image. The mouse pad is brand new, so I don't know how it will hold up. We'll see. But the color is WAY off of the image. I purchased the image of the house floating away attached to millions of colorful balloons. The image on Amazon looks black and white with bright, colorful balloons, many of which are light and pastel as well as rich. What I got is a green sky and the balloons are almost all very dark or too bright, like the contrast was turned up way too high.I like it fine, but thought it was worth informing potential buyers that what you see is not exactly what you get.

It looked lovely, it really did, but the black "stones" started falling off immediately. I ended up having to pry off the same one on the other side to use it for the rest of the night. Kind of embarrassing, but I managed. Still, won't be buying House of Harlow jewelry again any time soon ... no matter how attractive they look.
Very crisp and tasty. Used it for sushi tonight and it worked great!

Cute tank, but it's extremely sheer. The front gets some cover from the sequins, but the back is almost completely see-through. If you don't mind or plan to wear something else underneath or plan to use a bra as an accessory, I suppose it could work. But if you would rather not see a bra or wear layers, this is not the best tank to purchase.

If you are looking for a healthier ramen without msg and all that other garbage, this one is really good. I love that it isn't overly salty. It is excellent for adding veggies, green onions, and other ingredients. Add soy sauce to taste. My kids like it too.

These were ok. I liked the neon colors even thought they didn't glow for long. Good value for the price. Had to throw out all the eggs with crosses though. Can't figure out why pagan holiday eggs would have a Jesus cross on them. Weird. Still worth it in the end, I guess.

If you liked Dragon Age: Origins, or Skyrim, you'll probably like Dragon Age Inquisition.I found it to be much better quality than Dragon Age II, but that isn't saying much as that was pretty much filler between the two major installments. I still find the gameplay inferior to Skyrim, however the interaction between characters is much better. If the two were merged into one game I'd be a happy camper. That said, I also found the character interaction inferior to Dragon Age: Origins. I quickly ran out of inter action with many of the characters and had less control over the quality of relationships. Also the misleading or less than exact communication options tripped me up again, though not as badly as in DA2. The answer choices should be what they actually will be. Otherwise you're gambling on how you want to represent your character, so I never am able to play through personal interaction with any confidence. As a side note, I also disliked that things you can loot say "LOOT" on the ground. Makes for lousy suspension of disbelief. And I was disappointed all containers didn't open, and thievery in game was nonexistent. And my final gripe, that you never loot potions... therefore if you're in the thick of it, you'll need to pick up and fast travel back to a camp for supplies when you run out, or look for supply cache boxes that are rarely around.All that said, I'm very happy with the amount of gameplay so far. I like the towns and areas and closing the rifts is very cool. The story line from Origins to now has always been really interesting and I feel very drawn in. The conflicts and perspectives with magic vs control, the mysteries of the fade. I feel like there is a lot here and it's ever deepening. This makes me feel good about the game series in general as reliable entertainment. They can make tweaks to the gameplay with each release, so it can improve, but if the story sucks, you're nowhere. So I'm glad that EA has done more right than wrong here... for now. ;)

What I ended up getting in the mail was the long sleeves, long pants version of this. I really wanted the shorts and short sleeves version and was really confused when my order arrived. I needed it for a specific party so I ended up cutting it myself, which was ok, but not as good as the product pictured here.Otherwise, I love these and want lots of them. They're warm, cute, and snuggly. My whole family loves them and we each have at least one. :)

The banana slicer didn't slice at all. It just mashed the banana down, got through a bit of the peel, just enough for the filling to squish out the sides. They should call this a Banana Pudding Maker.Still in the market for a better banana slicer.

Love this. Tara is one of my favorite instructors for her tireless effort to remind you to breathe. These disks are soothing, beautiful, relaxing, and fun. There is definitely a flow for everyone in these disks. Great variety for beginners up past intermediate and even on to advanced who still like a guided practice that is a nice self-challenging no-brainer.Tara's narrative is like a constant path guiding you through every moment with your body in each pose, suggesting play and even micromovements within the greater poses of the flow. I love it! Flow yoga constantly moves, so it can be hard to get clear guidance in new practices unless you choreograph it yourself.Can't say enough good things about this set. Really. It's exactly what I've been looking for in a DVD set for years. Hours of good feelings for body and mind! Varieties of length practices from a 5 minute routines in bed for am and pm, 15 minute Gentle Flow on Disk 2 to an hour long flows on Disks 1 & 3, and plenty of 30-40 minute flows too.Thanks Tara and Strala Yoga for being inspiring, warm, friendly, and approachable. Your love of yoga shines through everything you do, and is contagious. Thank you for being the breadcrumbs we need from where we are in our yoga practice to where we know we want to end up.People seem confused about routine time lengths. Disk two's descriptions have a few names for each flow, so I can see where the confusion is from. The descriptions and times are listed on the back of each disk, but here's a quick guide:Disk 1  - Strong Flow (1 hour play time) listed at 60 minutes  - Relax Flow (34 minute play time) listed at 30 minutesDisk 2  - AM Flow (33 minute play time) listed as Beginners Flow  on back of case at 30 minutes  - Gentle Flow (14 minute play time) listed on back of case  as Relaxed Easygoing Flow on back of disk at 15 minutes  - PM Flow (48 minute play time) listed on back of case  as Calming Night Time Flow at 50 minutesDisk 3  - AM Yoga In Bed (4 minute play time) listed at 5 minutes  - Daily Flow (32 minute play time) listed on back of case  as Daily Basic Flow at 15 minutes  - Energy Flow (1 hour 2 minute play time) listed on case  as Energizing Strong Flow 60 minutes  - PM Yoga in Bed (6 minute play time) listed on case as  Bed Time Flow at 5 minutesDisk 4  - Pose Library  Sets of poses related to topics such as Seated, Standing,  Sun Salutations, Arm Balance, Inversions, Back Bends,  Reclining and runs 90 minutes total according to  back of case  - BONUS: Strength and Flexibility poses listed as 20  collective minutes on back of caseHope that helps! :) I'm printing it up and putting it with the disks for quick reference for myself too since I don't have them memorized yet.

Other reviews complained of handle damage, rust, hot handles, and other issues.I have NOT experienced ANY of these issues.The kettle is beautiful and shines up nicely. It heats well on gas or electric stoves. I put it on a burner the same size as the pot, and no matter how high it is boiling at, the handle has never been too hot to use by hand. The rubber handle stays cool and is in as good condition as it was the day I got it 6 months ago.I'll check back in when it starts to show wear, but for now, there's not a bit.Love it. It was a great buy, and I'm so glad I have it.----------------------------------------------------------------------  UPDATE! - 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS AFTER PURCHASE  ----The handle is still in perfect condition. The rubber still looks and functions as good as day one. Shines nicely and works wonderfully. We used it several times a week, sometimes every day, or several times a day. HEAVY USE, but it's holding up gracefully.The only wear and tear on it is some corrosion at the base in the crack. I think the salt in the air is causing gradual damage. But it is only in the crack between the stainless steel part and the copper part. Doesn't look as good there, but the pot still works in every way I need. If we didn't live on a small island in the middle of the ocean, I'm sure it would be 100% perfect in every way still.The 5 star rating stands!

This stuff is a bit chalky. The flavor is ok... not great. BUT it works WONDERS!Very filling, very nourishing. I had less cravings than ever. Lost 5 lbs so far, using Almased for one or two meals per day for a couple weeks. I pair mine with CocoaVia Dietary Supplement, Unsweetened, Dark Chocolate 0.27 Ounces each, 30 Count Yum!

The dress is very pretty but it is an intense purple color, and the jacket is jet black. In the original picture as of at least Oct. 2012 and before, it looks like a light purple and grey dress with a charcoal grey shrug. We'll upload an actual image of what we received.My daughter loves it though, and the purple color is very pretty. We're happy with it.Size is accurate.
The sizes run fine, but the bra is just not comfortable. Not enough give to it. I'll stick to Victoria's Secret in the future.

You can't be a little religious. You either are or you aren't. This book slips the "G" word at least once. It seems innocent enough, but that's enough to make it not a religion neutral book. It's either for everyone or it isn't. This book isn't.

Its nice to have all of these suggestions in one place. This book is a bit of a "The Best of" boy and homeschool tips.I'm not sorry I bought it, but do think it's more of a $0.99 book, not a $2.99 book.

I know Christians who would roll their eyes at how overwhelmingly religious this book is, forget those of us who are free-thinkers and don't live our lives based on myth and superstition.This book is not terribly well-written, but I continued to read since I related to the goal of creating a fresh homeschool year. We all know that feeling of needing to refocus the family and create a positive environment for all to learn and live in. The author proceeded to identify all parts of the family and experience through their Christian and Biblical relationship with their "God" and worked toward homeschooling function from there.If you are Evangelical or Baptist and homeschooling, you will probably like this book. Even despite it's bloggish level of quality.I'm giving this book 1 star, and would give it zero if I could because this book should be obviously titled and marked as a Christian handbook. I was drawn in by the classy appearance and high reviews (probably made by church friends). Many good books and homeschool books include the presence of their beliefs, and that is fine. This is not one of those books.This book is so overwhelmingly religious, it is useless to any other variety of belief system. To a non-believer, it's so dogmatic and imbalanced that its almost offensive. I suppose it was written for a very tiny group of people. What a shame.If you aren't a very conservative and deeply traditional Christian homeschooler, this book is NOT for you. I hope there is a way to return Kindle books. I definitely want those few dollars back.

This is a hard book to review.Narration: WonderfulTechnical Writing: ExcellentOverall Concept: RelatableSupporting Characters: ColorfulMain Characters: unintentional TRAIN WRECKAllow me to elaborate. Eleanor Brown is obviously a solid writer. Her description and narration was absolutely masterful. However, I couldn't read it thanks to the frustration created by it's contradictory nature. The characters are young and they are written to sound like old women. I LOVED this book until the moment any of the sisters spoke, and then I was instantly snapped out of the enjoyable read. For a modern book, the characters were just too old. They were painfully unrealistic. Not because of their born and raised flare for Shakespeare (which I adore), not for being eloquent or bookish (I'd quite relate to that), and not because of any age disconnect (they're my age). Their manner of speaking and choice of words even in the most casual situations made it impossible to believe the young one was any kind of rebel or free spirit, or that the fashionable one wouldn't have literally been laughed out of any social scene suggested to have been part of her New York life. I suppose the homey one could have been as frumpy and dated as she was written, but even that was pushing it.This book would be great for old ladies reminiscing on young life. It strikes the elderly chord well while wrapped in the romantic package of younger women finding themselves.I wonder a bit how it ends, because I really enjoyed the general premise... but I'll never know. I couldn't possibly torture myself long enough to read it and find out.Ms. Brown truly is an excellent writer, but I think it's obvious she should write main characters of her own age group. Sorry if this is a bit harsh, but it's completely true. If this had been a book about sisters in their 50's or 60's it would have been perfect.

I'm not taking the time to write a lengthy review here. People have already said it all. Really.I have to admit, I'm curious to see how and if they are going to make a movie out of this book. I can't imagine anyone liking it or how any film maker could attempt such an amazing feat as to turn it into something that anyone would even remotely like!I guess this book has that much going for it. It's like a train wreck... hard to look away. Of course I wouldn't spend a dime to see the movie if there was one. I's wait till I can watch it online instantly from Netflix or Amazon.

My son has used his size large from 5 to 6 years old. It was absolutely perfect for him to gain confidence in our pool at home. Now my older son is growing out of his and able to swim on his own. But my toddler is about ready for a vest of his own, so I'm back to buy a medium for him.In case there is still any confusion about the use of this vest, let me help clear it up:This vest is a swim trainer, not a life-jacket. It supplies enough support in the water for weak swimmers to gain strength and confidence. Any circumstance they would be practicing swimming in a pool, on the shore of a lake, pond, or the pool of a waterfall, this vest will allow them to swim without sinking easily. They will have to work a little to keep their head above water. It is a swimming vest, not a lazy floating vest. When my son was about 5, it took him an afternoon to get used to the vest and taking partial responsibility for keeping himself up and swimming. After that we both felt reasonably confident of his general water safety and became very comfortable swimming with this product. He was free to use his arms to paddle, as well as kick around. This vest gives kids a good strong start in the water.(Please note, this is not for use in the ocean in most circumstances. Sometimes a floating child in the sea is in more danger than a sinking one. Better keep kids safe, within your reach in shallow water they can stand in, and/or secure in a certified life vest. No young child should be allowed to swim unsupervised regardless of how great their floatation device is.)

In this book, the author Liz Fraser interviews her grandmother to compare notes on good old fashioned parenting vs new parenting trends and lifestyles. The result is a fascinating view into even her grandmother's childhood and her parents' views and techniques, as well as a wonderful dialogue between generations of mothers.My favorite thing about this book, however, is the tone. Liz comes across in an informed, but playful and relatable way, making the book a very entertaining read. I highly recommend picking up this book.On a side note, Liz Fraser is out of the UK and the book isn't widely distributed here in the United States. A real shame as I think the US lacks a character like her in our parenting advice world. She's a great example of a modern mom that so many American women would both relate to and be able to learn from. She has a couple other books available too, and a new one coming out in 2012 I believe.
Nabbed them on sale. Definitely worth it. They are as cute as they look and go with all kinds of outfits.

The pictures are lovely, the recipes are creative. However only one or two of the recipes are even remotely ok to feed to kids on a regular basis unless you want them to develop obesity and diabetes... very un-fairy like.On a personal note, I'm a bit confused in general. Fairies are supposed to be lovely little nature creatures that live among flowers and mushrooms, drinking dew and wearing acorn tops for hats. How does one make the leap from such natural surroundings to a fairy cookbook made with refined sugar, chemical food colorings, and frostings, and candies, and maraschino cherries?I guess that was my big disappointment with this book. My daughter could only make a fairy recipe once in a great while because eating them all the time would be terrible for her. If the book had been creative like it was but in a tolerably less sugary way, I'm sure we'd have had little fairy meals much more often. And when getting rid of things, I did dump the book since we could only use it rarely for parties rather than for fun on a more regular basis.The idea was cute though.

So the screen protector attracted a few bits of dust and didn't smooth out. Oh well. I can get more cheap and try again.The otterbox case is a bit heavy, but a great protector. It's not as splash resistant as the defender for the iPhone 3Gs but water shouldn't be near the iPad anyway. I feel this case will keep our homeschool-dedicated iPad well protected. Also the hard screen cover and stand work beautifully. Another great product by Otterbox!

Forget the screen protector, the case is perfectly simple and exactly what I wanted.I have a sleeve to carry around my iPad but eventually wanted a thin, light, rubbery protective bumper around the edges. I already have a decorative skin from gelaskins that I didn't want covered up too. This mostly clear case is perfect. The dots don't bother me, my iPad's style is intact, it's still sleek and slim. Great buy for the price.Also the shipping and delivery was prompt. No issues here.

I already had and enjoyed the Gaiam Yoga Kids DVDs but my kids needed something new. Story land Yoga was awesome! They act out stories through yoga with two adventures to choose from. What a brilliant idea! I would love to see more like this. If there was a series of several episodes, I would buy it. PBS should pick up a kids show like this. Fun, educational, and entertaining! Doesn't get better than that! :)

I've had a personal yoga practice for a while now. I began with several books and dvd's, but it is really important to have a good reference book. A yoga reference book should contain enough for you to pick from a variety of poses, and should inspire and empower you to create and continue your pursuit of your own yoga lifestyle. This book is a great reference book for beginners and intermediates.Slim Calm Sexy has an good number of poses (though I have books with even more variety). I prefer using this book over my others anyway. This book is a better total package. The practical yet playful and casual tone in the written content comes across as friendly and easy to relate to. But more than anything, Tara Stiles inspires tremendously through her unparalleled grace and elegance in the photographs. Slim, calm and sexy, Tara is the Prima Ballerina Assoluta of the Yoga world. Could anything be more interesting, motivating, and inviting?And, if I can top all of that with one more thing... She is a really nice person! I've never met Tara Stiles, but I've watched several videos and interviews now. She seems gentle, approachable, calm, but energetic and fun. I'm sure she'd make a great friend. In the mean time, she can be the best friend of our yoga practices through her book and videos. I recently ordered Tara Stiles - Yoga Anywhere: The New York Sessions and can't wait to get it! :)I am looking forward to more books, dvd's, and maybe even more lifestyle advice from the lovely Tara Stiles.

It's not even my skin color type. I use it as a sort of bronzer or darkener for facial contouring and shaping make-up. I love it and if I can help it, I will never be without it again. :) Great product!

Walt Disney Studios came out with the first version of Chilling, Thrilling Sounds Of The Haunted House in 1964.  The first side is narrated by Laura Olsher and the overall record is composed of a lot of things that actually don't have much to do with Halloween, ironically.  It's a classic vinyl record, though.  However, in 1979 Disney released a new version that carries the same title and guess what?  It is waaaaaaaaaaaaayyyyyyyy better than the cheesy 1964 original.  This 1979 album has EVERYTHING to do with Halloween and it's incredibly scary as well.  Pretty much the full Halloween spectrum is covered.  Take a look at the names of the tracks on the first side of the album:1. Night Creatures2. Haunted House3. The Dungeon4. The Witches5. Encounter In The Fog6. A Grave Matter (The Grave Robbers)7. Mad Scientist's LaboratoryThese seven tracks on Side One make up "Frightening Situations" (Seven spooky scenes in sound).  These tracks are like short scenes in imaginary movies that are designed to trigger the imagination.  Side Two consists of "Eerie Sound Effects" (Create your own tales of terror), which are designed to help your own creativity.  Here are the categories and the individual sound effects:The Elements: Thunder and Lightning/The Storm/Winds/Dripping CavernCreatures: Howling Wolves/Rats/Shrieking Cats/Owls/Baying Hounds/Crickets/The Raven/Unearthly MonsterGhosts and Phantoms: Moans and Groans/Laughing Ghost/Cackling Witches/Assorted Screams/Heartbeat/Dragging FootstepsFrightening Devices: Creaking Doors/Rusty Gate/Fog Horn/Clock Striking Midnight/Rattling Chains/Laboratory Sounds/Tolling BellHaunting MusicThe cover art is awesome, both front and back.  Every spooky scene in sound is top notch, but my three favorites are Haunted House, Encounter In The Fog, and A Grave Matter.  This album captures the essence of Halloween perfectly and that's one of the reasons why I still listen to it to this day.  Other Halloween albums have come and gone, but this one has stood the test of time.  This album got some negative press at the time of its release.  Critics said it was too dark and scary compared to the original album from 1964.  Well, isn't Halloween SUPPOSED to be scary?  This 1979 release even has a warning on the back cover:WARNING: This album will scare your socks off.  Parental guidance suggested.

Psycho II (Expanded Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) by Intrada is the complete original score to Psycho II (1983), starring Anthony Perkins, Vera Miles, Meg Tilly, and Dennis Franz.  Jerry Goldsmith did a good job composing music for this criminally underrated sequel to the original Psycho (1960).  This score is drastically different from Bernard Herrmann's masterpiece from the original movie, but it has its own identity and memorable music all its own.  The opening Main Title is my favorite piece in the movie, but all of the music is good throughout.I suggest picking up a copy of this soundtrack before all are sold.

For a full description of the plot (if there is one), etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this David Lynch movie...Inland Empire (2006) might be the weirdest David Lynch movie of all, and we all know that ALL of his movies are weird, but this one might come in first place.  This three hour movie seems to have everything that is vintage David Lynch and then some, including people dressed as rabbits.  Honestly, I'm not quite sure what this movie is about, but that's actually a normal reaction for anybody who watches David Lynch movies.  Bruce Dern's daughter Laura turns in a good performance.  This movie also stars Jeremy Irons and Justin Theroux.  I didn't care for the use of the steady cam in a lot of scenes in this movie because there was some shaking of the camera which I find distracting.  The second disc of this 2-DVD set contains about three and a half hours of extras with a lot of weird stuff.  While I like other Lynch movies such as Mulholland Drive, Eraserhead, The Elephant Man, Blue Velvet, etc., better than this movie, Inland Empire is still a good flick that I recommend seeing.

Three Dog Night - The Complete Hit Singles is a 21-song collection of Three Dog Night's rather large number of hits.  There are lots of recognizable tunes here, such as "One", "Mama To Me (Not To Come)", "Joy To The World", "An Old Fashioned Love Song", "Shambala", "The Show Must Go On", and many others.  This band was in their prime in the late '60s and early '70s and this collection has everything you'd want from this classic band from a bygone era.Highly recommended.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this movie...Lincoln (2012) stars Daniel Day-Lewis in the lead role.  He does an excellent job as Abraham Lincoln, definitely worthy of the Academy Award.  He not only looks like Lincoln, but also captured Lincoln's mannerisms, posture, even how he pronounced certain words such as pronouncing the word "get" as "git".  Sally Field is a dead ringer for Mary Todd Lincoln.  She looks exactly like her and portrayed her bipolar personality brilliantly.  Tommy Lee Jones is also great in his role as Thaddeus Stevens.  This movie also stars Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Hal Holbrook, David Strathairn, and James Spader.  Really, everyone nails their roles in this movie.  The movie looks really good.  By that I mean the picture is clear, there's great scenery, color, etc.  The movie is on the dark side and covers the last four months of the Civil War and Lincoln's presidency.  It focuses more on Lincoln as a man rather than a mythic figure.The only thing I didn't like about this DVD was having to skip through about a dozen promos, previews, and distributor and film company credits, etc. before seeing the actual movie.  Very annoying.  I hate previews and I'm proud to say that I've never watched a single preview on any DVD I own - EVER.I recommend seeing Lincoln.

This t-shirt will help you portray your enthusiasm for John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic Halloween III - Season Of The Witch, which happens to be my favorite Halloween movie in the entire franchise.  I like it even more than Halloween (1978).  The decal is a classic image from the movie, which shows some trick-or-treaters walking in Phoenix, Arizona at dusk while the shamrock song is playing.  This black t-shirt is of good quality and fits well.Highly recommended.

This t-shirt shows the iconic jack-o-lantern face of the opening credits of John Carpenter's Halloween (1978).  The extended cut in the lower right corner of the nose is what makes this rather simple and basic face memorable.If you want to wear a Halloween 1978 t-shirt that actually has something other than Michael Myers on it, then I highly recommend this t-shirt.  Even a simple shirt like this will make you stand out from the crowd, believe me.

I'm reviewing the plates...The paper plates show classic images of Halloween - jack-o-lanterns, owls, spiders, bats, a haunted house, etc. and have the traditional classic Halloween colors of orange and black.  These plates are sturdy and measure 8.75 inches in diameter.Recommended.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this Tim Burton movie...Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber Of Fleet Street (2007) stars Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter, and Sacha Baron Cohen.  This is a weird sort of horror movie that's actually a musical.  All the singing done by all the characters drove me nuts.  I swear, there's a song a minute!  I'm not kidding.  I'm not much of a fan of musicals in general, so even horror musicals such as this one have a mountain to climb before they win my approval.  The only horror musicals I like are The Wizard Of Oz (1939) and the borderline horror musical Willy Wonka & The Chocolate Factory (1971).  This movie would have worked waaaaaaaay better if it was just straight dialogue with no singing whatsoever.  The weird thing about this movie is that it's a musical with a very dark atmosphere.  The best aspect of this movie is indeed the atmosphere, which is dark, creepy, and macabre, so the nonstop singing brings the movie down.  I deducted 2 stars because of this.  The singing is just too annoying and waaaaaaaaaaay too frequent.  This is definitely a vintage Tim Burton movie, but he's done so many other movies that are way better that have similar dark and macabre atmospheres, such as Batman (1989), Sleepy Hollow (1999) and others.I don't plan on watching this movie again due to all the singing.  I could, on the other hand, mute the TV and turn on some horror music on the CD player.  That would probably make the movie way more effective than listening to all the singing.If you're curious, this movie is worth a look.  Recommended only if you like musicals and/or want to watch something different.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this movie...Sherlock Holmes (2009) stars Robert Downey, Jr., Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong, and Eddie Marsan.  This movie has a lot of action and darkness throughout.  The fight sequence near the beginning comes off as a little awkward with the film being sped up, etc., but it's definitely a unique sequence.  The acting throughout is good, especially by Downey.  The musical score by Hans Zimmer is pretty good.  The CGI was done well, with the exception of some scenes that looked quite fake.  The DVD comes with Special Features, including a feature called Sherlock Holmes: Reinvented.This movie is clearly a different spin on the Sherlock Holmes story and character.  He seems way more active than he normally would be and I feel that this was done deliberately to satisfy today's audience who expect and want everything to be high octane or they'll get bored.  This is Sherlock Holmes for the 21st century.Worth a look.Chow.

This 100% polyester t-shirt will help display your enthusiasm for the granddaddy of modern horror films, the first true "slasher", Psycho (1960).  The shirt shows a daytime picture of the iconic Bates house with the title "Psycho" above it.  There is no decal on the back of the shirt.I highly recommend this t-shirt for any fan of Psycho or horror movies in general.

This NFL Films 2-DVD set called History Of The Cleveland Browns (2008) is everything you'd want when it comes to a nearly complete history of one of the NFL's greatest and most successful teams.  Disc One features the history of the Browns from their early days of winning many NFL Championships in the 1940s and 1950s to the then-present day (2008).  You'll see a wealth of old black and white and color footage with highlights, interviews, profiles, and commentary from many Browns greats as well as sportswriters, sportscasters, and historians.  A great deal of attention (of course) is given to all time great Jim Brown and his legendary career.  Disc Two features the following segments:Greatest Games - Jets/Browns 1986Bernie Kosar - Cleveland LegendFrank Ryan - Genius QuarterbackOzzie Newsome - The Wizard Of Oz1980 Browns Highlight FilmIf you want to see the definitive Cleveland Browns history, then this set will deliver.  Total run time is over four hours.  Highly recommended.

This treeman face and arms will make a tree look like it's alive and ready to scare.  Use nails to attach the face and arms to a tree and you'll have the creepiest tree in the neighborhood.  Recommended for Halloween night and beyond.

Jets: The Complete History (2007) is an awesome NFL Films collection of footage and documentaries on the history of the New York Jets, who originated in the AFL and won the AFL Championship before playing the NFL Champion Baltimore Colts in Super Bowl III on January 12, 1969.  The second DVD in this set has basically a drive thru version of Super Bowl III.  Nearly every play of the game is shown, but it gets to the point rather than showing the entire game.  You'll hear Curt Gowdy calling the game.  During the game, every once in a while you'll see and hear commentary by some of the players on both teams as well as the head coaches, who give analysis of the game.  Also on Disc Two are bonus features - The Coaches, The Midnight Miracle, 1968 Jets Highlight Film, and 1998 Jets Highlight Film.  Disc One features the complete history of the team from its AFL days up until the then current day (2007).  The Bonus Features are excellent, with features on Curtis Martin, Herman Edwards, Wayne Chrebet, The Sweetest Victory, Duel Of Legends, The Miami Rivalry, Super Bowl III - An All-Star Tribute, and Joe and the Magic Bean, a feature that was filmed in 1971.Quite a bit of attention is given to Joe Namath, what makes him tick, his legacy, etc.  Attention is also given to the historical significance of Super Bowl III and how it changed pro football forever.  The first few Super Bowls had the NFL champions competing against the AFL champions.  As a result of the Jets' victory over the Colts in Super Bowl III, all ten of the AFL teams were absorbed into the NFL, thus creating the American Football Conference (AFC) that we know today.  The Jets' win in the Super Bowl showed that an AFL team could defeat an NFL team and that the AFL was not an inferior football league to the NFL.  You'll also see interviews with lots of celebrities who remember Super Bowl III and their reflections on that game.If you want a really awesome history of the New York Jets, then I highly recommend this DVD set.

For those of you who are burnt out on the old traditional overplayed Christmas music that you hear over the P.A. system when youâre at the grocery store, then Midnight Syndicateâs dark Christmas album Christmas: A Ghostly Gathering (2015) will satisfy your need for something refreshingly different.  Unlike so many Christmas albums that have been released over the past 75 years or so, this album has a definite conceptual theme and the music is tailored to that theme, which is:âAs fierce winter winds cut across the frozen landscape, a welcoming golden glow beckons from the windows of a venerable country mansion.  Decorated in the festive trappings of Yule, its stately walls seem to offer a much-needed respite for the weary traveler.  But the holiday spirits are restless and eager for company this night, as the haunting strains of melodies old and new call forth from the shadows.âHere are the tracks:1. Christmas Overture2. Dance Of The Sugar Plum Fairy3. Carol Of The Bells4. Night Of The Krampus5. Angels We Have Heard On High6. Greensleeves7. Up On The Housetop8. God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen9. Coventry Carol10. Little Helpers11. Sing We Now Of Christmas12. Winter Storm13. Into The Stillness14. The Parade Of The Tin Soldiers15. Everywhere, Everywhere, Christmas TonightBonus Track16. Christmas At MidnightI really like the songs Midnight Syndicate chose for this album.  They offer the greatest chance of putting a dark spin on them.  The opening track - Christmas Overture â sets the tone for the album.  It starts out very atmospheric, very magical sounding with harp, then turns dark with what sounds like an out-of-tune piano.  The track is very dark and haunting the rest of the way.  Out of the 16 songs on this album, 5 of them are totally original.  The other 11 are familiar classics but with a dark twist to them.  This album has the best version of Carol Of The Bells Iâve ever heard.  It walks the tightrope between cheery and creepy.  Wait until you hear Sing We Now Of Christmas â extremely well done and haunting.  Night Of The Krampus is destined to be a classic with its haunting choir, creepy piano and bells.  Winter Storm will make you visualize wind gusts spinning snow around and forming snow drifts.  I like what was done with Dance Of The Sugar Plum Fairy â very much their own dark and haunting twist with ghostly voices.One of the things I like about this album is that the pipe organ is used quite a bit, sounding very much like church music.  This gives the songs a haunting tone (Angels We Have Heard On High is just one example).  Choir voices are used to maximum haunting effect as well.  A wide variety of instruments are used throughout the album, which just makes the songs even better and more sophisticated.  Midnight Syndicate specializes in Halloween/gothic music, so it was only natural that somewhere along the way theyâd come out with a dark Christmas album.  This album delivers big time.  The overall feeling I get when listening to this album is of being alone in a huge mansion at Christmastime where things are on the creepy side and restless ghosts are haunting the halls and eager for company while dark and ghostly versions of Christmas tunes are playing, making me feel pretty creeped out.  Itâs a feeling of not being 100% comfortable in this mansion, but comfortable enough that Iâll stay for the creepy entertainment (because I like dark and creepy stuff to begin with).  Just look at the album cover.  I think youâll get what I mean.  I must add, though, that the last two tracks add some happy cheer to close out the album.If youâre looking for the traditional cheery Christmas album with Jingle Bells and Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer, look elsewhere.  If you want something different and on the darker side, yet still has a good helping of cheer, then give this album a listen.  Highly recommended.

This colorful action photo of Raiders great Ray Guy punting will make a great and vital addition to your collection of action photos.Congratulations to Ray Guy for being inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2014.  It's about bleeping time!  I watched this guy (no punt - I mean pun - intended) punt the ball into the stratosphere back in the 1970s and 1980s when he played for those great Raiders teams back then.  I remember back then thinking that he'll be a first ballot Hall of Famer.  He ended up being a 23rd ballot Hall of Famer, and that's only because the voters have had a long standing bias against pure punters getting into the Pro Football Hall of Fame.  In fact, he is the first and only pure punter in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.  For some strange reason, punters were not seen as vital to a football team's success and were ignored for Hall of Fame election up until 2014.  As Guy said during his induction speech, "The Pro Football Hall of Fame now has a complete team."  He's absolutely right.  Every possible position player had been recognized and represented in the Hall of Fame except punters.  I've been to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in Canton, Ohio five times and in those years that I was there..................no punters.  Completely absent.  Punters are a vital and crucial part of any football team.  They can make the difference between a team winning and losing.  It's all about field position.  When it comes to Guy, he had only three blocked punts in his entire career.  He was also the team's emergency quarterback and is a great multi-sport athlete in general.  He played in seven Pro Bowls.  He was part of three Super Bowl winning teams.  He was drafted by the Raiders in the first round in 1973.  That says it all.I recommend this photo.

The Sizzler: George Sisler, Baseball's Forgotten Great by Rick Huhn is really the first book to delve into the Hall of Fame career of St. Louis Browns great George Sisler.  Huhn sheds light on why George Sisler, as great as he was, is largely forgotten in this day and age while at the same time gives the Browns great his due, something that is looooonnnnnggg overdue.  Sisler, playing in the early years of the lively ball, had two seasons in which he hit over .400.  In 1920, he hit .407 and set a major league record for most hits in a season (then a 154-game season) with 257, a record that stood for 84 years until Ichiro Suzuki broke the record with 262 hits in 2004 in a 162-game season (Suzuki played in 161 of those games).  Sisler played all 154 games in 1920 and had 257 hits.  What's really amazing is that after Major League Baseball established a 162-game season in the early 1960s due to expansion, Sisler's hits record still stood for another 40+ years after that.  In 1922, Sisler hit .420, which is the third highest single season batting average of the 20th century, trailing only Nap Lajoie's .426 in 1901 and Rogers Hornsby's .424 in 1924.  Sisler's .340 lifetime batting average ranks among the best ever.  He sat out the 1923 season due to eye problems cause by a sinus infection, but came back in 1924 and, though he was never quite the same player again, still put up impressive numbers for the rest of his career.  Ty Cobb once described Sisler as "the nearest thing to a perfect ballplayer."  Why did Cobb say this?  It's because Sisler could do it all - hit, field, run, steal bases, even pitch.  He also had moderate power.  In 1922 he had a then-American League record 41-game hitting streak, which held up until Joe DiMaggio hit in 56 straight games in 1941.One reason why Sisler is largely forgotten is because he played most of his career for the St. Louis Browns, a team that were second class citizens to the other St. Louis team, the Cardinals.  His career lasted 15 years, shorter than a lot of legendary players, but not excessively short.  In those 15 seasons he accumulated an impressive 2,812 hits.  He had six seasons with 200 or more hits.  He led the league in stolen bases four times and swiped a total of 375 in his career.  He won two batting titles (1920 and 1922) and led the league in hits each of those years (257 and 246, respectively).Anybody who says George Sisler is overrated needs their head examined and doesn't know anything about baseball.

Batman: Season 3 contains every episode from the third and final season of Batman, which ran from 1966-1968.  This third season was definitely the weakest of the three seasons, no doubt.  The reasons?  Compared to the first two seasons (with the first half season which ran from January 1966 to April 1966 being the best season by far), the camp element was off the charts.  The scripts weren't as good.  The plots were barely there.  A lot of the episodes were flat out ridiculous.  The villains weren't as good.  There were too many Hollywood actors wanting to be villains on the show.  The sets weren't nearly as good, and a lot of them were downright cheap.  Most of the episodes were only single episodes that ran only a half hour long.  The show was on only one night a week compared to the first two seasons when it was on back-to-back nights.  Some of the episodes even had the whole '60s flower child element in them.  A lot of episodes had the actors poking fun at themselves and the show rather than playing it straight and serious.  Then there was Batgirl...................Wait.  Batgirl.  Barbara Gordon.  Played superbly by Yvonne Craig (RIP).  One of the definite highlights of the third season.  A huge plus for the show.  Barbara Gordon/Batgirl gave the third season a unique boost, a shot in the arm.  But it wasn't enough to save the show from cancellation.  However, for as many negatives as I have pointed out about this third season, it does stand out as being so different from the first season that it has its own unique identity and charm all its own.  I've always been a fan of the show's music by Nelson Riddle, and the third season's music is no exception.  I also like the Batgirl theme song.  Classic.  Some episodes - such as the Joker and Batman having a surfing competition - are episodes that are so bad that they're good.  Then there's Eartha Kitt as The Catwoman, who put her own unique spin on the character.  Her Catwoman was much more serious and evil than Julie Newmar's more seductive and playful Catwoman, probably because Batgirl was now on the show and the producers didn't want Catwoman being seductive towards Batman.If you want to watch the campiest of the three seasons and are out for just sheer entertainment and don't mind the camp element being in the stratosphere, then I recommend this third season.  If you want the best (in my opinion) season of the three, get the first half season.  The first half season and the third season make good bookends - one season that got everything just right and one season that has a totally different look and feel to it.

There have been many well written reviews of this great book already, so I just want to give a brief synopsis and a few thoughts...Exporting America: Why Corporate Greed Is Shipping American Jobs Overseas is really the definitive book on the topic of corporate downsizing, outsourcing, cheap foreign labor markets, and overall corporate greed.  Lou Dobbs, former CNN anchor of Lou Dobbs Tonight and current anchor of Lou Dobbs Tonight on the FOX News channel, delves deep into the roots of what is making U.S. corporations utilize cheap labor through outsourcing to foreign countries.  Also discussed in detail is the topic of illegal immigration and corporations capitalizing on this, plus many more relevant topics.  Dobbs has the ability to see the big picture, something that's increasingly rare these days among the populace.  I don't want to give away too much, so you'll have to read the book for yourself.As a side note, my view is that corporate executives in the U.S. owe the American people and American society in general for their own success.  They were born and bred in the U.S., yet they shamelessly turn their backs on the American worker and the country as a whole that provided them with the opportunities they have had to succeed both occupationally and financially.  Well, there's a narcissist born every minute, and that is what so many corporate executives are - narcissists.  They don't care about anybody or anything but themselves and they certainly lack even the slightest bit of patriotism.  With their piercing eyes that penetrate right through you, it's no surprise that they do the things that they do, like buying $6,000 shower curtains and gambling workers' pensions away at the craps tables.  Besides that, we live in an age where greed and self-centeredness is at an all-time high.  It's the Me Generation if there ever was one.  Everyone is out chasing the buck and many are lying and cheating their way to financial gain, and corporate executives are leading the way.We need more great Americans like Lou Dobbs.  He'd be a perfect presidential candidate, that's for sure.If you want to read the definitive book on outsourcing and corporate greed, then I highly recommend this extremely well written book by the great Lou Dobbs.

Raiders: The Complete History (2004) is a fantastic NFL Films history of the Oakland Raiders and Los Angeles Raiders.  You'll see all the classic old clips, much of it in slow motion, NFL Films style.  The music that accompanies the clips is vintage NFL Films, as is the narration.  This 2-DVD set also comes with an NFL Films version of the "Ghost To The Post" game - the 1977 AFC Playoff game vs. the Baltimore Colts, bonus features on John Madden, George Blanda, Lyle Alzado, the Holy Roller, The Immaculate Reception, "Sea of Hands" Game, The Heidi Game, The Raiderettes, Al Davis, rivalries such as with the Steelers, Chiefs, and Broncos, and more.  Throughout the two DVDs you'll see all the Raider greats in action as well as in interviews, such as Ken Stabler, Art Shell, Jim Plunkett, Ray Guy, Otis Sistrunk, Gene Upshaw, Marcus Allen, and many more.

...vampires aren't supposed to be portrayed the way they're portrayed in these Twilight movies.  Who wrote this stuff, anyway?If you want to see a REAL vampire movie, watch Salem's Lot (1979), Black Sunday (1960), Nosferatu (1922), Dracula (1931), Horror Of Dracula (1958), Dan Curtis' Dracula (1973), Count Dracula (1977), Dracula (1979), or Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992).  You'll see what a REAL vampire movie is and the way vampires are supposed to be portrayed, instead of how they're portrayed in these Mickey Mouse Twilight movies.Now go buy Salem's Lot and/or any of the other movies I mentioned.  You'll be glad you did.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some very quick thoughts on this movie...Changeling (2008) stars Angelina Jolie and John Malkovich.  This movie has great acting, passion, and great screen presence by Jolie.  Jolie gave a great Academy Award-winning performance in Girl Interrupted (1999), but she's equally as great in this movie.  This movie is based on a true story about police corruption and a woman's search for her missing son.  This movie is set in the 1920s.  That's all I want to say.  Watch to see how everything unfolds.If you want to see a good Angelina Jolie movie and have an interest in the time period in which this movie took place, then I highly recommend it.

This plastic Brunswick Glow Viz-A-Ball is perfect for shooting spares, such as corner pins. This ball shows an image of the Grim Reaper, which is embedded beneath the surface of the ball. The ball glows in the dark when in an environment that has black light, such as cosmic bowling.To add a little fright to your bowling night, get this eye catching ball.

This fan-forced heater is good for any time you want to warm an individual room.  It has an adjustable thermostat (1,500 W), three heat settings, overheat protection (the heater will shut off automatically if it gets too hot), and a carrying handle.Recommended.

Use this see-saw to carry around a bowling ball whenever you need to carry it around without your bowling bag.  It also serves as a sort of ball cleaner.  Whenever I don't feel like lugging around my 3-ball bowling bag on wheels and just want to go open bowling using one ball, I carry the ball in a see-saw and my shoes and towel are in a plastic grocery bag.Highly recommended.

For anybody who has been to the Pro Football Hall Of Fame in Canton, Ohio, this DVD set will just enhance the experience of having visited the Hall.  Myself, I've been there five times (1994, 1995, 1998, 2006, and 2010) and it really doesn't get old at all.  The Hall keeps expanding and adding new players, new exhibits, etc.  This DVD set profiles the 229 Hall Of Fame inductees and shows a little bit of old footage of their playing days.  This isn't a perfect DVD set (thus the 4 star rating), but it isn't bad, either.  More old footage could have been shown, but overall it's a solid program that I recommend.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this Disney flick...Maleficent (2014) stars Angelina Jolie in the lead role.  I'm not much into Disney flicks or Disney anything (in fact, the only Disney movie I own on DVD is the 1983 horror movie Something Wicked This Way Comes), but I rented this out of curiosity and because I've read the reviews.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this movie.  The movie is loaded with CGI, which I expect to see in a 2014 Disney movie.  The CGI looks fake as usual, as it does in 95% of movies that contain it, but the CGI is more tolerable in a Disney movie versus other types of movies.  That's because Disney movies are mainly for kids and they usually have that classic Disney children's charm to them and the CGI just accentuates it.  Angelina Jolie was perfectly cast in this movie.  She does a good job.  The supporting cast seems good as well (I'm watching the movie right now as I'm typing this review).  I like the dark atmosphere throughout the movie as well.  The lighting, the shadows...it's all done right.  Overall, a good movie that I recommend seeing.

For a full description of the plot, etc., read other reviews.  Just some quick thoughts on this movie...The Wolf Of Wall Street (2013) stars Leonardo DiCaprio and is directed by Martin Scorsese.  I rented this movie not knowing too much about it and about halfway through the movie I thought, "This movie seems so much in the same style as movies such as Goodfellas and Casino."  Sure enough, when the credits rolled at the end of the movie, it showed Martin Scorsese as the director.  This movie is vintage Martin Scorsese.  The movie is predictable.  I mean VERY predictable.  Along the way, there is endless cussing, nudity, sex, drug use, etc. - just like the two above mentioned movies.  This is one of those movies where the central character strikes it rich, then begins a predictable downward spiral.  His life spins out of control, he gets into drugs, he's a party animal, his drug use escalates, he has marital problems, he loses tons of money in various ways, he wrecks a car or two, he gets busted by the feds, goes to prison...basically he ruins his life.  Another movie that falls into this category is Blow (2001) with Johnny Depp.  Many scenes in The Wolf Of Wall Street are shocking and high impact, which is typical of Martin Scorsese movies.  Leonardo DiCaprio's acting is outstanding.  There is no doubt that a lot of the scenes in the movie were greatly exaggerated, which require the viewer to suspend disbelief.  However, knowing that some of the stuff that's in this movie actually does happen on Wall Street is an eye opener and truly shocking when you see it onscreen.  Overall, this is a movie that I highly recommend seeing.

Just some quick thoughts on this Christmas classic...It has been 25 years since National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation was released in theaters, so I thought I'd finally write a quick review of it.  I saw this movie in the theater when it came out.  This is my favorite of all the National Lampoon's Vacation movies, even better than the first one called National Lampoon's Vacation (1983).  This movie is the funniest of all the Vacation movies, in my opinion.  So many scenes are hilarious, I can't even count them all.  Lots of memorable lines as well.  Randy Quaid is back as Eddie and he steals the show.  Chevy Chase as Clark is in top form.  The entire cast is perfect.If you want to see a Christmas classic, then see this movie.  Highly recommended.

If you want to watch a documentary that gives a logical, fascinating theory and explanation about what happened to President Kennedy in 1963, then watch this documentary.  If you already have a lot of interest and knowledge about this event and you're a logical-thinking, reasonable person, after watching this you will probably connect all the dots in a logical, reasonable way and realize that the Kennedy "assassination" was an accident.  It was also a conspiracy, but a different kind of conspiracy other than the countless conspiracy theories that are out there, such as the CIA, LBJ, Nixon, Castro, the Russians, the Mafia, etc., etc., etc.  The conspiracy was after the fact, rather than pre-planned.  Why did the Secret Service and FBI act the way they did after the shooting, at Parkland Hospital in Dallas, at Bethesda Naval Hospital in Maryland, etc.?  I don't want to give away too much.  Watch the documentary to see for yourself.Now, of course, there are still a lot of unanswered questions out there that have been lingering for decades, and I don't blame anyone for still questioning a lot of things (I still do myself).  But if you approach this documentary with an open mind, you might be swayed.  At the very least, it will open your eyes and realize that this event might have been an accident with a massive coverup after the fact in order to protect the reputation of the Secret Service.  How many shots did Oswald fire according to this documentary?  Watch to find out.It is very possible that Oswald's second shot (the shot known infamously as The Magic Bullet) would not have been fatal.  It is very possible that Kennedy could have survived that wound.  I've always believed in the single bullet theory.  I've always believed that one bullet could cause seven wounds.  It has even been proven in several experiments on documentaries I've watched.  But what I've always questioned FOREVER is the head shot.  Why did the head explode the way it did?  It's so obvious that the head shot came from a different type of gun, a bullet that was designed to explode on impact.  A bullet from Oswald's rifle could not have caused such an explosion and massive injury.So, if this documentary's theory about how Kennedy was killed turns out to be actually true (and I believe that it is), then the history books need to be re-written and amended.  The history book have always said the following:John F. Kennedy's cause of death was by assassination.The history books would have to be amended to say:John F. Kennedy's cause of death was by friendly fire from a Secret Service agent who was responding to an assassination attempt by an individual who was later captured and identified as Lee Harvey Oswald.Thus, that would mean that the last U.S. President to be officially assassinated by definition and beyond any doubt was William McKinley in 1901.

It was bound to happen: Write a text file with field names to insert country names and activities and make a million by publishing a series of travel guides to {insert country names}. The most hilarious part of this book on Norway is the reference to "lush palm trees" lining the lakes and the great opportunities for "dolphin watching". This particular individual (whose first language is neither English nor Norwegian, judging by the peculiar grammatical syntax) has written dozens of equally uninformative travel guides to many of the world's vacation destinations under different pseudonyms, each available for less than $5.00 and containing less than 2 cents of information each. A great example of the limits of technology and the downside of the e-reader experience: Anyone with a computer and Internet access can be an expert on anything, and he or she can become a "published" author within a couple of hours just by being a reasonably competent typist. Let's hope Amazon recognizes at some point that there needs to be some editorial oversight of its e-book offerings, if only to make sure that what is being sold falls within a reasonable person's definition of a "book".

I am learning Norwegian because I will be moving to Norway in the future. I have every introductory self-study audio and/or book-based course available for Norwegian (including some only available from Norway). Pimsleur is by far the best way I have found to start learning a new language. I was amazed at how fast I progressed in learning a basic vocabulary. Most importantly, Pimsleur is unquestionably the best self-study method of mastering pronounciation. Expensive, yes. Indispensable, yes. Supplement the course with a good grammar text (like Janus') and you will get a fun, fast start to learning the basics of speaking and understanding the world's most important language.

DO NOT BUY. This item is not readable on the Kindle. The print is too small and can't be adjusted. In addition, it appears only in landscape mode. Finally, there is a large blank space on the middle of each page in which the text does not appear.

I'm pretty sure at this point, this is one of my favorite series at the moment. It is just so much fun. It is full of magic and fantasy, and unique edges to its story arc. I've read nothing like this by anyone else and I am pretty sure that is what makes it appealing to me. I don't need things to be 'real' to enjoy them. I loved the female narrator, but the male voice was just too old to pull off a 16-year-oldâ boy and it was sort of annoying thinking of him doing commercial voice-overs (which I'm pretty sure he has). I started to use audios books since I've had to drive to a thousand doctors appointments and have a desk job again part-time.I can read, even when I can't really read.But that cliffhanger...

Everything about this series really did it for me! I found myself laughing, crying, and cheering all through the course of these books. They were perfect and all the characters were relatable and made me want to hug and strangle them! What a brilliant read by the always great Mina Carter. Well written, engaging, and everything a reader wants in a werewolf book.

I'm kinda in love with this series. To the point that I REALLY hope the author continues telling the other characters HEA. She's set up a fantastic arc to create great conflict for future books! How is it possible for her to do paranormal AND sci fi well!!!

I literally read this whole series in a day! I love that the men actually act like men! I'm so sick of dudes that have the emotional range of a female on her period. Seriously, google it dudes talk and think dirty when they ain't around you--fact! Second, the wolf mythology in this is original and engaging.
