We didn't jump into the intimacy too fact even if they were introduced as a gated pair right out of the gate. I appreciate how well the story ebbs and flowed and all the smexy moments are natural. I LOVE this series! Well written, the story arc is natural and flows, and I can't wait for the next story arc for these characters!

This installment was one heck of a roller coaster. It has equal parts intimate moments with action and drama. I have to admit that I love when the hero is brought to his knees and shocked into admitting his love. Look what happened when he acted all stubborn and 'upset' I'm glad he still had people to follow her. And boy oh boy, look out Davie, the wolves are coming for you...

I wasn't too keen on this authors other shifter book. It was oddly built so you were jarred out of the story constantly. This story would've gotten more stars, but the mistakes and syntax in this story were kinda a mess. I can excuse a lot of things but just because your indie published doesn't mean your exempt from hiring an editor. I have a list of very well priced editors that do a very good job so there is no excuse for the mistakes in this book. The story does have a HEA and a very unique storyline and mythology with shifters, unfortunately the lazy editing makes this a three star for me. It's a shame it could've been a five.

But the author pulled it through for me. When the story first starts we have a unlikable lead female that makes you hope nothing good happens to her. She's selfish and whiny. Well, enter our hunky step brother and he literally makes her a better person. When she's forced to work for him, she becomes responsible and hard working. What starts as her trying to manipulate him turns into a romance that blooms and you really connect with. This was my favorite so far by Olivia.

I'm not sure if this book had an editor, or the author even read it over again. The thing that seemed to set off the chain of events was Georgia's period. But magically the next day, actually like three days later the period was... Gone? The plot inconsistencies for a short was very jarring and had me pulled out of the story so many times I was never able to connect with anyone in the story. The ending was disappointing and made no sense. As a whole it was a fantastically original idea that fell short due to poor execution.

Now, this is what I can't figure out. Did Grey really not know? Or did he set this whole thing up? Because clinics don't just make mistakes like that. I was so sure they were going to conceive the natural way, but boy oh boy is Grey a sneaky one. I'm slightly on the fence with this one, but it's a good concept.

This was really really good! After not being totally happy with the last two series I read this one brought it back home for me. I totally connected to Katie because I went through that journey with people very similar to Tom because I had no basis for comparison. I want to continue this series so bad! It's brilliant and well paced.

I gotta admit, the dragging on of the whole Cole secret is a bit much. By my calculations we are 184 pages into the series and by novel standards that would've pitted the major plot points by now. I do like how it's evolving, I don't like how much Cole lies and I think he needs to dump those other women out of his life. If I was Avery I would up and leave, I get she's stuck but I wouldn't tolerate Kalia and Lucy.

You can't just let me have it, can you Ms. Hawk? You can't just let them have the moment and let them get away clean... Oh no, you gotta bring in dirty cops and Gordon... Creepy Gordon needs to be sent to jail and seem him get a nice taste of his own medicine. Yep. That would be really really nice to see.

Egad! I swear this series has left me a total junkie! You know I don't really care that this is a short serial series, j actually like that better then I get some actual down time and I can gather up some books read. What well written smexy series. And she actually writes the male point of view right! Thank the book gods!

This story needed some work. The pacing was horribly choppy and it seemed like it was written by a teenager, or someone who normally reads young adult and wanted something sexy but was too afraid to write sexy. All the intimacies felt forced and a touch too robotic. There is a good story here, the author just needs to let it go when she's writing this genre and focus more on character building. I will try a few more of this authors work.

Mina Carter very rarely disappoints me. She just has a knack for telling stories in a very small amount of word count. This story was no different. We got to feel and connect with the characters very quickly and then we got to see the hotness. This one was bold and left me wanting to cry because, well, they are doomed to different cities and now I'm sad :-(The only thing I may suggest is the book isn't bbw. It was actually drilled into us that the lead was lithe, small, and petite. Those are not bbw qualities (I may be graceful when I dance but I ain't lithe)It is a good installment in the mistress of the city series, I would like to See Nick get his girl though.

I know it is totally unbelievable that people would lack that much communication. But at this point I don't really care. I'm on the ride, and it's like a really good daytime soap or even a really good lifetime show. I fell like pieces of this might be taking something from 50 shades, but I like Avery. I like how she's innocent but not stupid she kinda weighs out her opens. I'm sorry but if Cole was being all cryptic with me, I'd go hunting for info, even if Jeffery is skeezy.

Now I'm not going to sleep reading this series. I mean seriously, I LOVE an alpha male who acts like he doesn't want it, but does. I have a feeling I'm gonna want to kill Kalia, and why the heck is everyone after poor Avery. She's honestly a nice person given just bad circumstances. I also think it's time for Avery to leave Cole, would serve him right to have to beg for it a-little.

Now this is an original shifter series! Seriously, from page one I was gripped and I got stuff to do around the house. The whole story has fantastic characters that pop from the page, and a unique storyline that keeps you guessing from page one. Kinsey has a talent for jumping right into play and instantly getting you wrapped up into the characters. I love and hate Elijah with a passion but he is written so perfectly as a male. And he literally thinks like a proper man! It reads like a man is writing a man not like a woman is trying too hard to write a man. Kudos for that because all the dirty make talk read so smooth and I smirked constantly because I love a proper stubborn man. And boy is he alpha. I already went and bought the omnibus set because like heck am I going to not read the rest of this series!

Don't get me wrong the intimate moments were very steaming in this story, but I felt like the male dialogue and personalities were a bit forced. You can't force that you have to naturally just act male and it flows out in the pages of the book. But I felt it read more like a woman writing a man rather than a stable character development. I like my bear shifters really rough and this got lost in the story somehow. It wasn't holy or original either, quite a few people have used this plot point to get their characters together. As a whole I was disappointed. I also didn't like how it kept being brought up the girls were bbw, I only need it said once and I got it. I just wasn't feeling this story.

So this installment made me thrilled. It went deeper into Mina's werewolf mythology and I love how she is shaping and forming this world while still keeping it intimate. Archer is fun and I adore a well written alpha male. Reena makes me giggle and I like how she can be tongue and cheek even in a dire situation to just make it light while working on a solution. I'm moving onto the next installment--I'm kinda in love!

Holy hotness! I was not expecting this little short story at all. I tend to love a good alpha female, and I had a feeling that Mina wouldn't do me wrong on this one. I was right. I also know something mysterious is going on with Archer aside from him just getting some Lycan in him. I love how he just strolled in and took what he wanted. That is how an alpha male should always be.

I'm on a roll with catching up on these yummy shorts by Mina. What strikes me most is that the manages to pack in a little bit of everything into the stories. You have the characters, storyline, and the hot romance! They are literally the perfect weekend reads while sitting by the pool--which I am at the moment :-) I can't wait to know more and see more of the wolves cross over in the stories with one another.

This series started out so good! I love when Mina writes the aloof alpha who acts like he doesn't care but really does. But I see our girl in this series being strong, yet fragile... I don't want him to hurt her and I know that it's going to happen somehow :-( great start and another great shorter read from Mina! Keep'em coming!

So. I read this off a whim after I started to watch the show. It ended in a way where I had to find out the secret. So, with the book being part of my kindle unlimited I went for it. I'm so very glad that I did because this goes down as one of my favorite books. It is honestly pure, original genius and it made my jaw literally drop. I am not only pleased with the amazing storytelling but also how well the show runners have adapted it. I mean it's not verbatim but it's also not so far gone from one another that they are different creatures. I am happy to say that I will be reading book two ASAP and I can't wait to see what other crazy twists Blake has in store for me as a reader!

Okay. I'm a sucker for good sci-fi. I like it over the top, full of action, and with hot romance. Mina has managed to totally deliver on this series. I have to say I think her sci-fi is better than her shifter, and I really like her shifters! But something about this story makes me hot, cry, and laugh. I want to know about each woman that's been featured getting her man! But I do love a good hunky alien! High recommend! Drop in and go for it!

This was a detailed well written world of the fae. With an entirely new spin on the fae mythology. The author manages to spin computer tech with a epic fantasy environment that is commendable. Highly recommend this fast paced action adventure!

I follow and am friends with Burt on facebook. I've read his books before and they sit on the erotica end of the book spectrum. I wasn't sure what was getting into which this book when I started it. It was a big harsh right off the bat but I was oddly titillated lol. So I kept on going. And i have to say for a quick read this was totally hot and I loved every second of it. I think I have this thing for naughty cops though. If I'm being honest every naughty cop book I've read I've ended up kinda loving. It is so strange because I'm also afraid and hate cops because they used to harass my friends and I because we were the 'goth kids' in town. Maybe its some odd subconcious dominant thing, who knows but all I know is that this was a hot one, I read it twice, I might read it again and boy did I like Dalton! I kinda want more Dalton. Can we have more Dalton... please Burt?

I'm so totally speechless that I had to wait a few days before I actually sat down to do this review. It is so hard to do reviews for book I loved. Everything about this just worked. I kinda loved how the men were stupid but thought the chicks were dumb so they totally underestimated Liv. Now, here is the deal. Liv is immune to the island. Which means that its influence and its 'magic water' doesn't work on her at all like it does the other women that come to the island. Roen came through for me as a strong, yet still Alpha. He respected Liv, but at the same time he was so bent on keeping her safe he didn't stop to think that she could do that all on her own and his way of keeping her safe actually endangered her.The pacing on this book was must faster than the first. The first built the world and boy were you in it, now that the stage was set the book hit the ground running and didn't stop. I loved how Liv was the one to unravel EVERYTHING! But that ENDING! ZOMG! I'm STILL thinking about that ending two days later! I don't know if I want to hate or love Shane. I don't know if he wants her as a mate or if he just wants what he knows isn't really his anyways. But when we were in his head for that very brief amount of time I didn't get hostility from him, I got something totally different he way I hated him the whole two books and I was like WHAT THE---?Now, who the heck is in the tank? I think I know how is in the tank but it is a Mimi book so I could be totally wrong!As a warning this book does end on a HUGE cliffhanger and the last book isn't out until November. So on that note if you are the whiny type, wait for them all to be out.

Oh what a tangled web Mrs. Pamfiloff weaves! And here I didn't think it could get anymore twisted than King's story and I was oh so totally wrong. I seriously went into this book like a giddy school kid. I didn't know what I was going to get and what mytho was going to tossed at me and I found that my jaw was on the floor 90% of the time. Roen I liked straight away. I have a habit of liking the broken man, and he's totally not broken in the wrong way, and he quickly does a 180 when he sets his eyes on Liv. I adore Liv! I appreciated her strength, her stubborness and her ability to love Roen unconditionally even if she believed he'd gone all wrong. This is a shorter story than the King books but it packs this crazy punch that your left thinking about it days, possibly WEEKS later. I can honestly say that I had a huge book hangover after this book and I read it in about 3-4 hours. I devoured it because just when you thought it was getting slow it slapped you across the face to wake you up!I want to know what the author's writing process is, because she honest took a fantastic legend and really molded it to flow and eb perfectly. I wasn't confused I was dying for more and she trickled it out and you were left sucking in air and having everyone in the room look at you like you are out of your ever loving mind!If you love mermaids, obscured legends, and something different in your reading library, dive into this one!And since everyone has to be baby walked into books these days, yes there is cliffhanger, but yes book two is out already.

Oui Maks. I didn't think I would enjoy him as much as I did. He seemed like the easiest of the three brother's and I thought for sure that I would be able to handle him without tears... HA! Yeah right, I totally forgot I was reading a Kresley Cole book. Notorious for making me sob like a baby in EVERY immortals after dark book. Not one left me not screaming, crying, and kicking things in frustration!In this installment of the Game Maker series, we get to dive head first into Maksim, brother to Aleks aka Roman. Roman was one heck of a challenge and I didn't know how I could possibly get more frustrated with a man. Well, then you enter someone that is very arrogant and instead of just making it easy on everyone and saying, "Hey I like you, let's see how this works." Maks has to go the long way round. Which I believe actually helped Cat to fall in love with him all the more because she was under the impression it was based on one thing, when in fact we know Maks knew pretty much most of the truth the whole time, atleast that she wasn't really an escort lol.Krelsey Cole is the master of the Alpha male, I read one of her books and then I go to another and the men all pale in comparison and I'm left disappointed and thinking about rereading the IAD series because I know I'll get some hella barbarians in that series. Oh the demon men....Oh, wait, Russian Mobsters, right.So, I know we are all in for it with Dimitri's book. He seems like he got the worst of them all and is the most bitter. I'm just not sure what woman you could toss at him where he wouldn't just totally break her, he seems pretty--well--scary.*I read a copy via Los Angeles County Library Overdrive System*

You know, I have to admit, I'm not a huge fan of the MC genre. Most either seem over the top, too far fetched, or the cheating element in them puts me off. At a certain point of the book the couple should be beyond getting head from 'club whores'. I was at first reluctant to read Jenika's MC series, but so many people seemed a fan, and you know, Jenika was my first step brother read, she was my first 'fighter' series read and she made me enjoy all the books I read when other authors left me feeling annoyed and slightly ragey.So, I was gifted a copy for an honest review. Let me tell ya, I LOVED this book. It wasn't just that she mixed two genres and pulled it off. It was that she told a great story with intense plot devices and characters that really came to life for me that I could honestly relate to. I mean I was never kidnapped by an evil MC, but I was able to put myself in the heroines shoes and feel her journey very intensely. I felt that her responses were honest, and it did take quite a bit for both H/h to give onto what they felt for one another, but that made it all the more real for me.She even had an evil female in it, and I hate to be 'anti-feminist', but I love when there is an evil chick for me to rage at and hope to god she is taken down. As a whole the story had a great flow, the characters popped out of the pages, and the smexy was very steamy! I will be continuing this series!*I received a copy via the author in exchange for an honest review*

So, I have taken it upon myself to read all the books that my daughter is reading. Not just to content check, but to make sure she's reading it for AR lol.Anyways, I found this story really dry, even for a children's book. Not just that but the book was littered with grammar errors, poor sentences, and very stilted dialogue. I could've written more realistic dialogue from Anna and Elsa, any parent who has seen the movie a gazillion times with their kids could write Anna and Elsa better than this book. I know that I'm being a bit mean, but if you are a big five pub and you're going to agree to take on a Frozen chapter book series you better buck up and do it justice.I found that it took until over halfway through the book for the story to really kinda be 'fun'. My daughter even struggled through this and fought me on reading it saying , "This is really boring mom, can I just read something else." I told her it gets better, and she seems to agree once Elsa started using her powers. That is another thing. They almost make her powers seem like a bad thing while trying to 'tell their lesson' I thought the whole point of Frozen was a whole "Baby, I was born this way." deal. I'm not sure how Random House got the rights to write this, I honestly believe if this would've stayed in the hands of Disney Hyperion they would've found someone better to take on this series. I made the mistake of buying book two for my daughter. I think we will be going back to the Equestria Girl's books and NeverGirls.In summary: Disappointing, stilted, poor grammar that shouldn't be allowed in children's books, and a contradictory 'life lesson' makes this children's series a miss for me. I wouldn't recommend it to fans of Frozen.*I purchased a copy via my local Barnes and Noble*

I have to give this book five stars! First off it was written by a 14 year old, for 14 year olds! It was entirely colorful, adorable, playful, and age appropriate. It is not often you get books that actual 14 years olds should be reading in the young adult genre.If I am being honest, Belle has a writer talent. She was born to weave clever stories about ancient gods being reborn. She brought the characters to life so well, and there were no plot holes! It was refreshing, clever,and fun to read. I instantly bought a copy for my daughters kindle and will be buying a copy for her school! I can't wait for the second book!!!!!*I borrowed a copy from the Kindle Unlimited Program*Originally read on release date, amazon deleted my review

So, I didn't expect to read this, but while cruising my netgalley I came across this SilkWords publisher. Well, they publish choose your own adventures, romance editions! I'm like WHAT! Yep. So the first one I grab is this awesome little story that has some greek mytho, and it is lesbian theme romance. It was fun getting to choose which journey my character went on. I could've picked two totally different options and I can even go back and mix them around. On the website it seems like I can read what I want but I don't know if its just a free trial deal because it looks like there is a subscription fee involved. But the website is allowing me to read what I want. I think 2.99 is a deal for these because I get more than one story in one book.I loved this one, it was sexy, intriguing, and had all the elements I loved most in a book.*I read this via SilkWords website.

This is a tough one for me to review, because as a whole, the story was very good. However, the technical aspect of the story jarred me and pulled me out enough where I was left feeling lack luster about the whole thing.I want to note that I didn't read book one, but I did go download it so at first I was lost on the themes of this story. Once I realized it was a book two I had to read it as if I had read book one.As a whole, this story has the vast potential of being GREAT! Literally, for a theme that could be easily labeled dark romance it could dominant the genre. I'm not a huge fan on dark romance. Mostly because I take issue with glamorizing human trafficking. On the other hand, when you tell a story properly, it can work. This has all the markings of a story that could work.My likes:It was unique. In a world full of over saturated ideas and nonsense, this plot had me really wanting to know how it would end. It has meat, it is just lacking a proper execution. The characters worked. Albeit written very lack luster and in a grey tone, it was very hard for me to connect with anyone until the last few chapters of the book. It was as if the author found her rhythm and started to fly. But at the end of the day, a book is about its characters. Those need to outshine even a good storyline in order for a book to wow the reader.My issues:Now I normally don't review books this way but I wanted to be honest and not a totally a-hole, and if the author happens to read this I don't want her to curl up in a ball and cry. Trust me I know how that feels and I see the potential this author has. If she takes anything away from this review I want it to help not discourage.First off, the dialogue tags are a mess. I didn't know who was talking half the time. Someone would say something, and then someone else would feel the emotion. I had to reread the dialogue quite often until I could lock down who was saying what, and who was feeling what emotions. With the poor dialogue tags came stilted unrealistic dialogue. The words felt unemotional and robotic. Remember when people are talking you can talk in slang. It's okay. Contractions are a good thing in dialogue!Second, the editing was a mess. I'm not sure if this was a draft before edits or not, but I really struggled with how things were ordered and placed in paragraphs. It didn't have good transitions and it didn't flow from one scene to the next how it needed to. The BDSM needed some work. As someone in the lifestyle I appreciated how accurate the author was, while trying to put a darker spin on it. My brain had to shut off at the idea of a clue that didn't allow safe words and if you used them you got kicked out for life. Once I swallowed down my judgments, as a masochist, I kinda wanted to know where The Black Door was lolThird, my advice? Which I normally don't slot into reviews, but like I said I NEED this author to be great! She has so much untapped potential that I was screaming at the book in my head! Find critique partners that are NOT your friends, and that will be very honest with you. Sometimes it will hurt, and you are going to pout and stomp your feet, but at the end of the day, it will help your writing. I would also suggest a proofreader that is not the current editor. As many set of eyes you can get you your work the better.As a whole, like I said the story was good. I struggled with the characters because they weren't giving me enough to care. That opening scene was such a punch in the gut and then it sort of just went frozen on me until the ending build up. I found myself enjoying the secondary characters more than the two main protagonists.I will read The Red Door and I will read the next book in the series because now I gotta know if they catch the "Auctioneer" duh! I just hope that a little more time is spent in the revision process because I want these books to be GREAT! You can write a full length book in 14 days, but it takes an army to revise that sucker!*I received a copy via The Book Enthusiast Promotions*

This was my second audio book. I realized its really handy to listen to an audio book while I do busy work like graphics, blogging, and all that other stuff since I can't actually read. The Selection has been on my list for ages. Finally, on a lazy weekend I started it knowing my daughter could listen to it with me. This was a different dystopian type tale. I mean it has its moments of harsh reality like all of them do, and its a bit odd that they have to go through this whole Selection process. Think Hunger Games meets The Bachelor because the dates and how they talk is SOOOO like the Bachelor but the whole rating system and when they got cleaned up for the Prince. I have to admit I'm not favoring Maxon. He had these incredible moments of sweetness that made me go awwwwww. Then he was all mean about the Celeste thing. I mean yeah, he explains that its because he's got pressure later. But then he's whining that he's sick of being told what to do. But dude. America told you she's a a-hole, she's an a-hole. I guess it's cheaper to keeper. Oh, and it will lead to more drama in the books lol. I don't believe he kissed the one chick on the roof. I think that's a lie. It seemed out of character for him based on his kiss with America.At the moment I'm digging Aspen. Don't like the name so much but he's willing to fight. I wonder if Maxon knew he had competition if he would be as aggressive. At times America got on my nerves but I think that was more the way the narrator played her. She seemed to keep America very monotone and the rest of the characters when they would speak seemed to have more color. I'm starting to notice that narrators make or break a books when you listen. The book ended on a slight cliffhanger type ending with Aspen laying down the game, Maxon being a little bit passive, and America willing to give it a shot with him. Personally, I don't think she's gonna cope well because I think Celeste is going to be around until the end and I don't know if I can cope with that. If she is I might have to stop reading lolAnyways, this was a very sweet, fluffy easy young adult story and I will be continuing.*I listened to a copy via Scribd*

This was a tough one for me. This book had me feeling bipolar in some ways. It had these really great moments where I felt the author would redeem the female lead for me, and then he would go back down into this pit of unlikablity. Hannah wasn't a character I would call strong. I guess with the way the author wrote her, he pulled if off if that was his goal. She was weak-minded, superficial, selfish, and really mean. But I also felt that every female character in this book was laid out to be this way. I couldn't figure out if this was the way the author wanted this 'town' to be, but based on Hannah's introspect, the author seemed to make a generalization of how girls are in high school. It is laid out that every teenage girl wants to be popular, blonde, worshiped, and adored. This guy has obviously never met the comic book|fangirl|nerd chick (That was me.) I didn't care about popular, actually I related to Lukas if I am being honest. I live my life in origin stories, revenge stories, or redemption stories aka comic book story arcs. But I'm not sure if this author was venting a personal hatred towards high school girls in general, or if he was writing a cautionary tale. I honestly was thinking one way, then Hannah's action would have me going towards the other story arc option. Not to mention the author built TOO much tension. He waited until the last 2 1/2 chapters for anything amazing to happen. I was waiting and waiting for zombie action, how this was going to take place, and I was WAITING. When you spend too much time in a characters head who is unlikable you tend to not care about the awesome gruesome action when you get there.I kept finding myself wanting more Lukas, then feeling bad when he came into the scenes because Hannah treated him like garbage. Then she realizes AT THE END he was a good person? I kinda wanted to toss her ot the flesh eating cheerleaders at that point. When I don't care if a cheerleader lives or dies that is a problem. It was written similar to old school Tales from the Crypt episodes because the leads in those were very rarely good people. You always were waiting for them to get their comeuppance. At the end of the day, I just wasn't totally feeling this story. I am not sure it was right for him to write in a female POV, I would have totally enjoyed the book if it was in Lukas's POV. The book gets two stars for him putting in what I like to call one of MY people into the story, and for the fact he isn't a bad writer, he just wrote in a female POV and it didn't work for me. I have to like the girl who's head I'm in. I see this as more of a 'boy book' he wouldn't mind it because I'm pretty sure teen boys think this of teen girls. But on the other hand with the rise of the comic book films no one has to face persecution for showing you like comics now--so this book might prove to date itself a bit.As a whole, I would recommend this book to the teenage boy crowd. I don't think females would find this book very flattering.*I purchased a copy of this book at the friends of the library bookstore*

Now THAT was fantastic young adult fiction! It is going to be very hard for me to write this review because I want to do that telling gush, but I want people to actually read the book, and most people don't read a book based on gush. They want facts, they want why, and they want to know really why they should read it other than ZOMG! It was soooo good!So here is the low down. The Duff was written by a teen, for a teen. She wrote this book when she was a senior in high school after hearing the term 'Duff'. When she thought to herself that she was the Duff with her hot friends around her, she realized her hot friends also thought they were the Duff. So in terms I can make you all understand, its a realistic book, about more realistic teens, that face self-esteem issues. Because lets face it, even the hot chicks think they are ugly on a bad day. Not only was that an endearing quality to the book, but Bianca is a very likable and relateable character. I was Bianca in high school. I just didn't give a crap! I thought relationships were silly, I thought love was fake with teens, and I looked at the hot dude like a walking STD. Which it turned out he was, and I called him out in the middle of science class about it, and it didn't seem to make him afraid of me it made him 'curious'. No I didn't even up with the hot guy, I ended up nearly beating him up at a party, but that is neither here nor there. The rises and falls of this book were perfect. It was paced so wonderfully that I never caught myself skimming (which does happen) I wanted every introspect, every word, and every struggle that the characters were going through. I loved have well Bianca and Wesley complimented one another. I liked how it was more of a joke to use the term whore, and when Bianca finally put it into perspective she just didn't feel that it was right to use at all. The hot girls were a-holes, and there was no token mean girl, they all just got along. Yes, there was a group, but they were mostly isolated to their own 'mean girl' world. That was very telling because it was that way in my high school. Yes they bullied, or tried, but when called out they backed off and went back to their own reality.Wesley. Well, he's not likable as a hero at first. So we have a bit of a redemption story in here. He was totally hilarious and his banter with Bianca was easy, quick-witted, and hysterical right from the start and you just knew that these two were built for one another. Bianca never allowing Wes to, well, be Wes. And Wes made Bianca feel beautiful. It was a match made in young adult book heaven and I loved all the good young adult reading qualities this book had!I wouldn't recommend this for younger young adult, more upper grade into college. There is a lot of sexual content, it wasn't shown but it was lead up to and implied. So I wouldn't let my daughter read it until I felt her maturity could handle it. I can also tell that the movie is going to be NOTHING like the book, they manufactured a 'mean girl' character "Madison" who is not in the books. Not sure why they needed that plot device when the plot devices in the book would've worked just fine for conflict.*I purchased this book at my local Barnes & Noble*

Le sigh...I went on this journey with these characters not really knowing what to expect. I'd never read this author before but I LOVED forced marriages. Call me old school with the whole bodice ripper mentality, but I love when a woman is picked and a dominant male insists on her accepting him. If that makes me a non-feminist then label away but I love me some barbaric manly chest pounding heroes. This is my cup of tea and I love how the author had a very effortless way of world building and bringing the story to a full arc. I'm a fan of the serial format because I'm a busy girl and I haven't got all day to sit and read most of the time, I get the weekends. This is one of my favorite serial series to date. I love how Tanya didn't give into the men, they were forced to work together for the sake of the women they loved, and for their race of people. It wasn't just a 'forced' situation. They all needed one another and sometimes stubborn people need to realize that they get along with someone that someone isn't an enemy just because your daddies didn't like one another. Zane seemed to get this but Brant had trouble and it took losing his woman to realize all this. This was a great story that had me laughing, crying, and falling totally in love with this author and her world!*I read a copy via Kindle Unlimited*

....This one made me so happy to start with. I was on top of a cloud and I was so into the book that I had no clue that the author was going to toss the inevitable trouble at the reader. Then I was feeling it. I knew that something was coming. Our boys Zane and Brant were acting off. Even during the ceremony they were being silly and they were trying to get Tanya to doubt--to reconsider. If I was here I would've looked at both of them then and been like, "Um... wtf!" But she was in the moment, getting married/mated, and I get it! Then WHAMO! I cried... I was so hurt for her and I wanted to snatch her up and allow her to cry in my arms because she was totally justified in being as upset as she was. They don't get it. Well, I think Zane does get it but he was wrapped up in the whole 'Being the last one standing thing' and, le sigh... I'm jumping right into the final book now, its really late but I need to know what's going on like NOW!*I read a copy via Kindle Unlimited*

Wow, what an awesome book!  Loved it thoroughly!  So glad Spoonflower published this book, the information inside makes it SO MUCH EASIER to prepare your designs for printing using their services!  LOTS of super cute inspiration projects too!  Really well written in a super friendly manner, this company seems like a real family and part of a very special community.

The cardstock used was very thin light weight paper, some of them had fold marks across the corners, packaging was bent out of shape.  If I bought this for a really serious project that I was putting very important photos into, I would have returned it.  The designs are nice and thankfully did not come loaded with the standard TC cliche design motifs like Fleur de lis and crowns etc. (just one card had a damask design on it).  I bought it for the color palette, soft neutral, peach, kraft.  Most of the sentiments are very brief which I liked, plenty of white space on at least half of the 3x4 cards for journaling.  Only perhaps 2 of the designs were duds.  There were 2 lazer cut designs, one with FAMILY and one with PHOTO cut out.  There are  2-3 acetate cards in 4x6 and 3x4 sizes that you can layer on top of the printed designs which worked out really pretty.  I've only ever bought these kinds of cards once before from the Project Life brand (when they first came out) and the cardstock they used was very sturdy, but the design was not so great.  I guess this is one of those things where its safer to look at it in the store before you buy!

We found one of these at Target, managed to snag the last one left during a run on fans during a massive heat wave.  Went back the next week to get any fan at all and the entire inventory of fans at all big box retailers was "SOLD OUT" within driving distance from my home.  We hadn't done any reviews on this fan, just bought it because it was the only one left, but it turned out to be a really great fan.  So we bought our second one here on Amazon and discovered how many other people love this fan based on the overwhelming number of positive reviews here.  I didn't really think it would add any value to provide one more review but thought I'd mention a few things.  Our first fan made a regular humming noise, the other one made a noise as if something was wobbling on the inside but this didn't seem to effect the performance at all, just made me wonder if something inside the outer box was loose.  We have tiny pets in the home and we feel very safe leaving the fan on the floor with them in the room and they love it.  So far no nasty dust has collected around the blades like they do on ceiling fans (have only had them for one month).  The cord is rather small, so you can only place it somewhere fairly close to an outlet unless you use an extension cord.  I do prefer this style compared to a "rotating" fan, and there are 4 settings for the amount of "air" that comes out of the fan.  I do WISH it had one more setting for a level of air that is more gentle than the lightest setting.  Even during our 100F heatwave, we could only use the most gentle setting, if that gives you a sense for whole powerful the settings are.  We don't have gigantic rooms, so perhaps if you have really huge rooms in your house you might like the settings that come with the fan.  We gave central air but it causes my arthritis to flare up so this has been a great way to stay cool.

I've owned better quality mesh bags, but these do the job and are not bad for the price.  So tired of the drum in my washer creating little holes in t-shirts, ruining new clothes after only a few washes!  Decided to get a whole batch of these to protect lingerie, and clothing made out of "finer" materials that will get ruined in your washer if you don't have a "delicate" cycle.  Not sure if I would buy this brand again if I find myself in need of more but they do protect your clothes from damage done by your washer.

They are soft and a great value.  They are not "seconds" that you would find in an outlet (ie. factory rejects) but not something I would lay out for guests in the bathroom either.  I bought these for the kitchen as a safer more eco-friendly way to keep things clean instead of using disposable paper towels and sponges.  Would buy again!

Best gadget in my kitchen!  I love this product, has its own little stand, bristles are just the right size for any size glass, coffee cup, tea cups, tea pots, etc.  Bristles are not rough so you can even use it on delicate China.  Just brilliant design.  Nice little pop of color.  Makes my life so much easier!

I bought this book because I just purchased the Accu-Quilt Orange Peel die (same shape but not size as those used in the quilts in this book) and was fascinated by the brief sneak peak posted here on Amazon in terms of the different variations of quilts that could be made with just this one applique shape and was not disappointed at all.  If I were only rating the book on design, I would have given it a 5 star rating however due to some serious problems with the book's tutorials and illustrations I had to mark it down to a 3 star rating. There are 8 quilts with 8 matching pillows, and I absolutely loved at least half the pillow designs and half the quilt designs.  While the applique shape is the same, they vary in size according to the pattern, however, all templates are provided full size in the book (digitized, not hand drawn).  I also love the fact that the pillows were "quilted" for the front and made to be used with standard size pillow forms and an "envelope" style backing (no zippers, button holes etc.)  I also thought the instructions for the "window fusible applique" method was very good.  I did have a few "issues" with the book that I felt could have been improved.  The first 30 pages discuss "quilt making" - if you've never made a quilt before, I don't think there is enough information in these 30 pages to teach you all the ins and outs of piecing, quilting and binding a quilt, you really need a separate book that just focuses on quilt making to learn all the essentials.  I think these pages could have been more wisely used to focus on one area that was almost completely ignored in the book yet very essential to the success of making these quilts - applique placement.  There are "no diagrams" for each of the quilts" that provide a "step by step" visual of how to place the applique pieces onto the quilt blocks, there is just one sentence which says the same thing for each quilt.  This applique shape is very unique as you need the points to meet up but you must applique them onto the block before the blocks are sewn together and I could see that even the samples in the book had some problems with getting the points of the "petals" to meet up properly.  The instructions that came with the Accu-Quilt orange peel die gave more advice on how to address this issue than this book did, so between the book and the instructions from my die, I had a better sense for applique placement.  Another important thing that was left out of the instructions was guidelines for "height and width" of the blanket stitch when machine appliqueing the petals to the quilt blocks per each petal size.  (By the way, "satin stitch" was not even mentioned as an applique stitch option in the book or the "invisible machine applique stitch" which would have really enriched the educational aspects of the book as this book does focus on applique specifically.)  The stitches have to meet up "perfectly at the point so you can pivot around the point just right, but the book only says that it might "take a couple tries" to get it just right (in other words, you must play around with your stitch settings until you get the width just right so it will pivot right at the points for each petal shape (that's ALOT of work!  I was interested in these designs because I thought they wouldn't be too labor intensive!). The other thing that bugged me was the "drop shadow" that was used by the graphic designer in illustrations where different prints are sewn together, which makes things look more confusing than they actually are.  Finally, it felt like the editor was very "heavy handed" in their editing of this book, which made it feel like very cliche/cookie cutter/boiler plate reading, more like a series of magazine articles, rather than having a narrative with an authentic voice from the author.  The book cross promotes other C&T books and Moda pre-cuts (product placement??) as well as name dropping for the Moda Bakeshop website. I have an enormous amount of respect for the author and have been aware of her work since her first fabric line came out and am very happy for her success in having this book published in her name.  But I think the publisher could have done a better job on the editorial side in the preparation of this book.

It is so difficult to find a dress pattern from a sewing store where you actually see the finished dress on a real model.  If I just see a graphic design of a pattern, I feel like I have so little to trust in terms of how well the pattern will turn out when you see the finished product.  Also, there are so many patterns in the sewing stores that are just pure duds, its really hard to find anything classy yet contemporary and thats where this book really shines.  I would love to make at least 75" of the dresses shown in the book.  This isn't one of those books where just the cover photo is adorable, they are all super awesome dress designs.  The premise behind the book is that every top can be mixed and matched with every skirt for up to 200 different combinations of dresses to make.  Just some things you should know.  I guess all standard sewing patterns are designed with the assumption that you have a "B" cup bra size, according to the author, so I think all her patterns are based off of that assumption as well.  Every pattern in the book comes in size 1-12 but they are not designed in particular for petite, tall, woman's sizes etc. (but there is a section in the book on how to lengthen/shorten, widen etc. your patterns as needed).  Also, the sizes are not marked on the patterns numerically.  None of the patterns are hand drawn, they all look digitized.  The pattern paper is very thick and sturdy, not the tissue paper kind, I would imagine you would want to trace your pattern size onto drafting paper for sewing.  The book assumes that you will take your own measurements, make adjustments to your pattern accordingly and then make a "muslin" or "voile" mock up first for a custom fit.  She recommends quilt fabric along with many other fabrics for dress making but I can't really recommend quilt fabric as it is 100% cotton and gets very wrinkly/difficult to iron (she even recommends washing and drying twice to insure full shrinkage of the fabric before sewing with it because cotton will shrink even more on the second wash).  I don't know where one goes to find dress maker fabrics anymore except if you are lucky enough to live in a very large city with a "garment district" like LA or New York.  I've never really felt confident making and wearing a hand made purse for any other purpose except to go to the farmers market or the library but these dresses are something I would actually feel proud to wear if my skills were as good as the seamstress who made all the garments for the book.  I get the sense that this was a collaborative effort with some expert advisers, seamstresses etc. involved.  I don't know if Tanya served as "art director" and the actual "hands on" work was done by others but whatever the case may be, the end results were outstanding.

I really liked the designs too.  The color palette is much more bright, the colors are more saturated then they appear in the photo here and on Prima's website.  Especially the pink and turquoise colors.  I'm not sure I would have been so gung ho to buy it if I had known that.....The only thing I was disappointed with is the fact that these papers come in a pad that is actually about 7x6" with about a 3/4-1" margin on top that you have to cut off with a paper trimmer or scissors.  If you have a storage system for 6x6 paper pads, this pad will not be 6" in height, only 6" in width, just FYI.  So while I was hoping the colors would have been softer and more toned down like they look online and I didn't like the way they made the papers with margins that have to be cut off, overall, I was happy to find this and add it to by stash of papers for card making.  The overall vibe of the designs is very retro 50's in style except the dark chocolate brown pages looked more modern/contemporary to me.  Definitely check out the Prima website to see the full collection, they have some really awesome coordinating products, especially their flower embellishments that have the most beautiful colors.  I only wish I could "see" them in person at a real store first because the price of buying all those accessories can really add up and I'd like to make sure they look as pretty in real life as they do online.

Loved it!  Has about six adjustable heights, built sturdy, but light weight, comes pre-assembled.  We use it as something to read large textbooks on and for the laptop.  Thought the grip on the bottom would be more substantial but it stays put on our glass top desk.  The power cord manager (small piece of rubber that I believe is supposed to slide onto the back rack or snap into some holes on the back panel didn't seem to work at all, but it was a minor issue for us.  Wish this was around a LONG TIME AGO!!!!!!!!

In "Attract Your Ideal Customer," author Mark Anthony Germanos offers a refreshing and new approach to social media marketing and actually getting to know your customers at a level beyond the impersonal data of demographic numbers. Germanos sets forth that specific targeting rather than the blanket approach to an age-group, a gender, or a group of a certain income or educational level not only yields superior results, but affords a personal touch that is more likely to attract new customers and retain old ones.Germanos boldly deconstructs the conventional approach to marketing by taking aim at what he calls the âpain point,â or the problem a business or company seeks to solve. His unflinching claim is that internet marketing is the countermeasure to the debilitating symptoms of the pain point, and he adeptly lends support to this claim in each chapter of this intriguing book.Numerous worksheets inserted throughout the book offer a practical application toward developing a greater understanding of this unique and groundbreaking system. This is one of the most innovative approaches that I've seen in a long time, and I am eager to test-drive some of these fascinating and well-grounded theories.

James Blackthorne ups the ante with another epic trilogy in "Meditations of Madness." Using a mix of pure imagination and settings that are loosely grounded in medieval history, Blackthorne loves to mix and match and move things around in his stories. While these tales contain his trademark fingerprint of action and magical allure, the humanity of the characters shine brilliantly through, posing the ultimate question of whether we can really ever know anyone deeplyâ¦even ourselves. As always, Blackthorne juggles lots of characters and sub-plots in his tales, but he manages to tie up all the loose threads in a satisfying manner by the end.

James Blackthorne delivers another tour de force in "Thunder at Dawn" which combines action, intricate story lines, and heartfelt characters that are a hallmark of his work. Blackthorne casts away the limits of his imagination by weaving a large and complex story of battles, magic, and immense settings that have seemingly limitless boundaries. Despite the expansive scope of this story, it is crafted in such a manner as to be easy to follow and hard to put down.

In "Tribute to a Trilogy" author James Blackthorne combines three powerful stories to create a thrilling mix of adventure and intrigue that is sure to appeal to fans of fantasy. Blackthorne does not shy away from a thicket of characters, subplots, and themes as he fearlessly hacks through them with machete-like ease. He gives his readers credit for their intelligence by not dumbing down his writing. His style is straightforward and introspective if, at times, a bit jerky. However, this small transgression can be easily forgiven for the captivating story lines and the compelling delivery that characterizes each of these three rich stories. Recommended.

This is a raw, compelling, and often disturbing peek into the turmoil and pain of a troubled young woman. The content is broken up into a collection of essays, poems, and short narratives that is reminiscent of Jack Kerouacâs stream of consciousness style. Unlike Kerouacâs free-spirited protagonists in his most famous novel, however, this young lady casts her imprisonment behind the walls of her own pain into the forefront. One gets the sense that much of her pain is self-inflicted through poor choices in men and through a basic lack of rational decision-making skills that often lead to poor choices, in general.Her talent as a writer is undeniable, but the book has many disturbing aspects that elicit both sympathy and exasperation for this young woman. One can only hope that she will recognize the forgiving nature of youth and the opportunity for second chances before her story culminates in the tragic ending to which she seems to have resigned herself.

In this first installment of the Market with Numbers series, authors Frank Bria and Mark Nogaki propose an entirely new approach to the way we look at marketing. Rather than devising a blanket campaign to a generic audience of "18 to 34-year-olds", Bria and Nogaki blow the lid off traditional demographics with the concept of breaking up an audience into smaller pieces so that each may be motivated by a different strategy or technique. In short, the authors boldly seek to deconstruct the conventional approach to marketing in an entirely new framework that offers a fresh way of thinking about gaining new customers and retaining existing ones.Using a system they call Market with Numbers, the authors present a multi-faceted strategy that enables you to make decisions based on specific facts and hard data rather than targeting a broad and largely undefined demographic segment. In other words, their system seeks to use marketing with the precision of a sniper rather than using the shotgun approach to an expansive age range. This is one of the most innovative and exciting approaches to marketing that I've seen in years, and I plan to recommend it to my colleagues.

This is a book for anyone who appreciates poetry, but it is especially for those of us who wonder how ANYONE can appreciate poetry. As one who was forced to memorize the sonnets of Shakespeare and the heroic couplets of Chaucer in college, I couldn't get away from those vile, torturous verses fast enough once Iâd served my sentence in a required English Lit class. It was, therefore, with my tongue planted firmly into my cheek that I opened the sample pages of a book called "Why Poetry Can Save the Planet."The writing was immediately welcoming and humorous rather than the stuffy and indecipherable babble that I usually associate with poetry. Author Joe Sottile writes warmly and with a sharp wit as he presents his case. He immediately states that this isn't a scholarly perspective on poetry and that he, too, was once among the "others" who just didn't "get" poetry. I was intrigued.What followed was an entertaining, intelligent, and well-written romp through Sottileâs evolution as a lover of poetry that is inspiring, cute, and just plain fun. It did not surprise me to discover that Mr. Sottile is a teacher as well as a writer. If he had been my teacher, perhaps I wouldn't have spent the past three decades hoping that poetry would suffer the same ride into oblivion as disco and Sea Monkeys.

Author Daryl Capuano takes a no-nonsense approach to parent participation in the academic success of their teenage boys. Drawing on his experience as the father of his own teen boy, and on his expertise as an academic consultant devoted to helping students achieve their potential, Capuano has devised a practical and groundbreaking plan geared specifically toward teenage boys.As the founder of a company called The Learning Consultants, which focuses on guiding students toward academic success, Capuano noted a disturbing trend with boys in the early 2000s. While it has always been the case that many teenage boys are easily distracted from academics by sports, buddies, girls, and social life, the ratio of calls from concerned parents in regard to their academically unmotivated child was a disproportionate 20 to 1, with boys tipping the heavy side of the scale. This prompted further research, and Capuano was both saddened and alarmed to discover what he believed was the beginning of an epidemic of male underachievement. Not only did he find that high school boys were largely lackadaisical, but the lethargy seemed to be following them onto college campuses. Perhaps the most disturbing statistic of all was his finding that at least one in three men between the ages of 22 and 34 are still living at home with parents!As the parent of my own teenage son, that astonishing statistic hit me like a ton of bricks. While I have no greater desire than for my son to be successful, I also do not wish for him to still be living under my roof when heâs 30! Upon reading that horrifying claim, I immediately closed the sample portion of this book and purchased it. I wanted to see what this guy had to say.Capuano articulately describes the root causes for a lack of motivation in teen males, and the three paths of abundance, struggle, and disaster that lie before them. Most importantly, he utilizes the lionâs share of this book to describe his innovative approach to guiding teen boys toward the desirable path.As we all know, teen boys can be prone to resist parental intervention, but the techniques in this book strive toward guiding your son toward self-motivation so that nagging will be unnecessary. Capuano understands that it is impossible to have no motivation. Rather, unmotivated boys are actually motivated not to perform and to resist parental intervention. These techniques offer a sensible solution to breaking through that barrier or, preferably, to avoid the construction of such a barrier in the first place.Overall, I found Capuanoâs background knowledge of the topic, his sound philosophy, and his practical approach to a complex problem to be educational, inspiring, and original. I intend to employ some of these methods as I open a dialogue with my own son. As parents, we all wish to lead our children toward a path of abundance. Maybe this book can help.

Author Paul McQuillan takes a delightfully unique and entertaining approach to exploring the popular discipline of yoga. His relaxed style of writing infused with frequent wit affords the reader a smooth ride as we follow him on a profound journey of discovery. This book will bring repeated smiles as it touches your heart, and it may even inspire you to contort your body into odd positions and, despite the title, you may actually love it!

I got this iron as a birthday gift for my sister and she hasn't stopped raving about it, so I felt compelled to share a review. She claims that she uses it every day and that it has eliminated the need for a daily headful of unsightly rollers. My sister tends to be a chronic complainer about practically anything so, if she gives this product her stamp of approval, you can believe it!

Took on a cruise ship for five days. Many different lighting situations is a challenge. This camera kept up fine.I bought the spare two-batteries and charger from a vendor on Amazon, and never needed the second battery.Bought the 128 gig SDHC card also from Amazon separately, never filled it up; even taking videos etc.Only thing about this model is the display shows colors wonky, some photos came out with funny color. There are so many options, it's a good idea to practice taking photos the week before your big event, so you can change settings faster.Great point and shoot - and I love the microscope feature, that works great.

Seem to be evenly distributed between spring sizes and types. New and quality seems to be there - also well - segregated. Anyone who's ever reached for a spring in their spring bag to not find one - this is a good next place to look.
Moody tools should speak for themselves. These are pro quality wrenches - second to none.

People who have problems breaking these must be breaking everything they touch. Experienced in electronics for decades, for the price break, these are worth the savings. Just be careful not to move them while attached.Soldering skills required.

People who have problems breaking these must be breaking everything they touch. Experienced in electronics for decades, for the price break, these are worth the savings. Just be careful not to move them while attached.Soldering skills required.

Over 30 years active technician - seen every transition to modern electronics since vacuum tubes. These are excellent quality proto boards at a great price break. The lead time is a little long, so order too many for all the different sizes this vendor has to offer.Easy to solder SMD parts and wires to the holes, no solderability problems at all.

Wow, we live in the U.S. and my wife is from Thailand...she always claimed Sriracha was created there, but I didn't know the connection.How enlightening! What a great presentation for a well-loved product.

Started watching this thinking everyone gave it high ratings because of Robin Williams role, but it ended up being a pretty good plot.Probably really helped cast roles that you CAN'T sing on key to get the role. I would think a musical would have on-key singing. Oh well...

Cute show for the kids. The mild swearing was unnecessary and detracted from the rating. I'm an adult who watches the kids shows because that's all that's left for non-offensive videos anymore. Otherwise five stars for acting, special effects, and general plot.

Five stars for the second toner I received. The first one was in seemingly factory sealed packaging, but only lasted a week before I got the out of toner message again. Running toner report confirmed this. Thank God Amazon has great return/exchange policy. Replacement toner shows full on the report and is lasting longer- still full after a few weeks. All the defective one cost me was time.  Recommend you run your printer report right after installing, given the other so-so reviews with the same experience.Folks complaining about the price, ugh they don't understand. Love your Brother!
The real deal. Excellent magnetics tape for winding your own.

Missing critical retaining collet. After soldering, the wires can pull the contacts out of the rear shell easily.Yes I made it work by applying an excellent brand RTV and finishing with Sugru. I should not have to...these are not the best, but the good price brought up a one star to two (maybe three...but naw).

I've had a few .3mm mechanical pencils now. This one is smarter than the rest in that it's double barreled. This means when it's protracted for use, the pencil tip comes to the traditional point. But when you retract it by pushing the top part of the pocket holder, the inner fine point retracts into the outer casing, so your shirts don't get stabbed full of holes. This is the best of the .3s

Exactly what I expected. Smells like a vinyl swimming pool. The seal quality is the best I've seen for a pocket protector, and the clear part tells the world: I'm a geek, but trying to hide it.These will protect my shirt And my expensive .3mm mechanical pencils. Happy happy.

Smooth outer surface allows catch all to fall deep. Seller sends follow up email with brief PDF indicating if they fall deep, it'll still catch stuff. I have some emergency blankets I used to prop them in place, works until someone moves the seat. Saving stars are the sticky mat is unique.

Windows 7 professional 64 bit, right clicked the install file >properties >compatibility >check run in windows 98 compatibility mode.Once the software is installed, set your USB to Serial adapter to Com 1. It worked right away. Took control over the built in hand controller. This is very cool.

Seems like this was offered before as a FAOTD, but somehow is showing as a new purchase.This app has nothing to do with a piano except for it Sounds like a piano.Bars drop from the top and you have to touch the tablet at the second the bar hits the key. This doesn't teach anything about what note your playing, what key the song is in, or anything resembling a real musical score for the piano.This is good if you Pretend to be playing the piano while friends watch, key-syncing (like lip-sync), but if you want to learn piano......get a piano and hire a teacher.One star busters- small file and an app that's low in permissions. Not much use. Should be .99 cents.

Great price and I've used a few different values now in my lab for various experiments, they seem to be measuring within 5 percent of nominal ratings. Sucks having to wait for them to come from across the pond, but the price break is un-beatable.

Only four stars because of the price, you're paying for the name brand. I installed this over the Dynamat extreme on the floor of my 2008 Impala, and in addition to the Dynamat on all the side panels/doors (not done the roof yet), I can hear my engine and the very loudest rock trucks/motorcycles/boom box cars/glass packs...very faintly when they are within one cars' distance from mine. Any other vehicles around me is like they're in another world- I hear nothing buy my own radio on low volume (very clearly).Even though I'll probably buy another pack for my headliner, maybe it should be five stars, but... the money, ugh.

This is the real deal, a nice clam shell enclosure with swivel handle/plastic-aluminum, all hardware, front and back plate. The photo is a bit deceiving because it seems to not show the front plate, but it's all there. What a great value from a renowned company.

See the graphic- the big white circle never gets narrower, just moves around the screen surrounded by the little sperm that can never make it home. There are many better apps like this. A first loser app for SungLab...I like most of their stuff. Oh well, back to the drawing board.

I watched it, so I'll never get that 1.5 hours back in my life.It took a while to figure out he was an American in Great Brittan? Only because they poorly scripted into the plot some actor saying Those D*mn Americans!Every twist is obvious, but the chicks have tight shirts- worth the look see.

These fit my 2008 Impala perfectly. They stay on unlike some other's have experienced.I can roll down my windows now to the point that they meet to edge of these during highway driving. air circulates but isn't a vortex in the cabin anymore. One minor complaint is I can see where the mold flashing was removed with a knife at the manufacturer, but it's on the inside edge- not visible after installed.These have been on my car now for two months, no problems...wish they had the rear-side window louvers!

Identical replacement pads for my 2008 Chevy Impala.The box comes with silicone lube enough for both sides. My car brakes good again, I have no complaints.Held the new pads side by side like the two-star rating, and mine where exactly the right parts. Don't blame Delco because you order wrong parts.AC Delco has been perfect every time I buy from Amazon. Many of their parts are already on my wish list for when my car gets even older (that I know will wear).

2008 Chevy Impala, perfect replacement. Easy to do yourself with a metric wrench and or socket.Note: Instead of compressing caliper piston by using a C clamp the way the videos show, just use a flat screwdriver and pull the caliper towards you by prying the caliper against the old brake pad. KEEP and eye on the brake fluid reservoir level. If your mechanics are integral, you shouldn't have to bleed the brakes.
Surprisingly good Japanese subtitled movie. A good Guy flick or for the gals.As with any sub-titled flick, you have to watch it if you don't speak the language- requires undivided attention.

The real deal. Speedtest.net reflects I'm getting the upgraded speeds I'm paying for. Unit runs cool and is fast as advertised. Worth it to get rid of North Texas Time Warner's $8.00/month modem (I should have done this a long time ago- I bought three of these for the rental I've been paying).I'm starting to really like and rely on Netgear products. Good job!

Hohng Company should have stopped at Cubistry, I actually like that one and it was aesthetically pleasing.This game is so convoluted, there are so many colors, it's impossible to discern matching blocks. Need an option at least to use solid color backgrounds- which would make this game playable and fun, yet still challenging (not impossible).I have the same exit problem others have stated, on my Galaxy Note 10.1., have to force close the program to exit. This reflects a fundamental change in the software engine as compared to earlier versions.Uninstalled FAOTD, may try in the future to see if the dev listened and acted.

*Slides smoothly across the carpet, not so heavy. Handles are low profile, but I can grip them fine.*Fits all my important letter documents with the hanging file folders and tabs. Room to spare!!!*Comes with desiccant. I added an extra of my own (you need that).*The keys were inside the documentation firmly taped to one of the shipping Styrofoam. Glad other reviews mentioned looking there- could have been easy to miss.*The latches seem cheap as others mentioned, but this is NOT a safe; and the instructions specifically state to keep the unit locked as a latching precaution. One note about the latches: there's a release button at the bottom center of each one, you have to depress the button to initiate/unlock the double latch.*I love the pistons keeping the lid from smashing your fingers by accidentally letting the lid close too fast- smart.

The physical characteristics were identical to the one I replaced in my 2008 Chevrolet Impala LT 3.5 V6. Yes it was clicking, fourth time. No matter the manufacturer- they all come from China. Just bought another to replace the far passenger one (inside/outside air) that is also identical; I've had it disabled, but couldn't live without the middle one temp control (this purchase). Now I see how easy it is to replace. the dealership will NEVER get $450.00 to do the work + parts for me. The guy that produces one with metal gears will be rich- this cheap plastic will always become defective again. Glad Amazon/Delco only sells them for $20.00.

Screws and small electronic components (resistors, capacitors), finally getting my boxes of stuff organized. You will want to use a bead of RTV along the bottom edge of the dividers if you're planning on storing very small parts; to keep them from migrating to adjacent compartments
Perfect match for my 2008 Impala, exactly what I'm replacing for age. Love it- from 100,000 miles to new with a twist of a wrench!

I would have paid $10.00 more American for a box to store these in- had to buy separately and wait a month for shipping from over the pond. The redeeming quality is the count seems correct, but as other reviewers noted- are not an exact replacement for the named laptops in the advert.

Professional machined inserts, pro quality materials. This is the same stuff we used in avionics test stations for repairs. Greater than three decades experience in electronics; this is the one you want.
Great price for an all-in-one spacer standoff kit. The threads are well machined, the case is perfect for this size. I'm a happy customer.
Does what it advertises. Great quality cable, no noticeable degradation of speed with any of my USB 3.0 devices.

Stranded wires of different lengths have rubberized molded finger holds near the end of the wire tinned tips. These work perfectly for my proto board designs. I also used a few for soldering wires to phase-II perf board iterations of those designs. This is my first time to not use solid conductor proto board wire, and will never go back. Will buy more...
If you're an acrylic junkie like me, you'll appreciate this is the good thick stuff. Arrived without a scratch. You can run over it with a truck and it would survive. Love...
Leads were in great shape (solderability) and the values were well marked on the tape portion. I measured a sample of these with a fairly accurate meter, and they pass.
Great price and good for electronics component storage. Will buy again.

Cute program, the guy you're hanging interacts with you. As you make wrong guesses, he goes from nonchalant to getting mad at you to worry as the wrong guesses progress.Why is Flurry Analytics imbedded in this? Totally a five-star breaker...boo

Addressing the previous reviewer's comment about software- The installation CD was included with the unit...I'm an experienced electronics technician with an inventory of capacitors and inductors with varying values.This unit was surprisingly accurate for most of the capacitors and inductors that I tested. I sold my expensive LCR tester a long time ago (big mistake), and wanted something to validate a growing stack of components that no longer have identification labels.On the low value cap./ind. end, this meter performs well all the way to the mid-upper values end (500uf and 4500mH). I did not have components available to test the extreme high ranges for capacitors or inductors, but can conclude that this is the little meter that can...1%? Mostly, yes. For 60-80 buck range meter, highly recommended.*I don't see a need for installing the software, pass/fail is mostly percentage math and you'll probably never use this in a production environment.

Will try to get a refund.*15 ohm resistor across the 12 volt line equals slightly less than an amp, voltage drops down to 9.8 volts...not even close to 12. Surely at 2 amps, this will cease to be a 12 volt power supply. Measured first with accurate Fluke DMM, then with Tektronix TDS 2012C scope, a + is that there was no noticeable noise on the DC.*Same 15 ohm resistor across the 5 volt line (about 1/3 of an amp out of the rated 2), with no load equals 5.1 volts, at 1/3 amp, drops down to 4.9, again clearly not capable of supplying 5 volts at 2 amps.*can it power a fan? Yes.*will it perform to advertised specifications? NO.I'm an electronics tech for 40 years- this is not a good power supply for anything beyond a very light load.

Tested with calibrated bench setup. The needle is off by five amps to the negative side- full deflection, with no method for needle zero procedure. Cannot use this in newer cars (like GM) with advanced electrical systems and my OBDC II. Still OK for a quick indication if your battery is charging or draining, and nice retro.All the hardware was included. You supply the wiring and terminals.

I would gladly pay $10.00 more for quality connector contacts. The power adapter 4-pin to SATA adapter broke attempting to insert it into the Molex receptacle (power supply side OK).Lucky I had a toolbox full of adapters like this that WERE quality construction, and that worked.Hooked up my most power hungry/Older HDDs and they read just fine. Will be using this a lot (I help a lot of folks with virus eradication), as the one it's replacing, which is USB 2.0. If it has a short lifespan, I will certainly change/update my review here.Overall, seems of good construction and USB 3.0 seems faster access. Windows 7 Pro instantly recognized and just worked. Happy

XnView created photo editing software. I've been using their software since Windows 3.11 days.This program is as intuitive and simple, as it's expertly written by a developer I trust, a great foundation of tools that make your photo edits look great and pro.Crop, frame, watermark effects, all vary the intensity with a single slidebar, and save at reduced file sizes or original. At 10 meg file progam size and few permissions,I recommend this even on a non-FAOTD day. Installed on Galaxy Note 10.1

DOM (date of manufacture) 9/8/14, date received 11/7/14. I've been soldering SMD components to my friend's circuit board for four hours using this solder paste and a fine tip soldering iron to just heat it. A hot air method would certainly work too. This IS Kester solder portioned into a syringe and sold as depicted. A little tough to push the plunger, but I've been able to control to the finest pitch devices and smallest SMD chips with great control. I will be buying this again. Great stuff solders very clean, almost no residue.

Other customer unfairly rated low...because they didn't know what they were ORDERING? These are quality new SMD chips right off the reels, well-marked and new condition.NOTE: the photo, upon close inspection, shows many missing parts/blank spaces in the sealed reels. I carefully inspected upon arrival for that problem and am completely satisfied I've received all that I ordered.As an electronics tech from the old days through to current technology, these perfectly satisfy my inner geek to have parts available for repairing random consumer electronics that cross my home bench from time to time.

Some videos have audio level problems, may or may not be Amazon prime fault, but it's super quiet, then suddenly loud (like from talking to climax music for example). Choices seem OK, but I was watching Gilligan's Island on Prime for free, then in middle of watching, they wanted to start charging money. NOT cool!

Crucial SSDs, any Crucial memory- always five stars. They're my first stop shopping for all memory. I was not disappointed. Upgraded my dad's dual core Pentium laptop due to HDD failure, wow was he happy, it's so fast now- like new.

This arrived quickly and is exactly what I need.  I connected my new Chromebook to a modem.  I didn't have to use the enclosed disc because Chromebooks already have "support built in".I must say, I don't have a clue about technology but this USB connector was easy - even for ME.GREAT PRODUCT!
reminds me of my youth

I wasn't sure about the Stamina InMotion Rower but decided to give it a try.  I'm SO Happy I did!!I assembled it all by myself ( 67 years old with MS )  in a little over 2 hours.  I goofed with some things and had to redo them but it was worth it.  When I finished, I hurt my arm - Patting myself on the back - Kidding !!!!I used to have a rower with 2 arms that had to be "circled around".  At this stage of my life, 1 rower arm is better.  It strengthens muscles in my arms, back, shoulders and stomach.For the first workout, I  adjusted the shock to the lowest level and it was still a real workout for me.  I only did it for 5 minutes.  That was enough, after the 2 hours of assembly.  I must say, I felt the whole day.  My legs and arms had a great workout.  I had the Amazon Webpage on my computer as I was assembling too.  It was quite helpful.  A couple of times, I thought I was missing parts but I was wrong.  All of the parts were in the box.I'm looking forward to maintaining and improving strength.  This equipment is  a smooth and quiet "ride".LOVE IT!

This is the first time I've tried Rosehip Oil.  (I had heard about it on Dr Oz.)  I didn't know  if it would smell like roses. It doesn't. I've  had weird dry patches on my scalp for the last couple of years - almost like cradle-cap.  The Rosehip Oill is  helping them.Normally when I use any oil - Aragan, Coconut, Grapefruit Seed - on my face, I get bumps.
