In general, though, its a bit too light for all of my playing styles (I really like the heavy feel of the regular 5B, especially for flams on the toms and heavy crash hits)but for the kind of drumming required to play a lot of Maiden songs, its a perfect stick.

Stronger than ever, back with 11 new songs and 2 covers, Van Canto has managed to improve in every area. The arrangements continue to grow in complexity, diversity and the sound quality is huge, right up there with Nightwish and Epica. The power metal core root remains in place, but a few of these songs branch out somewhat like "Magic Taborea" (use of keys) and "Frodo's Dream." "To Sing a Metal Song" is a great metal anthem and a song like "Water Fire Heaven Earth" reminds me a lot of the greatness of Nightwish. Again, Van Canto - aside from the a cappella approach - doesn't bring anything new to the genre, but they have nicely developed a highly enjoyable variation on metal that is a testament to the versatility and power of the human voice. Inga's presence is one again an important part of the mix on all these songs, which was something that I didn't hear on the last release. This is definitely the best collection of original tunes from them of the first 3 releases. Any commentary on this album would be remiss if it fails to mention the amazing cover of "Master of Puppets." I think they did an even better job with this one compared to "Battery" and that was a pretty outstanding effort. I don't think I've ever heard a better "vocalization" of metal guitars ... ever! Certainly a force to be reckoned with in the metal world, this Van Canto tribe is here to stay.

Van Canto takes their sound to the next level with Hero - the production sound more robust, lush. The drums blend with the singers much better this time around, and some of the open space in the songs has been filled in with full vocal rhythms and harmonies which, overall, makes for a better listen. There are fewer original compositions here, only 5 of the 11 tracks, the other 6 being covers of various metal "heroes." While some of the songs are well suited to the "metal a cappella" treatment ("Fear of the Dark" is stunning) "Stormbringer" doesn't translate well into this style. Of the original compositions "Pathfinder" is probably one of the best songs the band has put together to date, but the title track is pretty good as well. I don't hear Inga in the mix as much on this recording, which is a shame as her voice is sublime, but otherwise this is a band well on their way to success.

Retro ReviewThe debut release from this German band features a decent array of a cappella "metal" songs deeply rooted in the traditional power metal native to their land. Amazingly, this stuff really works - the bass, rhythm and lead guitars are replaced by vocalists, and then the lead singers alternate between Inga Scharf and Dennis Schunke. Both singers are very competent and their voices have enduring qualities which keeps listener fatigue at bay. Only the drummer uses an acoustic instrument, which is probably essential to making this legitimate. Without the drums to propel the music it might lose its metal bite. Most of the songs feature a fast, driving rhythm and the typical fantasy themes of heavy metal, but the biggest surprise is the cover tune of Metallica's "Battery." With this very intricate version of this classic song we really get to hear the vocal capabilities of the group - the vocal instrumentations are incredible!  Love the lead guitar "wah-wah" effect - used to emulate solos - which sounds uncannily like a guitar. While obviously the voice can't replace the guitar, the performances here are very impressive. Van Canto will be a novelty for sure, especially with the cover tune, but time will tell if this is embraced by the die-hard metal fans.

Great, sturdy drink holder that is really convenient because it clamps securely. I clamp it to a cymbal stand and it basically never comes lose. It's a very heavy weight so not flimsy at all and easily holds wider drink bottles and all 12 or 160z cans. One of the other nice features is the rubber on the bottom of the cup which adds padding, traction and absorbs condensation pretty well. Plan to get one for my second kit as well.

This case does pretty much what is expected of a great cymbal case. It protects the cymbals (where as soft case doesn't always). Its ergonomic (very easy to carry even fully loaded)and it makes for a great place to store unused cymbals until they are needed again without worrying about them being exposed. I love the screw down feature and the pads to go in between the cymbals. Great product.

These are great running shoes ... I've been using them since the Pure Flow 2. The 4 is not much different from the 3 last year but the new design has a more traditional lace up (but not quite as cool as lasts years black, grey and red setup). I like these better than the Pure Flow 3 though because they have more padding on the heel area and over the instep. I had to go a half size up though because of that additional padding. For those familiar with the series, this shoe changed a lot from the 2 to the 3 but there is less change from the 3 to 4 if that helps. As always, the lightweight Brooks series feels like you are running without a shoe but with the comfort of some cushion. Not for every runner for sure, but for my 8 to 10 miles a week these are great.

Although the line-up has changed since this review was written (at the time of original release) these songs continue to amaze.Since their inception, Atlanta-based Theocracy has been delivering the highest quality power metal in the business. Matt Smith once told me in an interview that he wanted to be known as, "the band that never released a filler song." That fact remains evident on As The World Bleeds because this newest incarnation (now a 5 piece) of the band has yet again delivered the goods. Perhaps a bit less progressive than previous work, fans of Euro power metal will be dazzled. Heavy, melodic and replete with plenty of blistering guitar work - the guys really sound like a touring force now. Lyrically, from the opening moments of the epic "I Am" to the closing title track, this has got to be one of the most compelling/convicting/uplifting collections of songs ever released within the scene. The truth never sounded so good, so give these guys the praise they deserve.

Teramaze has endured some major changes over the past decade. After their success with Tears to Dust - which was a great prog/power release - they dabbled with emo. The relative unpopularity of the release was then followed by many years of silence. More recently, however, with the passing of long time drummer Julian Percy it seems that Dean Wells decided to rid himself of the pain and anger by coming full circle (closer to their debut Doxology) back to his metal roots. The result is a dark and complex mixture of thrash and power metal that is both immediately engaging and emotionally cathartic. And while the Christian themes so prevalent on Tears to Dust are absent here, there are remnants of hope at the core. After spinning this disc for months, the music remains vibrant - plenty of great chops here on all levels - and heavy. It is fair to say that Teramaze have retained their original sound, yet delivered a recording that will not sound "dated" to those who have ears only for the modern metal sounds.

This less well known Austrian melodic power metal act has been around since 2001 but really didn't hit the radar until this release which features the dual vocals of Clementine Delauney and Georg Neuhauser. Using the back drop of historical figures (such as Nero, Bathory, Napolean, Henry VIII, etc.) the band has put forth a very credible collection of mid tempo power metal songs with big melodic hooks and a slightly symphonic vibe. In many ways Serenity is a band with a big Kamelot influence, the emphasis on the melodies more than on heavy, fast riffing. Both vocalists put forth a confident and compelling performance and this will certainly be yet another band for fans of Epica, Nightwish, Within Temptation and of course Kamelot. Production quality, artwork and packaging are first rate.

I have to applaud Steven Wilson for never entirely repeating himself. With the success of The Raven that Refused to Sing it might be tempting to duplicate that formula for success. Wilson, both with Porcupine Tree and with his solo work, has reached somewhat of a hero status for musicians and artists who value quality, along with artistic freedom, ahead of quantity of output. Nevertheless, Wilson has managed to push the envelope of progressive music while maintaining a fairly prolific output - no small feat.Hand. Cannot. Erase. is quite different from Raven, both conceptually and musically. First off this is definitely a concept album whereas Raven was a collection of "stories." Second, the jazz elements from Raven are less prevalent, in my opinion, with more straight forward elements of rock appearing. This has the effect/vibe of making the music feel more accessible. There is more of an electronic feel and the keyboards (both electric and acoustic) seem to play a greater role. There are some ambient passages as well so the overall listening experience from song to song definitely feels more cohesive. Those comparisons aside, this is just another great collection of music from probably one, if not the, most relevant and talented, hard-working artists in the scene.Deluxe Earbook Edition (2CD/DVD/Blu-ray)While there is no doubt that the music of this release stands by itself as a work of art, the earbook and the discs contained therein represent a completely immersive tactile, aural and visual experience of unprecedented proportions. Steve Wilson once again collaborates with Lasse Hoile (photography), Hajo Mueller (illustrations) and Carl Glover (design/artefacts). While Raven's Limited Edition book set a precedent of its own, it should not be surprising that Wilson and friends have pushed the envelope further in terms of the quality and depth of not only the music but the art and the visual and tactile presentation as well. This limited edition is better in every aspect.The StoryKarolina Grzybowska "stars" (aka models) as "H" - a woman in her 30's who is estranged from her family and friends. An introvert, she prefers a life of solitude with as little interaction with the busy and somewhat insincere world around her. The story begins with H's childhood/family background and progresses quickly to her adolescence where her parents adopt a 16 year old "sister" named "J." H and J quickly become connected and share some of their experiences, music, friendship, etc. In only 6 months the parents separate and so do the two girls. This is only minimally traumatic - yet significant - for H who prefers her own company anyway. H meets up with a boyfriend in college but subsequently distances herself from him when she feels things are getting too "serious." Further distancing herself from the world around her, H begins to have "visitors" who question her about her attachments and relationships. H develops a fascination with news stories about people who "disappear," and the interaction with the visitors and her own questions about her ability to be invisible to those around her raise questions about her significance and purpose in life. The rest of the story is more speculative and can best be left to the listener's/reader's interpretation. Suffice it to say, there is much more depth provided in the artbook - too much more information would spoil the story. There are still things I've not yet figured out yet as well.The ArtbookThis 108 page hard-bound book is a work of art itself. Not only does it contain pictures and art chronicling the story of H, but it contains "artifacts" - such as a birth certificate, childhood journal, newspaper clippings, postcard - which help elucidate the story and make you feel as if you are actually touching the items owned by this young woman. The story is presented in a journal fashion from the standpoint of the woman H. Each entry enhances the meaning and character behind the songs. Additionally, the lyrics to each song are cleverly contained within journal entries, diary entries and other media. It's really quite brilliant. The written words certainly help capture not only the meaning behind the songs but also help enhance their emotional/human connection. This is art at its highest calling - the connection between visual, tactile and aural - perfectly executed.Disc 1/The MusicThe opening song "First Regret" is essentially an ambient piano prelude to "3 Years Older" which is an upbeat, rhythmic piece featuring a driving bass guitar line reminiscent of Geddy Lee, and Minnemann throws in a few Peart-like drum fills as well. The beginning and ending definitely has a Rush vibe but the song middle is a mixture of styles - the dynamic contrast between soft and loud sections pretty extreme. The solo section beginning around the 8 minute mark is one of the few times where the band really lets loose on this release and they ride it out to the end of the track. Lyrically, this song chronicles the early stage of the main character's life and H's interactions with her sister J.The title track follows and is the most easily loveable song on the disc; it's immediately appealing with its sing-along melody and catchy chorus. This is certainly the most radio friendly song on the release. Lyrically it alludes to the main character's "break-up" with her boyfriend and provides a lot of insight into how she views relationships in general."Perfect Life" is a mix of narration during the first half and Wilson repeating the chorus over top of some electronic beats and keys. Lyrically it's a reverie of sorts about H's relationship with her sister - sadly one of the only meaningful relationships in her life."Routine" is another epic song that begins with a haunting piano and vocal melody. The soft guitar noodling the main melody around the 4 and a half minute mark is a highlight followed by ethereal female vocals (Ninet Tayeb). This song, which has a definite Pink Floyd vibe, is probably the most beautiful song on the record from a melody and composition standpoint. It's not really a song about the main character but instead one of the "victims" H reads about in her news stories.The intensity really gets ratcheted up a notch with "Home Invasion" - a song about the internet's negative impact on our lives - and the follow up instrumental "Regret #9" with its incredible guitar solo. This song really showcases the kind of talent Wilson has recruited to realize and execute his musical dreams."Transience" serves as another retrospective type song from H's youth and serves somewhat as a transition to "Ancestral," the most epic track here. Very cool how the song builds in intensity throughout, culminating in an ominous sounding finale. Once again, this song features the band. Lyrically, this is definitely the most challenging song on the recording to comprehend and remains open to interpretation like most of Wilson's work."Happy Returns" - the most appropriately titled song here - features a letter to H's estranged brother ...almost a "goodbye/farewell I have no regrets" type letter. The peaceful album closer serves essentially as a bookend. Once again, the final outcome is open to interpretation. (But X-files fans might not think so!)Disc 2/The DemosThere is a key piece missing from the main story - "Key of Skeleton" - and it is musically found on the demo CD. The book also describes this in some detail as well. The other songs here are different/mostly longer versions of the final cuts but different enough to make this demo CD much more relevant than the demo CD from the Raven sessions. As with all things Wilson, don't think demo quality - these songs sound just as amazing as the stereo versions on the main CD.Disc 3/The DVDFor those who buy the media book with the DVD-V, you get the DTS 5.1 mix and the 24/96 stereo versions of the songs, the photo gallery and the documentary. Most of the photos in the artbook show up on DVD while the songs are playing in sequence. However, neither the Blu-ray or the DVD contains the "artifacts."Disc 4/The Blu-rayHere is the disc for the audiophiles. This one contains the 5.1 master DTS, and the stereo 2.0 and 5.1 mixes. Words won't be able to describe how these songs sound in surround but a better listening experience will be hard to find. The fact that these version contain very little compression means that you can crank this stuff up to the highest volume with no distortion. Every voice can be heard in detail and it truly is one of the best recordings I've ever heard. In addition to these hi-def versions of the main CD music, the Blu-ray contains instrumental versions (all of the songs) and alternate versions of some of the songs. For me, the Grand Union version of "Perfect Life" - where the spoken word is more clearly discernable - is a highlight, along with the alternate version of "Regret #9." A new item (not present on the Raven Blu-ray) would be the piano themes from the release. This is a particularly stunning inclusion from my standpoint as the emphasis on piano and keys on this release was one of the first things I noticed with initial spins that really set this release apart. Of course, the documentary and photo gallery from the DVD are included on the Blu-ray as well. It should be noted that during playback of the DVD/Blu-ray discs, the photos and art from the book - those which correspond to the songs - are displayed. In essence, you can literally watch the video/look at the book and the items therein and listen to the music all at the same time. For music/art/story lovers this project is a dream. The fact that Wilson knows how to make it all connect on an emotional level is merely the icing on the cake!I've yet to hear the vinyl version but I'm sure it won't disappoint. In summary, Hand Cannot Erase is an unrivaled emotional, listening and visual experience - eclipsing even the brilliance that was The Raven That Refused to Sing. Surely this will be enjoyed for years to come. Thanks to Wilson and friends for their commitment to art at its highest level.

When I first listened to At The Edge of Time a few years back I don't think I realized just how good it was. Sure, the veterans of the German power metal scene had delivered another epic slab of energetic and symphonic songs pretty much in the vein they had patented over 2 decades ago. In essence, they consistently craft memorable tunes filled with all of the elements that make this genre appealing to so many, simultaneously propelling their music to a higher level of complexity than any other band in the melodic power metal scene. ATEOT was certainly no exception and it's well worth another look for those who may have skipped over it or just not had enough time with the songs initially (which was my case) for the hooks to take firm hold. But take heed, once they take hold they won't let go as this one gets better with repeated play. Spinning this disc multiple times, both in anticipation of Beyond the Red Mirror and since the release of that masterpiece, I am firmly convinced this collection of songs was the perfect precursor to that magnum opus. Where fans were somewhat jaded by the complexity/density of A Night at the Opera (and perhaps shocked by Stauch's departure from the BG drum throne) the band pulled things back a bit with 2006's A Twist of the Myth. But where that album was a bit more commercial, At The Edge of Time turned up the intensity and metal factor big time while simultaneously re-introducing the epic and symphonic elements that were for the most part absent from ATOTM. Hence, ATEOT serves as a transitional album which perfectly balances all of the elements that make BG so endearing, and in doing so positions itself as the perfect bridge from ATOTM to BTRM. The album title even ends up as a pivotal song in the Red Mirror saga - no coincidence that. Fans know this music by now so it speaks for itself, and others have chronicled detailed descriptions so I won't digress. For me, the first 6 songs are perfect and the rest of the album is really darn great. But don't take my word ... have another look into the "void" and you won't be disappointed.

Fans of 80's metal and classic melodic metal will find everything they need here to satisfy their longings for great music. Michael Eden's all-star crew is back with their third installment of ear candy. This time around they seem to be going for a much more commercial approach, which could turn away fans for the more "metal" feeling debut. Every song here has that definite AOR appeal, largely due to the big choruses and melodic hooks. Lyrically, there are more spiritual references than ever, yet the band maintains a rebellious spirit. It's a paradoxical approach, yet one can't argue with the truth behind songs like "Trinity" or "No Holy Man," or even "Can't Fool The Devil" for that matter. It can't hurt to have James Labrie sing on any recording ("No Holy Man") and even Andi Deris (Helloween) makes an appearance on the speedy "Black Widow." The cover of Dio's "Rock `N' Roll Children" is simply a faithful rendition of the original. The AFM Records (European) release contains "We Climb" while the North American release contains a different song. One observation: sometimes when a release includes too many guests it steals away from the bands' own identity, but I don't think that is the case here. Eden's Curse - to my ears - sounds like what Stryper would have sounded like in 2011 if they hadn't changed their style from their later 80's hits. Eden's Curse has no progressive leanings whatsoever - this is straight ahead melodic rock/metal. This is a well-produced slab of music from a great band and it is nicely packaged/produced by one of the best metal labels in the world.

The 2013 reissue of BG's Nuclear Blast debut - featuring new drummer (at the time) Frederik Ehmke - comes nicely packaged in a tri-fold digipak (featuring the incredible artwork of Anthony Clarkson) with 3 bonus tracks not included with the original release. The new tracks are "All the King's Horses" (Japan edition), the acoustic version of "Skalds and Shadows" (which really doesn't sound that different from the original version) and a fast and short version of "In A Gadda Da Vida" - the latter two tracks taken from the Fly EP. For those who own the original release these tracks are non-essential, but for the fans that like to own every version and certainly for those without the 2006 release the Special Edition is worthy.A Twist in the Myth was more straight ahead metal compared to its predecessor A Night at the Opera, which for some fans was a much welcomed change. Lacking the layered guitars and symphonic elements these songs have a "clean" sound that is more immediately enjoyable. Lyrically these songs visit numerous literary figures (Peter Pan the most noteworthy with "Fly"), mythology, Christianity and Viking and Welsh folklore. And "Carry the Blessed Home" even features characters from King's Dark Tower series. Other songs are conceptual in nature like "Straight Through the Mirror" - a song about dreaming - and "Another Stranger Me" - about a person with dissociate disorder. Musically, this is actually a pretty diverse collection with plenty of emphasis on the guitar leads and solos in the mix. Kursch's vocals are exceptional as always and Ehmke's drum contributions proved that he was a more than adequate replacement for the Thomen Stauch. Ehmke's performance on "Lionheart" remains a highlight for me - the song itself one of my favorites from this release. Listening to this release this many years later I can't but wonder why it was not better received by fans as I think these songs hold up really well over time. Yes, there were some quirky songs - "Skalds and Shadows" much maligned by some - but to me it's all part of the greatness of BG.

While not as impressive as 2010's 7 Sinners, Helloween continue to set the standard for heavy and speedy traditional power metal. With the exception of Blind Guardian there are very few bands in the genre that can deliver so consistently at this high level for such a long time. The first 3 tracks here are obliterating power metal with infectious and catchy hooks, soaring choruses and just "in your face" metal. But then things get a bit more diverse going forward, with a mixture of metal anthems and power ballad type songs that might tax the patience of die-hard metal fans. Most of the songs are really good though, but "$##hole" is a complete waste of time, as is "Wanna Be God." Those two songs should have been left off this otherwise stellar collection, and can't say I'm a fan of "Church Breaks Down" either, probably because of the lyrical content. The biggest way to summarize the difference between this release and 7 Sinners would be to say that while 7 Sinners had a generally positive vibe (and was more consistently great), this one has a much more negative vibe, mostly due to the lyrical content on some of these songs. I do love the Hammond organ (Deep Purple-like) version of "Burning Sun" which is a great song to begin with but sounds even better with the organ. The criticisms aside, these guys invented the speed power euro metal genre way back in the 80's and they still own the crown as far as I'm concerned.

I already have See Diapers charcoal bamboo 5-layer inserts with gussets. They are 13in, like most other CB inserts are. I like them, but I wanted longer ones. These said 14in. VERY misleading. They are MUCH shorter than my SD inserts. What a waste of money!
Totally stopped working after 3 weeks!  For no reason. :(

I'm usually very fair with reviews, but I hate this garbage. We bought one and got it home and noticed the mirror was scuffed to hell and back, so we exchanged it. The new one, the remote only works if you turn the power on and off. Every time! NEW name brand batteries in both! Remote does NOTHING! Slide the power off and on, and the remote will work. But the next time you go to use it, even if it is 5 minutes later, you have to turn in on and off again! The light only stays on for like 5 seconds, too. The only reason we paid $20 instead if $10 for a standard mirror was so we could use the remote so we didn't have to climb back in a moving car, but we have to climb back anyway! The light is useless, the remote is useless. The only benefit is the music, but we have a stereo in the car, so there was ZERO benefit to buying this over a standard mirror! Absolute rubbish! But I don't feel like returning it a second time.

There are a dozen or more bamboo charcoal inserts for sale on Amazon and they all, even the ones with gussets, say about 13in long. These said 16. It should have been safe to assume they would be longer than other brands. NOPE. They must just measure them when pulling the elastic out. It isn't fair. When all your competitors use a standard measurement and your stretched-out measurement makes yours look 3in longer, even though they are in fact the same size, this is deceptive. I NEEDED longer inserts because ours were too small. What a MASSIVE waste of $30 just to get more of what I already had. Thanks. The ONE seller who says 16in instead of 13in and it was a white lie. Brilliant. $30 in the bin!

Like other reviewers stated, it is flat. It curves around the face so that all you can see is a glare becasue it is highly glossy. The curvature also elongates the face making it unrecognizable. The pressure against my nose caused excruciating pain to the point that wearing this mask was out of the question. I am only giving 3 stars because apparently the seller refunded me.

Love it! I am pretty lazy, and it isn't too much work to wrap. I am very hot-natured and it isn't too warm. Just wear without a shirt around the house and with a layering tank when out. My son is 24lbs and it doesn't stretch or sag even after an hour. I have chronic back pain and this offers as much support as my Ergo. I wish that I would have used a Moby when he was a newborn, especially skin to skin. And you can't beat the 50% off price! The logo is nice and large, soft and only on one side, so if you wanted the 50% off without the logo, you could wrap the logo on the inside and it would just be a solid color.I can think of NO complaints about this product and you and see my other reviews to show that I am usually pretty critical unless I really love something. I love this.

This says 8-36lbs but I can barely snap it on my 22lb baby because it is too tight.We use Bububibi/BB2 and they are so much better. They cost less, they are bigger, they have a double row of snaps, they are double-gusseted, they have extra room for inserts. There is just no contest.

I love this! I wanted something safe for my 7.5 month old son to play with while he nursed and keep him from looking around distracted. It serves that purpose. I didn't think I would wear it because I hate jewelry. I never wear Jewelry, even my wedding band. I wind up taking it off after a few hours because it is uncomfortable. But I have been wearing this necklace since I bought it. I wash it and put it back on. The blocks are kind of big for him to chew, but that wasn't why I got it and it serves the purpose it was meant for. I don't love the plastic clasp but it is secure. I love the colors. I would recommend this product to friends.

Because of the shape of my door (enclosed photo to show shape), there was nothing for it t catch on. It just slid back up, even when the door was shut. Pulling it down over the slope in my door covered the locking mechanism, which can't be safe. I was bummed, but I didn't want to go through the trouble of returning it.The company contacted me and I would shop from them again simply because they are hilarious. E.G. "High five! (I'm pressing my hand up against the screen I promise)."Not only that, they went ABOVE and BEYOND to resolve this issue. I did not realize this was a smaller company. I have sympathy for start-ups because I watch a lot of Shark Tank. I know that there are usually families with dreams behind the scenes.I look forward to getting the replacement product and will update this review when I do!

I love these inserts. I use them (instead of prefolds) with covers.The outer layer keeps baby bone dry! They say that they become more absorbant after 5-6 washes, but even after the first wash, one insert alone keeps my 23lb super-soaking son dry overnight (11+hours) with NO leaks. (Which is also thanks to Bububibi, but the inserts are still great.)I bought another brand (Natrally Nature, or something like that) and I like these WAY better. These are the best inserts I have ever used and I ordered more the first day.What makes them better:-larger than NN-softer than NN-seams hold up in the wash better than NN-nice square edges and dark color make them look higher quality than NN-priced the same as NN, not extra-didn't pill like NNThis isn't the best review I've ever written. I'm NAK. But trust me, especially if you use covers, buy these!These are on the left, NN are on the right.

The crib arrived with MASSIVE damage to it. It wasn't just scuffed, but an entire chunk was carved off right on the top rail, like 2-3 inches long and 3/4 of an inch wide, as well as other scuffs. It goes down to the bare wood, so it was clearly done after the paint job. I'd have demanded a replacement but we'd already started to put it together, I knew that I was going to have a rail cover anyway, and for all I knew, the replacement could be in worse shape. It did not appear to be repackaged at all, so I'm calling poor quality control.

I was with this book until the very end. The only redeeming quality about Jeff or Fish is that they didn't screw and the author focuses on this repeatedly until the last two pages when she is like "j/k, they did screw." As if she couldn't think of a better ending. It ruined the entire book for me. It was predictable and a cop out and uneventful other than to remove any remaining likability for 2/3 of the characters. If you completely take out the last chapter, the book is good as is. Leave Claire having some hint of normalcy and the hope of her sister staying in town to practice law with her. A movie version could have ended there. And if it had, it's like the author shoved in a clip of them screwing in the end credits after spending the entire book denying it.I gave it two stars instead of one because I liked the writing. As a wife, the ending killed it for me. Minus the last chapter, I'd have given it 3 or 4.

I loved this thing when I first got it but after using it for only a couple of weeks, it started to peel on the corner and exposed the sticky inside. I'm bummed and pissed. 3M is a name I trusted but I obviously got a defective unit.

I love these. I got a pair in the store but lost them and I can't wear any other so I was happy to find them here online. As earphones, they are unbeatable. However, I docked stars b/c the mic doesn't work. I don't know if my unit is defective, but my PC won't recognize a mic.

It looks cool but through no fault of my own, the way the case is made, scratched the crap out of my brand new 3DS XL. The metal prongs that hold the top part in place scraped the DS when they hooked around the rim. I'm heartbroken and only hope GameStop honors the protection plan we purchased and replaces my DS. I don't normally leave bad reviews but it damaged my item.

I've been using these for years and I replace them every once in a while. This batch was a lot smaller than the ones I'd been using and barely touch the insides of the straw. It makes cleaning more difficult.

I bought this because we don't use toxic talk or scented corn starch with added chemicals on our child for disappearing. We use organic, non-GMO corn starch. Not judging J&J mom's; to each his own. At any rate, we needed a shaker for it because shaking it from the box is too messy. This works perfectly for that! I rated it lower because the edges of the handle are really rough and scrape my hand to the touch. It wasn't smoothed enough. It might be less noticeable for people who just use it a few times a year, but using it every day is very uncomfortable.I have to be careful to grab the other side.

I really thought I would love this system! All I wanted was a system with ten sensors, a keypad, a chime, a delay, and that is all. This should have been perfect. The problem is the system disarms itself a few seconds after I arm it. Every time. I read all the reviews and expected this stellar customer service. I left a message with the phone number on the sheet in the box. I never got a call back. Ultimately, I contacted Amazon about my inability to reach the seller and they just refunded me NQA. I really wanted the system to work, but it didn't. I'm a real customer. I really bought it. It really didn't work. Maybe had the seller returned my call, he could have helped me. Instead, I got a different system that doesn't do everything I wanted but at least stays armed.

I want to preface my review by saying that I got my Kindle (Fire HD 32) from QVC for $229, made in 6 monthly payments (costing less than $50 to get it home) and it came with the fast charge wall adapter, leather magnetic stand case, 2 year premiere tech support, and $50 printerpix.com credit, plus NQA returns for 3 months. So, my review is based on that deal.That being said, I barely touch my computer since my Kindle came. I use it every day. It's faster than my laptop and our two other tablets. The screen is so gorgeous that it makes my phone/tablets look like toys. I watch TV and it's as pretty as our 1080p 240hz 42in TV. I read in bed without lighting up my husband's side. I read books to my 2 year old from the massive library on Freetime Unlimited (worth it for the apps alone), I can finally stream Prime on the go. I can watch YouTube videos in Silk for knit/crochet patterns and can see their hands as clear as day. I can video chat via Skype. I can skate around the only-front-facing camera, though I wish it had both. It also doesn't come with video (camera takes pics only), but there are good, free apps that allow it. It hasn't crashed on me once in the weeks I've had it. I only have nice things to say other than video isn't built in, no back camera, and no YouTube or Ibotta app - or GooglePlay. That, and that I can't upload pics to it from my camera via usb like my other tablets. It plugs in but won't link, I assume bc the drivers won't download. At any rate, it was WELL worth the money and I'd buy it again. Replaced my tablet, laptop, and smartphone, for the most part.

This game is very addicting. It looks great on an HD screen. They intentionally make it slow to earn donuts (currency) in the hopes that you will buy more with real money. But it is a high quality free app, so they have to make money somehow, I guess.

This was a very good idea for an app. I didn't really like 4 pics 1 word, and I beat The Room. Needed a fun game and this was a good pick! Knew the first 3 no problem. Had to remove letters for 4. Got 5 with no problem. And I rarely listen to current music, especially pop. So, it isn't THAT hard.

It is meant to be a quick reference but I happily and hungrily read it cover to cover. I have also referenced back to past chapters when needed. After falling off my cloth diaper high horse, I rid my child's environment of PVC (bye bye ball pit) and reassigned my "#7" tumblers as "not food safe" and Pinned a bumload of Vegan recipes. The hardest part was giving up my bottled spring water for a filter. But it is much cheaper. The easiest was going from Teflon to ceramic. Much better anyway.

Addicting and well made! I got 500 coins free with my Kindle Fire HD so technically, this game was free and even gave me 20 coins. The HD screen makes this even more beautiful. Music and sounds are spooky but quality. This game is short, but worth playing. Like others said, make it last by not using hints or walkthroughs. I want more! I love puzzle games but some are too easy and some are impossible but this is a good happy medium. And my favorite thing is that you can put it down and pick it up and be right where you left off. I am a mom and timed games are not the best because kids do not wait for checkpoints. Go at your own pace and enjoy the ride. Personally, I am super easily scared, so playing at night creeper me out, but it isn't so bad when muted. All in all, there is a reason it have thousands of reviews and 5 stars.

We bought every kind of sippy cup on the market and while my tot took to the Dr. Brown's cups at first, straw cups wound up being the ONLY kind of cup she will use! There are a handful of straw cups on the market, but these are my favorite and I'll tell you why...1. Price: These are as low as $2 in my local stores. ($1.99 at Baby Depot, $2.49 at Wal-Mart, etc.) The only other straw cups cheaper are the Take & Toss and those are not spill resistant. So, these cups are easy to replace. While I haven't been able to find replacement nipples, at this price, I can just buy more cups and recycle the old ones.2. Ease of use: We have tried other cups and the odd shaped nipples are difficult to get in and out of the odd shaped lids. Insulated cups are too clunky and not necessary for us as out kid doesn't sip at her drinks but is done well before it has time to reach room temperature. Flip top lids are a huge pain to wash and none of these pieces fit in standard dishwasher baskets well. With these cups on the other hand, they assemble and wash almost exactly like her Playtex drop-ins bottles. 5 nipples fit with plenty of room in the basket, the lid are just rings, and the straws go in the straw slots. I'll link our basket - Munchkin Deluxe Dishwasher Basket, Colors May Vary And they are easy for her to carry.3. Durable: My kid is rough on things. These are dropped from shopping carts, fall off counters, washed in the dishwasher on high heat, and she chews on the silicone straw part of the nipple and it has never broken off or anything like that, nor have any of the cups ever cracked. We've been using the same cups for about 4 months now, and we started with only 2 in rotation, and as of today we have 9. Every other cup we bought, even the expensive ones, are sitting in a bag under the sink because we did not like them for one reason or another.4. Spill-proof-ish: They aren't going to pour all over like some cups, but sometimes they can spill a tiny bit. You see, the straw part of the nipple has two valves and if my kid sucks liquid past the bottom valve and then removes the cup from her mouth, the liquid can leak out of the top valve. But other than that, no, it isn't going to leak so long as the nipple is sealing into the ring all the way around - like a bottle.My only complaints are that I don't like her drinking mostly from plastic, even if it is BPA free, and I don't like that the rings are different colors. I had to buy one of each so that I could match them up green/green, red/red, yellow/yellow, pink/pink, blue/blue, but I was still stuck with a purple cup with an orange lid. But I know these aren't big enough issues to count off a star, so I didn't.

We have been using this product for about a year now - I bought a 3pk and then was given a 3pk and we still have a few unopened bottles. It lathers a lot! My child has really bad eczema and this has never caused any issues for us whatsoever. And her eczema is so bad that she will get a flare-up on the side of her face if she sleeps on it too long. She also has really sensitive skin. So much so that we had to switch to cloth diapers because disposable diapers caused a reaction on her skin. She can't even wear polyester or she gets heat rash. And she can't even wear band-aids or eat raw oranges because she is allergic to adhesive and citric acid. So, I knew that I wanted the most gentle soap I could find, without paying California Baby prices. We were using an Aveeno product, but since they are made by Johnson & Johnson, who openly use formaldehyde in their products, I needed to make a switch. After hours of reading reviews, we picked this one. Our regimen includes The Honest Company Shampoo and Conditioner, Aquaphor Gentle Wash, and BabyGanics Extra Gentle Lotion. Will I keep using it? Probably not. It's better for your skin to change soaps every once in a while, so I'll be on the hunt for something better. I'd have changed sooner, but 6 8.4oz bottles will last you forever, it seems. And I use it generously. The bottom line is that my kid reacts to everything but this is gentle enough for her. So, if you want gentle and aren't worried about organic or natural, this is your winner.

First off, I haven't tried the little green bags, but I will say filling from the bottom and washing in the curves is a little bit hard, so if you're between the two, I'd sway the other way. But these are so cute, so I picked these! hahaI love the concept. My almost 17 month old refused to eat veggies - except blended. This keeps me from having to go back to spoon feeding. The storebought pouches are so expensive! And just like with jarred food, it isn't the same as home made. So, I pulled the baby bullet out of the cabinet and filled these little guys and my tot ate veggies willingly! That's a win in my book.I will update if they tear or anything because they feel kind of flimsy, but we will see! Some things aren't as delicate as they look, so they may hold up! No leaks yet! Though I don't feel like I could turn them inside out without risking a tear, if that's how you planned to wash them.I LOVE that they are freezer safe! I may get the little green bags later, to compare, so I can make big batches ahead of time and freeze, instead of blending every other day. We will see. But these guys are just as cute in person, and I have no regrets, really.Update: The smaller size, the bird and lion, they are really difficult to fill! IF I were you, I'd go on Amazon and search for the 4pk that is four of the larger size, two each of a panda and walrus. The cost is about the same! The little ones are almost pointless. Squooshi 4 Count Reusable Food Pouch, Large Panda/Walrus, 4.5 Ounce

I took a chance because it was only $7. I have Touchmaster 1, 2 and 3! So, I thought I'd have to like this. I agree with another reviewer. Almost every game is timed! I like to play Touchmaster and relax in bed while maybe watching TV or chatting with my husband after a long day. So annoying to have to give the game 100% of my attention or lose! Just a couple games aren't timed. :/ I definitely think this Touchmaster is the worst out of the 4. It was probably worth the $7, I guess. But barely.

I was skeptical because of the few low reviews but this is a total home run! I needed a quick and easy solution to keep my toddler out of her hamper, and I took a chance on this because it was only $12. (I have it hanging on an over-the-door hook and not the knob)I wish I'd gotten it sooner! It seems really sturdy. It doesn't collapse on me like others said. It collapses when I empty it, but never while it's hanging or when I toss things in - it stays wide open until I take it down. One full bag does equal one full load for my brand new full sized washing machine! Maybe the reviews who say it doesn't hold a full load have a huge, high capacity machine? In fact, when a load is mostly jeans, this bag actually holds MORE than my washing machine can. It keeps dirty laundry out of my toddler's reach, while still keeping it close enough for me to toss things in all day, which I love! I don't even need the zipper, I just tip it over the washer and shake the clothes out.I loved this so much that I ordered two more, one for me and one for my husband. I love that they are washable, too. I washed my daughter's after I'd had it for a few months and it looks identical to mine and my husband's which are brand new. No wear at all! They do sag just a little bit when they are full of my husband's jeans, but the spring right back to life on laundry day. I recommend these to anyone and everyone! Oh, and since it is made of canvas, you can paint it if you don't like the plain white for your decor. Even some simple chevron stripes in a bold color would make this gorgeous.Note: Even though the hook never collapsed when it was hanging up, I got a wee bit tired of it collapsing when I'd dump it out. So, I wrapped a rubber band around parallel lines and now the hook NEVER slips. Amazon doesn't do customer submitted photos anymore, but I am about to order number FOUR (Not because any of the others failed, but because my daughter has one, my husband and I each have one, and I want a fourth one for towels and bedding, etc) and when that arrives, I will take a video of my rubber band trick and attach it to this review. 9/21/13

I'm really shocked by the reviews. This cup has been great for us! I actually came her to buy more b/c I wanted to stock up as we lost one and only have 2 left and they are the only ones she will use. We started with the Playtex ones Playtex Baby First Lil' Gripper Twist 'n Click Straw Trainer Cup, 7 Ounce, Colors May Vary but when we lost the only one, I didn't want to buy more because they are so expensive. These are like $2.99 at Wal-Mart so I grabbed a few and my 15 month old took to them right away! They have dropped and been kicked and no cracks. She has literally all her baby teeth and is a biter and chewer, but the straws are intact. And they have never once spilled, even when I try. Plus, they are way more easy to clean than they Playtex cups, and hold more. I'm very happy with them. This split reaction makes me wonder if they have changed the way they make them recently. Well, I guess all babies are different. At any rate, at half the price of the average cup, they are worth trying!!! They were a home run for us and about half the other reviewers.

Just to be clear, I do not keep a pet in this. I have an aquatic turtle, and it is very common to feed them outside their tank because they are messy eaters, poop immediately, and it will keep your HUGE tanks from getting so dirty so fast. So, this bowl is JUST for meal time, NOT for full time.Mine did not leak. It's cheap feeling, but not cheap looking. Put the screw into a stud if you can because it is really heavy! I only filled it a little less than half way because that's all I need. You don't have to unscrew it every time you take it down if you use a screw head small enough. If you can't, you can just tilt the bowl to pour the water out without removing the screw.But it would make a hell of a lot more sense if they used a proper screw hole that had an easy easy way to slide the bowl up and off the screw. So, stars off for that.

I guess it is my fault for taking a risk on this when it only had one review. I uploaded a few pictures to show you what I mean, but there are threads and bad stitching and tears. It's nothing that makes the bag unusable, but I will have to take the time, energy, and supplies to stitch it by hand myself, and it won't look as good and I just shouldn't have to do it because I didn't pay for a bag that needed work done, I paid for a new bag. At $17 for a simple duffel bag, you wouldn't expect this poor quality. It isn't like I paid $5. At any rate, I'll let the pictures speak for themselves.Other than that, the size and shape make it PERFECT for a toddler's diaper bag. All her food and dishes go in the left, all her milk and juice goes in the right, diapers and wipes in the front, hand sanitizer in the little pocket, and a blanket, spare outfits, and TONS of toys in the main compartment. I have had many other diaper bags and totes, but they are tall and narrow, and hard to get to things in the bottom. I looked for hours for something more shallow and wide and finally found that a bag like this was really what I was looking for and boy was it super easy to find things with this bag. Her bottles even fit in the mesh pocket perfectly. It would also make a great cheer bag, dance bag, sports bag, or travel bag.Eventually, I plan to get her name embroidered on, and maybe some gold stars. I come from a military family, so I love the camo. I think it's adorable.Three stars for bad stitching, please view photos.

I got this tripod because I was so busy putting Balapalooza together that I forgot to video my baby's first Christmas. I did not want that to happen again! So, I ordered this before her first birthday and it was a lifesaver! It is so light (my point and shoot digital camera weighs more) and collapses easily and the legs telescope easily, and the locks will secure it at literally any height between the shortest and longest. The head tilts forward, back, left, right. The handle makes it even easier. I could see it blowing over outside if it were very windy on a hill, etc. It suits my needs, though!! If you are shooting inside, you won't need anything more expensive or fancy.

A little annoyed that the price is down like $5 since I ordered, but that's Amazon for you.When I went to Wal-Mart and Best Buy looking for a plain tablet cover, the cheapest was 2-3 times as much as this one and it did nothing! I knew I at least wanted a kick stand and for this price, the keyboard was just a free bonus, so I wouldn't care if it hadn't worked or stopped working, but it's good! My tablet came with a USB adapter so that was no issue, but they are only a few bucks anyway.It's a ZTO 7in N1+ or something like that and it fits great. The keyboard is awkwardly small, but still better than the touch screen key pad! It kinda turns your tablet into a tiny laptop. It's a decent quality. I am pretty rough on my belongings nowadays and no stitching has come undone. It looks like I paid twice at much, or more.The stylus is just a Nintendo DS stylus, so don't expect to be able to use it on your tablet. I happen to have a DS, so it's not a total loss, but I doubt I ever use it as I have many nicer ones, like most DS users. Don't let that deter you from buying because if you really want a stylus, you can get them for like $1 here on Amazon! That's what I did and mine work great! Had them for about a year and still intact. Minus one star for misleading stylus that you can't use on tablet.UPDATE: A couple months later, the keyboard stopped working. But it's still functions as a cover, though I admittedly don't use it. I still use the micro USB to USB adapter, though!

[If you look at the 5 star reviews, especially the 2nd page, each and every one is rated unhelpful. So, at the risk of someone who hates this product reducing my reviewer rank for no good reason, I'm going to leave a positive review anyway.]We purchased this kitchen in our local store for $45. I would not have spent $100. The material is like ALL Little Tikes plastic, e.g. the Cozy Coupe. The vent hood will not fall if it is screwed in like the instructions clearly state. Likewise, the white part will not lean forward if screwed in correctly. I have ALL the accessory pieces stored in the oven and fridge, so there is room, but I do plan to get more food and then the accessories will go in small baskets, slid under the counter in Stage 1 and wherever she wants them by the time it is in Stage 2. So, this is really not a big deal to me at all, having to spend $3 on some plastic baskets, and even IF the food it came with had been healthy, I'd buy more b/c it only came with a few foods, anyway. (Update, I bought the Little Tikes Backyard Barbeque Summer Fruit and Veggie Set and it is a great fit and all very healthy!) The stickers do not look cheap when you compare them to every other play kitchens' where most are done in a cartoon design. At least these make an attempt at looking more photographic, and to a non-jaded toddler, they succeed! It doesn't make tons of sounds because it is an imagination-inspiring toy. Many play kitchens make NO sounds, so I was actually surprised when I found the burner took batteries. My child prefers stacking cups, puzzles, books, and blocks to the infamous Ballapalooza, so making noise, and flashing lights are NOT a necessity for her. In Stage 1, the low stage, the counter hits about hits the waist of my over 30" tall  baby, where I guess you would expect it to hit her chest, though I'm not sure why, as my own counter hits my waist. If the sink was not that low, they couldn't reach the shelf, hood, etc. I have a feeling this bothers parents a lot more than it bothers toddlers. They can sit and play, bend and play, stand and play. It's really not that big of a deal, and if it is, then move it to Stage 2 so it meets your needs. That pretty much addresses the negative reviews for those of you who really want this and are skeptical. However, do NOT spend this $100 it is listed for! It is well worth $45, but for $100 you could get a much nicer one, like the gourmet series, or a wooden one. Check Wal-Mart.

I would not let my child watch this movie. I don't understand why they put inappropriate things in movies marketed to children.  I understand that people will disagree and that's okay. To each his own. My honest opinion is that I am not comfortable letting my child watch this, and I have no desire to watch it for myself. Children are not as naive as some people would like to believe. They DO pick up on innuendo. I don't want them to hear anything that I wouldn't want them to repeat. I'm glad some people enjoy it. It's just not for me.

My baby is only 11 months, but I knew we'd want a sand/water table down the road. I wasn't going to spend $40-50 on a plastic tub with legs, unless I could be certain it is something she'd just love and play with all the time. For now, we love it as a Mega Bloks table. We'll likely try the sand and water in the Summer.She has not tipped it, or tried to climb on top of it. Watch your kids and those things won't happen, no offense. Once assembled, I could not pull the wheel tower apart when I tried, so no way could my baby accidentally break it apart by spinning the wheels. Sure, it could tip over because it isn't attached and just sits on top of the table, but unless the unit is defective or not put together properly, it will not just break apart as one reviewer seemed to claim. Maybe a leg could fall off if dragged when heavy with sand/water, but I've not had any issue like that and would likely pick it up and move it and not drag it, anyway. I'm not trying to pick apart reviews, I just don't want people thinking this table will just keep falling apart on them when that just isn't the case. The pieces lock in firmly. I can't pull them apart when I try to. It's just not THAT flimsy.It uses much less plastic than the Lil' Tykes versions, but it still functions. For the price, it is a good table that will do the job. If you don't care about brands, or you want to get a cheap table to see if they like it before investing in a bigger table, or you want a table for indoors, this is the one to go with.

I love it. I've been making things on a stick all morning and have encountered no problems. They cook evenly. Nothing stuck to the pan and I didn't need Pam. Even cheese did not stick!! They are crisp on the outside, warm and fluffy on the inside and come out super easily. It takes VERY little time! I just love it. I didn't think ahead and get supplies so I had to use what was laying around the house. I stuffed some peppers with cheese, I grabbed some frozen chocolate and banana chunks, I grabbed some cheese sticks and pizza sauce, I grabbed some summer sausage, and my husband had the brilliant idea to use JUST batter and make waffle sticks to dip in syrup, which was genius. So, it is NOT junk to us. It's a joy! To address some negative reviews, my batter did not 'go everywhere' because I poured carefully. None got into cracks that are hard to clean or anything like that. If you can pour cake batter into a cupcake pan without a disaster, then you can do this also. Yes, it's too small for a full hot dog. That doesn't matter to me. It doesn't change the flavor. Someone commented that their batter came out too dry. This isn't the fault of the machine, it is the fault of the recipe. Ours were great and not dry at all. I followed a Bisquick recipe and not one that came with the book. I understand people blaming bad experiences on the machine, but it's not always fair. The machine can't control if you make a mess and it can't control the flavor of what you put into it. Take that into consideration when reading negative reviews. One star off because the sticker on top is crooked and looks cheap.

Don't spend $100 here when it is only $60 in stores. That being said...Pros:-My husband and I both LOVE the music on this toy! It's unlike any other toy's music we've ever had. It's very techno, like rave music. Reminds me a lot of "Castles in the Sky" and songs like that. Very nice change.-It's big! There's stuff to do from every angle.-The lights are pretty.Cons:-Not sturdy enough for baby to pull up on without it trying to tip.-Trampoline only works like 2/3 of the time, so most of the time the balls fall straight to the floor.-It's one of THOSE toys that will go off even when no one is near it.-It's big! It's great fun for baby to explore, but takes up so much floor space. Be prepared to make 4x4 feet of space for it and it won't fold in any way for storage.I may have more bad things to say than good, but I do love this toy. As soon as I saw the commercial, I knew I wanted it. I was more excited about it than my baby was. Having played with it, I would say it is worth $40, but that is for you to decide what it's worth to you. I do recommend it, if you don't think the price is too high. We got it as a gift for her from my husband's parents. I'm not sure I'd have ever paid that much.UPDATE: She NEVER plays with this thing. I can't even get her to play with it when I try. It says 6 months and up, and she is 12 months and not having it. Glad I didn't pay for it!

If you have other Tungsten Carbide rings, you already know this, but for first time buyers, do NOT expect the silver color pictured!! They are gunmetal, which is much darker. Don't expect it to match any silver or white gold you already have. It will only match other gunmetal grey tungsten carbide rings, not silver or white gold or platinum or anything else. they are DARK!They will not bend, they will not scratch, and they will not turn your finger green, but they WILL shatter. Take care not to drop them because they could shatter if they hit the floor. Research tungsten carbide rings for more info.

0:16 MinsI'm usually one to see the best in things and try to argue negative reviews, but I am really disappointed by this toy. I know the balls are designed to roll out, but like everyone else said, they do so immediately. Usually, all the balls will be out before even one song finishes. And when they do roll out, they stay hidden inside the mouth instead of popping out onto the floor - until another ball uneventfully pushes it out, leaving the last balls inside the mouth. So, you have to reach in the tiny hole to get it or tip the whole until over, EVERY time. It's really just like a bass speaker on it's side! Also, when that green thing pops up, while your hand is in it, it hurts! It says 6-36 months if I'm not mistaken, and my 10 month old is not impressed. She enjoys the little balls more than this $25 chunk of plastic. This is such a popular toy; I'm surprised it's such a dud.

LOVED these. They are EVERY bit as good as the Medela and at a tiny fraction of the cost. This was the only way my preemie could latch, but they are clear, so I was forever losing them. At this price, that was okay! I could not afford to do the same with other brands. I only recommend this brand now.

Runs SO small. I was using this size in the Microfleece when our baby was in the NICU so we bought more when we finally came home and the Cotton Knit are MUCH smaller than the Microcfeece and did NOT fit my 6lb baby. I could not believe it was so much smaller! I only wish I'd returned them instead of cutting my losses. I still have them and they were never used.
Several months later and it is still working! I had gone through 3 SD to USB adapters that quit working quickly and decided to just plug my camera in directly.

Mine still haven't broken and I'm not careful with them at all. Sometimes they aren't recognized properly and I wind up using my finger, as in the line I'm drawing will appear just above or below where I drew it.But for the price...

It's a simple smartphone. It has a really small memory and most apps can't me moved to the SD card, so you will only be able to have a small about of apps at a time, because there are several it comes with that it won't let you delete, even though they are crap and you'll never use them. That is a stupid and pointless feature that annoys me.

The toys really suck! I know why it was one of the cheaper models. I should have gotten the farm one like I wanted, but I thought I'd save myself $25. Big mistake. The toys are just awful. I honestly wonder what the development team was thinking. It's only good for jumping. I wish I could exchange it for the farm one. I'm trying to sell it on Craigslist like I did all of my other regrettable baby buys, but no one wants this model.

My baby weighs about 23lbs and this barely fits her now. I knew when I first put it on her at 12lbs that it would not fit her at 40. Also, all her other diapers are pockets, and this one is the only one that leaks within an hour. So, it always needs a 2nd insert, even if it isn't overnight, and even when she was only 4 months old and not a heavy wetter. I go for this diaper last out of all my cloth. I do LOVE the Velcro, though. But the color is a tad more yellow than pictured.

It is plastic with a VERY thin satin-y 'rubber' coating. I could NOT get it off my phone to read the codes under my battery, so I had to pry it off with a utensil and scratched the mess out of my phone, and ripped my nail off the bed. I don't know if I just got a dub, but it would NOT come off!!!
Works for Tom-Tom but also works to charge Playstation 3 controllers, which is what I mainly use it for. Had it for months and it hasn't stopped working.

Every bit as good as the name TomTom name brand. There were visible differences, but it did not lack in function, and the price was outstanding. It's been so many months and it is STILL stuck, even when the temp was over 100 degrees F.
These really came in handy. Clips toys to the highchair, stroller, shopping cart, etc. My baby can't unsnap them yet.

Love these wipes because they are alcohol free, but they could be thicker or softer. Parent's Choice are MUCH softer and Pampers are MUCH thicker. These are very thin, and not very raised. So, they don't grab as much poo, and I wind up using several. But they are at least moist, and each box comes with a new plastic case to refill, and I love the subscribe and save, but I cancelled when the price went up.
I usually use Wondfo tests, but I like these more because they are cased, and I think they are more sensitive. Time will tell.

I like this cup. It has high reviews. It doesn't leak. It's cute. ALL of the parts are perfectly interchangeable with NUK bottles.However, even the slowest flow is really fast. My baby won't use it because she chokes, unlike all her other sippy cups, and the nipple alone costs as much as a new cup! The lids pop of easier than her other cups, too.
One of the only lotions that doesn't burn my skin, which even Johnson & Johnson burns me. It didn't work magic on my baby, but it's at least a safe option.
I can hook my HD computer monitor up to my Playstation 3, but there are no means for sound to play, so kind of pointless.
These test gave a clear, obvious bfp at less than 4 weeks pregnant, so before the end of the 2 week wait.
Only an inch or so short, but it works. Keeps my baby from chewing on the crib railing, and seems to be of a nice quality.
I prefer these to Playtex! They have a firmer bottom, where the Playtex is crushed in at the bottom. They are also reasonably priced, and the stacks come in resealable ziplock bags.
Fixed my tub drain in a jam! Don't know what I'd have done without it. I have a built-in Tip Toe drain, and the rubber thing broke. This barely fit, but works!!!

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*I was completely blown away by this book. I had no idea what to expect when I picked it up and I was glued to the pages the entire time. There was so much going on and all of it was hidden and Clarissa only allows you to see small snippets. I couldn't figure out what was going on, if Julian was a good guy or a bad guy, or whether Gwen was going nuts. I was definitely intrigued by the story and didn't form an opinion until towards the end.Speaking of the end, I did have a bit of an issue with the end. There is a moment that I cannot speak about because it will be a spoiler, but it kind of irked me because it was too quick. It seemed like It could have been written a little differently and it would have been much better and more believable. But, I understand why it happened and I know that it was the right decision. I just didn't like the execution of it. Is it enough for me to not like it or not recommend it? No. It's just a personal irritation of mine that most people may not even pick up on.This story has a lot of different aspects in it: there is humor, romance, suspense, action, and drama. This is a read that will keep you on the edge of your seat for the entire time. Clarissa will take you on a roller coaster of a ride that will leave you breathless and your heart pounding. It is a very hard read to put down once you start. I absolutely loved her gay friend Fenten and loved how doting Seth was. The book made me hungry all the time because Seth liked to cook so he was always cooking some yummy food. It made me wish I had a Seth in my life. I give this 4.5 stars

This installment of Darcy Walker is intense to put it mildly. Darcy does some growing up and maturing in this book. She's still dealing with her mother's murder and can't get her head around her relationship with Dylan. Some very big and scary things happen in Defcon Darcy that leave you on the edge of your seat and holding your breath. There were times when I was reading that I would forget to breathe. I also got scared a time or two when I was trying to figure out how Darcy was going to get out of the particular predicament that she had gotten herself into. I never figured anything out ahead of time and was always surprised when things were revealed. AJ does a fantastic job at keeping things hidden until she wants them seen. That is one of my favorite things about this series, besides Darcy herself.I have loved Darcy Walker from the get go. She is a snarky little spitfire of a gal and has majorly large cajones.  She fights for the underdog because she is one herself. She has a band of misfits as her family because they are just like her. She's inquisitive by nature and doesn't want anyone to be taken advantage of or hurt. She's passionate, strong, sarcastic, and someone you want in your corner. I love her and wish she were real because we could all use a little Darcy Walker in our lives.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*The much awaited third book with the climax of the fight of her life!! Allison has laid everything on the line and is trying to fight for her mom, her dad, Ethan, and the rest of the Danaan people. She has sacrificed so much for this fight and to become the person that everyone thinks that she is. So many things have gone wrong and she's lost so much but can she do it?This was such a great conclusion to the trilogy. It was emotional and had some curve balls thrown in that I didn't expect. I really hope that Laura writes some more about the Danaan and Allison. It would be kind of cool to see a prequel of this series or possibly one for in the future, maybe with Allison's children. I'm going to miss these characters and the world of the Danaan. It's such a magical place and the characters are likable and fun. 5 stars.

Oh the angst and emotion that Laura Howard has placed into these books!! I was warned about them before I read them so I knew it was coming. Other people that I have talked to have told me to expect it so I was prepared. This first book, which is FREE on Amazon, definitely hooks you in. The magical world that she's created is breathtakingly beautiful in her description. I can imagine it all with clarity and it makes me want to go to Ireland really badly, even more so than before.I didn't mind that this story is mostly for YA readers as I am a lover of YA stories. Some may find them a little immature, but definitely not so with this one. The subject matter at times is definitely not immature or childish. The love of a daughter for her mother and wanting to help her situation is not exclusive to age. Also the contempt that a daughter has for her long lost father returned isn't going to be something that everyone can relate to but it's definitely not unimaginable. I have personal experience with some of this so it resonated with me. I am glad that I read these back to back as I don't know how long I could have waited in between books. I give The Forgotten Ones 5 stars.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*Stone of Destiny picks up right where The Forgotten Ones leaves off. Allison definitely does not get a break at all in this second installment as it is full of action, too. Allison is worried about her mom, Ethan, Aoife, her dad.....she hardly has any time to worry about herself.I felt so bad for Allison having to go through all of these crazy things and to not be able to tell anyone what was going on. I definitely wanted her to get with Ethan and make a relationship with him and trust him, but she can't trust anyone. It sucks to be going through stressful situations and not to be able to tell anyone for fear that they will either kill you or not believe you, not that I would know what that feels like, but I can imagine. I was just as hooked to this one as the first one.

I liked the costume over all. The "skirt" part and the pants fit well. The top was too short. It kept riding up. I did not use the boot tops as I had found some boots that I liked. The belt is way too small to wrap around twice like the model has it, unless of course you are as stick thin as the model. The bandana was great and easy to put on. Everyone loved my costume so it was a big hit.
I purchased these for my 11 year old daughter. They are gorgeous!! She absolutely loved them. She did not want to take them off and tries to find any excuse to wear them. Great shoe.

I bought 3 of these chairs. All 3 of them lost the pressure in the pneumatic shock so the chair would start sinking. I contacted the company when the first one went out and they sent me a replacement shock. The other 2 started later and I tried contacting them again and heard NOTHING back from them. So, I have 2 of these chairs that can't be raised sitting at my business for "extra" seats. I wound up buying two of these instead (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0046TR4IW/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1). MUCH better purchase.The chair is pretty comfortable and if you can get it to stay in one position (not all the way down), then it's a fine chair, especially for the money.

I absolutely love this series! The characters and their relationship dynamics are so emotional and complicated. There is a lot happening in this second book. Some questions are answered while many more others are unearthed.Ever mysterious and ever brooding Oz has decided to attach himself to Khara as if he were her shadow. And there are sure to be some fireworks when Hades finds out about this new "arrangement." This installment has a lot of Oz and Khara interaction and the sexual tension is building. There are times when they are mere inches from each other in the heat of a discussion and you keep waiting for someone to make a move. I'm not going to say if it ever happens as that would spoil the book for some but Amber is the queen of sexual tension/frustration with her characters.I am not sure how I feel about Oz or Persephone and this book didn't help me to decide. I am not sure if I want Khara to be with Oz and I am very leery of Persephone. I think both Oz and Persephone are selfish and I'm not sure if Khara can change this trait. I am in love with Kierson and I wanted (needed) more Kierson in this book. I am seriously looking forward to the next book. If you haven't read the first book of this series, go get it NOW and read it.

*I was given a copy of this audio book by the publisher in exchange for an honest review.*I started out listening to the audio book for The Woodlands, but I changed to reading the Kindle format after about 25% way through. I am not a huge audio book listener, so I'm not sure if it was just me but the narrator was just a tad over the top for me. It was almost like she was adding extra emphasis to all the words and not just the ones that needed emphasis. I was intrigued by the story so I went and downloaded the e-book (Free!!) from Amazon and finished it that way.I am really glad that I got the e-book copy and finished the story that way. I really enjoyed the story, the characters, and the drama. Everyone always uses the phrase "twists and turns" and there are some moments, fairly early, where you are completely shocked as the story unfolds. I would call these "jaw dropping" moments as that is kind of what happens when you read them. The author is very adept at making these surprising and not expected, which I tend to like. I would give the audio book version a 3.5 but I give the overall story 5.

I initially received a copy of this book several months ago. I have read other books by Jake and have enjoyed his style of writing. He's a master of his craft and can transport you into the story as though you were a secondary character. He makes you see and feel things and lights a fire in your soul with each tale. You don't so much as read a story that Jake writes, but you go on a journey, an adventure. You truly get lost in the story and forget all else. The Tigress is no exception to these feats. It definitely is a story that takes you away to another place and time but the emotions and drama that you experience are real. You will encounter many feelings on this trip so be prepared. However, it's not a journey you want to miss.

I actually read this story first when it was included in the Stroke of Midnight Anthology. I loved it then and I love it now. I really enjoyed this wacky family. Even though they are "odd," I still get a connection to them because isn't everyone's family a little odd?  I wish this story was longer because I could read a whole book about these people.

I sincerely love R.L. Stine books. My daughter's love them as well. We read this one together and we all enjoyed it. The humor and suspense in this story is really good. It held the kids attention (aged 9 and 11) which is a hard thing these days. They loved the story and the characters and how spooky and creepy it was. They own a lot of R.L. Stine books and look forward to all of his new ones. My youngest one loves zombies and anything to do with zombies so this one was her favorite.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*I love reading children's books even without my children present. Having reluctant readers, I try to read children's books and then if they are really good, then I get them to read them. It seems to work as they have found new favorites this way. With children, it's about the excitement and enthusiasm I have found. You've got to transfer your enthusiasm for something to them and it'll usually catch like fire.This book about Byron being a werewolf and not being able to howl is a very embarrassing thing to him. He doesn't want anyone to know but doesn't know how to solve it. This book is good at helping kids relate to Byron and to show them that they aren't the only ones that are afraid or embarrassed. It also helps them understand how to help with these issues. It is a very well written story and the illustrations are cute.

I was among the lucky few who received an ARC from the author.I have been a Ruby fan for a long time. The characters, settings, situations, and world that Amber creates is like long lost memories from your past; like having amnesia and reading your old diary entries to try and remember. Each and every story gets inside your head and leaves its mark. These stories not only become part of you but part of your past, present, and future. You cling to each story in anticipation of the roller coaster ride that your friends are going to take you on. You cry for these people; scream at them for stupid s***; get scared for them; and laugh at their humorous nature.  They aren't stories so much as a missing part of who you are.In Strayed, a lot of things happen and most all of the questions that have been posed have been answered. But it also brings new questions to light. This story isn't over by any means. Not yet. There are more trials and tribulations and adventures yet for the gang. Some, I'm sure, will be hard to bear, but Amber does a great job of helping you make peace with it. But know this: when you pick up Caged and start reading, you are making a commitment to these people. You will weather the storm and go on the roller coaster even though you are afraid of heights. And every second of it will be worth it.
