If someone were to ask what my all time favorite series is, I'd have a hard time picking just one. However the Rose Gardner series is one I'd mention because it is awesome. Rose gets into shenanigans, sometimes through no fault of her own, and has a devil of a time trying to get out if it. There is suspense, drama, action, humor, and love. The characters are great and the writing is superb.I have not read anything by Jana DeLeon except this but that's about to change. The eccentric ghost Helena is a hoot and I'd like to read more about her hoodlumery. These two characters mesh well together and I could envision lots of scenarios where they end up having to help each other out.

*I received this item from the seller in exchange for an honest review.*Another reviewer had said that it was almost too overstuffed and too overfull. I'd have to agree with that. It seemed it was too full and I got the confirmation when the zipper broke on it's own. Basically the zipper split and ripped. The only thing that was going on at the time was I was laying my feet on it, propping them up. When I picked it up to move it off of the bed, I noticed that the zipper had pulled apart.Other than the zipper issue and the overfill, it is a very decent bolster. If it was less full and the zipper beefed up, it would be perfect.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*I enjoy zombie books and apocalypse books even though it seems that there are tons of them out there. I tend to like the different zombie & apocalypse books. You know the atypical ones that have a different scenario and the zombies are different. Accumulation definitely falls into that category. It isn't the normal zombie story. The end of the world scenario happens differently and most people don't even know what is happening. The zombies are different in that they are kind of a hybrid type of zombie. The way that the "virus" is spread is different as well. You definitely don't know what to expect in this book.I enjoyed the story and the differences that the author had in it. It was definitely not boring and I was pretty much glued to the story. There are a lot of characters in this book and sometimes it's a little difficult to remember who each person is but it doesn't detract from the story at all. It was a fairly quick read and was entertaining. I give Accumulation 4 books.

I really wanted to like this book but I couldn't. I purchased it on Amazon to read after the original reviewer was unable to read it. First of all, the book needs some editing. I found multiple typos and the use of the wrong word, such as "would of" and "should of" instead of "would have" and "should have." There was also a lot of redundant phrases and the overall book was wordy. There was so much inner dialogue and I felt the book was really unnecessarily long. Some of the fight scenes went on for pages. I didn't connect with the characters. It was told from third person and just jumped all over the place with them so you never got a good feel for them. I didn't finish the book. I got to 80% and just couldn't read any more. Someone else may like this book, but it was not for me. I will give it 3 books though as it could be better if it had some serious editing.

*I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*Even though I was given a copy of this book, I bought a copy as well. I tend to do this with books that I love so that way I have the final copy in my possession. My pal and fellow hooligan, Joood at Platypire Reviews harassed me about Lindy's books a long time ago. I have read other books that she has written (not all of them yet), but I think Roomies is my favorite so far. I enjoyed the emotions that were on display throughout the book. The anguish Kennedy felt when she would think about or look at Graham was real and palpable. I mean, we've all been there at least once in our lives. Kennedy is also a fantastically hilarious and sarcastic character that I enjoyed immensely. Her interactions with Graham and Blake were awesome and the relationship she has with them is perfect.I loved that even though this was a romance, there wasn't sex or overly mushy sentiments being slung around. There was no one calling the other "babe" or "baby" which I loathe. Lindy is real adept at portraying the dynamic and complicated emotions that are involved when there is a secret crush or secret love. I was able to put myself in Kennedy's position and I was able to relate with her on a personal level. She is an awesome character and I hope to see more of her in the future. I give Roomies 5 books.

Tim Miller is all kinds of creepy. Well, his stories are I should say. I read one and I think "Man, that is effed up!" or " Holy $h*t that's scary as hell!" But then, I pick up the next book and he's taken my expectations to a whole new level. I always think that with the latest one, there's no way he can top it and then he does. I think he does it on purpose. I think he's as calculating as some of the miscreants that he writes about. How else would you be able to explain the new levels of creeptastic horrors that seem to come forth with each new story? Keep `em coming Mr. Miller.

I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.I started reading this book and it immediately hooked me in. I could not put the book down and read it in one day. Yes, this is a zombie book, but it is not the usual zombie book. The main female character, Jackson, is a complete bad a$$ in every sense of the word. She may resemble a tiny little pixie, but she definitely does not act that way. She has been on the run from the zombies and she's trying to stay alive all on her own. She has to prove to these men that want to protect her that she doesn't need any protecting, not with her trusty machete "Mandy" by her side. However, she wants a sense of normalcy that she hasn't had in years and she's not sure if it even exists.This is a fascinating story and an adrenaline rush from the first page. I had to stop myself from reading ahead to see what happened because it was so intense. The roller coaster ride is one that I really enjoyed and will highly recommend this book to anyone that likes to read a fast paced, different kind of zombie story.

This is the first series I had read by Denise Grover Swank. I can't remember how I found out about her but I am super glad that I did. I really enjoyed the Chosen Series and the premise of the book was really unique. I enjoyed Emma and Will and their tumultuous relationship. The series is gripping, entertaining, and has you on the edge of your seat through every book. I heard a rumor that this series might get picked up again and continued. God I hope so.

I read this book once and had to read it again. I wanted to read it again before I saw the movie. I forgot what happened and I wanted to see if I agreed with Ben Affleck as Nick Dunne. I loved this book the second time around more than I did the first time. I absolutely wholeheartedly agree with Ben Affleck as Nick Dunne and I could picture him in the role as I read the book. I can't wait to see the movie and see what David Fincher does with this story. It is intense, nail biting, and suspenseful. You have no idea what the hell is going on until the very end. Love books like this.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review*This book has a lot of similarities to The Hunger Games and a couple of movies that I've seen, namely one called Cube that came out in 1997. It was predictable and mostly unoriginal. The action and adventure weren't really high energy or nail biting. The story twists weren't really exceptional. Kira was an odd character and where I was supposed to like her and feel empathy for her and she was supposed to be strong, it didn't happen. She was mainly a walking contradiction. Things were left out there for you to guess or left unresolved. The concept of the Countdown and the explanation of the makings of it were cliche. I kept hoping for something different and exciting to happen, but it never did.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review*I love the science fiction and fantasy genres. When going through the requests for reviews, I generally pick all of them and claim them for myself. I hardly ever let the other reviewers have a chance to read them. That's why it's good to be the boss!  So, when this one came across, I snatched it up.This book is pretty fast paced and action packed. The main characters, Vaush and Comron, are very complex and deep. I enjoyed their banter and conflict in the story. There were many twists and turns in the book that I didn't see coming. You never know what's going to happen with them from one minute to the next. Are they going to give in to desires and their feelings or are their family bonds too strong? Very intriguing and nail biting scenes between these two with respect to their families.One thing that I will say about this book is that there is some sexy time scenes in it. I have issue with them because the author uses the word "member" for the man's private part and uses "moistness" for the woman's private part. Really? That is so not sexy. I really wish that authors would use the correct verbiage. Call it what it is. Don't put a sickening or hilarious adjective for it instead. We're all adults here. If you can't use the words to describe the parts, then maybe you shouldn't write a detailed sex scene and just fade to black. So, I will have to "ding" the author for that and can only give this story 4 books. But, I will be looking out for the next book in the series as it definitely has my interest.

All Blues is a fantastic, gripping, sexy, roller coaster of a ride. Ethan "Blues" Sloane is a manly hunk of a man that's not going to let anything or anyone get in his way of taking down the people that wronged him. But, he doesn't plan on meeting Angel, an enticingly volatile and dangerous woman that Blues can't stop thinking about.Marie's writing just gets better and better. Her sex scenes are intense and are very vivid and imaginative. However, this story isn't just sex; there is a lot of mystery, intrigue, drama, etc going on at the same time. Blues is a very demanding character in everything he does and he is definitely the kind of man that women want in real life. He is caring, giving, loving, but troubled as well. Angel is mysterious, sensual, head strong, and can't keep popping up when Blues least expects it.This is an amazing story to go along with the All series. It is a hefty read, but it doesn't feel like it when you are reading it. You are clinging to the pages trying not to rush ahead to see what happens because then you would miss the lyrical writing style that is all Marie's. I don't like romance novels, but I'll read any that Marie writes.

I was both excited and upset about the release of this book. I am elated to read more about the curse and what Ellie and Collin were going to do with all the demons running amok. At the same time, I don't want the story to end. I love these characters and I like the roller coaster ride that they took me on. It was actually hard for me to believe that Denise was going to be able to wrap everything up and give Ellie, Collin, and David a happy ending. Well, I'm not going to spoil anything for you readers, but let's just say that I didn't see that one coming!! Holy Hell the curve balls this lady threw during this story!! Seriously! I thought the rest of the books were edgy and suspenseful and unpredictable. Denise completely blew those thoughts right out of the water. This book was more tense, suspenseful, emotional, scary, terrifying, and frustrating than the other two books put together! She really did save the best for last.This was a great way to end this trilogy. I really and truly didn't expect the story to weave itself the way that it did. But it makes sense. The Curse Defiers answers a lot of questions and raises a whole slew of new ones at the same time. It is rumored that we haven't seen the last of Ellie, David, and Collin. The way this book was written leaves room for more books to follow should Denise decide to write more (YES PLEASE!). I was sad, hollow, empty, and felt all alone when I finished the book. I totally had a book hangover from this one because I just couldn't believe that it was over. I am going to be passing along subtle (yeah, right!) hints to Denise that she can't quit this series and that she has to at least let me have some more Collin. He is a very interesting, frustrating, and sexy character. He's trying to be a good guy but he's good at being bad. If it weren't for the connection between Ellie and Collin, Collin could have his own series by himself and I would be all over it. There aren't too many "book boyfriends" that I get emotional about, but he's one of them! Please get this series and help me "hint" to Denise that she needs to write more!!
This is such an amazing book. I laughed, I cried, I clung to the pages totally engrossed in the story. This is a must read. I read it 3 times already!!

*I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.*I read Alice Tribue's first series and really liked it. Yes, it's a romance, but I enjoyed the story and the characters. When I read the synopsis for this story, I thought that it sounded good. I knew by reading the synopsis that this wasn't going to be a typical romance story. When I say typical I mean the kind of story where the boy and girl meet and are in love within the first 10 minutes of meeting. There is an attraction and a pull to them. Ugh, please. The story of Everly and Luca is most definitely not typical. Everly and Luca HATE each other. They literally can not stand to be in the same room as the other and they have never gotten along since the very beginning. Time isn't a helper in that fact either.Everly and Luca spend a lot of time bickering and hating each other that you aren't quite sure what's going to happen. It's one of those stories where you are asking yourself "Where is this going? How are they going to go from this pure hatred to anything else?" It's like a train wreck at times because you just know that when they get together something explosive is going to happen. And it's never a safe bet on which side the instigation is on. I give Unspeakable Truths 4 books.

Purchased this for my wife on a whim and surprise, surprise, she loved it!!  You can dress it up with black slacks for the office/a night out, or go more casual and pair it with jeans. Either way it looks great.

Wish I'd read the reviews. One of the worst purchases I've made on Amazon. This is the type of item you might find at the dollar store, and even then, given its ridiculously small size, you'd likely conclude it was overpriced. It's seriously 3 inches tall!! It's so small that if you put it on a table, most people wouldn't even notice it.

This printer is virtually identical to model 7525 when is exclusively sold at Costco. I've looked at the two versions in person and can't tell a difference except for the model number on the front. I assume they change the model number to prevent "best price guarantees" having to match Costco's price.  I purchased this HP printer at Costco because my last HP printer was extremely temperamental, but this one isn't any better. Given the current state of printer technology HP shouldn't be producing printers this unreliable. Initial set-up wasn't as easy as advertised, but was doable. It worked flawlessly for about a month before the problems started cropping up.  First, even though it shows it's on the network my devices are completely unable to locate the printer.  This is a constant problem when the printer comes online from hibernation mode.  The only way to get it discoverable by my PC's and Mac is to turn the printer off and then back on.  At which point it's back in business.  This process worked for a couple months, but then I discovered that when I turned it off using the power button it wouldn't turn back on. Seriously, what else could go wrong.  I've fiddled with it for 10-15 minutes at a time trying to get it back on when we urgently needed something printed and the only thing that works (and even then less than 1/4 of the time) is to unplug the power cord from the back of the device and wall, wait a little bit, and then plug it all back in. IF I'm lucky, at that point it will power back on.  More often than not it won't.  If I try the power button again a few hours or days later, it will usually turn on, but by then whatever we needed to print in the first place is long past due. This is the most insanely frustrating device I've ever owned.

I purchased this HP printer at Costco because my last HP printer was extremely temperamental, but this one isn't any better. Given the current state of printer technology HP shouldn't be producing printers this unreliable. Initial set-up wasn't as easy as advertised, but was doable. It worked flawlessly for about a month before the problems started cropping up.  First, even though it shows it's on the network my devices are completely unable to locate the printer.  This is a constant problem when the printer comes online from hibernation mode.  The only way to get it discoverable by my PC's and Mac is to turn the printer off and then back on.  At which point it's back in business.  This process worked for a couple months, but then I discovered that when I turned it off using the power button it wouldn't turn back on. Seriously, what else could go wrong.  I've fiddled with it for 10-15 minutes at a time trying to get it back on when we urgently needed something printed and the only thing that works (and even then less than 1/4 of the time) is to unplug the power cord from the back of the device and wall, wait a little bit, and then plug it all back in. If I try the power button again a few hours or days later, it will usually turn on, but by then whatever we needed to print in the first place is long past due. Purchased this for a family beach/resort vacation and it did the job perfectly.  It's cavernous and holds a ton of kids water toys, towels, sunscreen and reading material. It's also surprisingly durable, after a week or hard use it still looked brand new. I'm not wild about the color and wish they offered more color options, but I accepted the neon color when I made the purchase so I can' subtract a star for it being neon now.  On the plus side, the neon isn't easily missed or left behind, which is probably a good thing.

I was skeptical, but these definitely did the job.  My son is gaga over Pokemon though he's a little too young to play. He generally reads about the characters, memorizes their levels and abilities and compares their strength. These cards were a huge hit. He couldn't get over how many great cards I had gotten him for his birthday. There were no duplicates in the 25 card bundle.Now I'll caveat my review by saying that for my purposes these cards were perfect, BUT if you're actually a Pokemon player, you may or may not be as excited about these cards. I don't play, so I can't say for certain how powerful or rare these are.  Also, I should note that I purchased 2 separate sets of these "25 Rare Pokemon Cards with 100+ HP", and between the two sets, only 8 were duplicates, which I thought was a lower number than I'd expected.

When it comes to beach balls they'e got to inflate easily and stay inflated, and all 12 I received worked on both counts. We brought them on a vacation to an all-inclusive resort in Mexico where we were meeting a number of other families. They received a week of constant use and held up well. Given their price I think we got out money's worth.

I was looking for a back-up basketball to use with our indoor (over the top of a door) basketball hoop.  It's worked extremely well.  It's durable, but soft enough to not damage furniture when the inevitable accidents happen.  It's also a good, intermediate size for my kids who are aged 7 & 9.

Initially I loved this trash can. The infrared was super handy, and with plenty of room for both trash and recycling it held all our family's kitchen waste. The catch was that after 2 months of use the infrared lid has slowly stopped working over the course of the last couple weeks. At first it would only go up half way, and then day by day, it would open less and less. I double checked the batteries, and they were still strong, but I changed them anyway, just to be sure. No luck. At this point we're opening it by hand, which isn't convenient because there's really not much of a handle to use. While it worked, it was awesome, but getting a couple months use out of a trash can is rediculous.

I was an early adopter and purchased my first Tivo back in 1999. My girlfriend at the time (future wife) complained that I needed another electronic component added to my already impressive A/V stack like I needed a hole in the head. Funny thing though, within a couple months when she'd come over to my place I noticed that she'd always ask "What's on TiVo?", not "What's on TV?"  From that point forward, while she might complain about a new TV or stereo purchase, she's never once complained about me upgrading my TiVo boxes as new versions with better features are rolled out.  At this point my TiVo's are just about perfect. It has universal search across all my digital content - Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu, etc. We couldn't be happier or more satisfied.

This is a very cheerful, colorful and beautiful neckless.  It's definitely a more casual jewelry item, but given that limitation, I think it's great!!  Both my wife and daughter wear it, and it looks terrific on both of them.  It's also quite durable, which is a nice plus.

These are very nice smaller artificial Christmas trees.  We purchased one for each of our children's bedrooms. They are surprisingly nice looking for the price. When they arrive you'll need to rearrange the branches a bit - bend them into their proper positions - but that's standard for artificial trees.

We just purchased our second one of these burr mills and overall we've been quite pleased with this item. The first one lasted about 3.5 years, and while I think that's a decent length of time, in this day and age I think appliances should work a bit longer than that. That's the main reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. Over the years it's worked great. The ability to adjust how fine it grinds is nice, though once we fiddled with it a bit and figured out our preferred level (medium) we never adjusted it again. There's usually some grounds build-up on the side of the canister, but I understand it's common with most all burr grinders, and it wasn't a huge problem. For anyone curious, we replaced our old one after the motor burned out.

I purchased these for my 9 yr old daughter who loves this sort of stuff and she wears them all the time.  From my perspective (dad) they actually look like a quality piece of jewelry instead of something disposable like much of her other stuff.  As long as she doesn't lose them I think she'll get a lot of use out of them.

When camping or around Xmas time when putting out the lawn decorations I never seems to have enough decent length pegs, and this purchase has fixed that problem. These are decent sized and reasonably strong, and should meet most people's needs if you're looking for something of this sort.

My wife seems to love them. While I've learned to be a bit cynical when she says she loves the jewelry I give her, the proof is determined by how often she wears the item, and these are getting a lot of action. The have an Art Deco look to them, which is quite different than most other earrings. I think they look pretty cool. I purchased them as a Daily Deal and think it was a fair price given how much use they are getting.

I've never purchased Field  & Stream clothing before so I wasn't sure what to expect.  It was a Amazon Daily Deal at a nice savings, so I pulled the trigger. It's a decent item, looks good, and reasonably well made. It will definitely go into my winter clothing rotation. I think $15-20 is a fair price for this item, but anything over that is probably too much for what you're getting. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with the item, it's just that I was hoping for a bit more heft/thickness given that's Field & Stream. It's fine, but thickness wise it's similar to a quality t-shirt. I buy similar shirts at Costco or Target for $15-$20 so that's my reference point.

It's hard not to give this product 5 stars. They are Xmas ornament hooks, they are a darker green which blends into the tree, which we like, and there are a ton of them. Nothing to complain about. They do the job!!
This item looks exactly as described. Size, color, shape, etc.  It's a nice sturdy little basket which exactly meets my needs.

I've tried a large number of travel coffee mugs and each one seemed to come up short in one area or another.  This is the only model which has come close to hitting a home run. It keeps my coffee hot/warm for most of the day. It's virtually spill proof regardless of what you're doing. And it actually looks halfway decent!!  My one minor issue is that the underside of the lid isn't super easy to clean, but with a good brush it's doable.  It's also not an issue if you rinse the container shortly after each use (something I'm not always great about doing until the next day when I use it again).  Overall I highly recommend this item. Now if only I could get my wife to stop losing the ones I've bought her and then taking mine.

ARC provided by Entangled Publishing, LLC via NetGalley for an honest review!This story had me hooked from the beginning. It was real and every-day. I REALLY liked that about the plot and I enjoyed the heck out of Ryan and Jules! Their flirting and back and forth banter was cute, sassy and refreshing. These are two people I could easily see in my circle of friends!Let me tell ya how these two start out a relationship, or rather what Ryan does to start this relationship going ... he decides that he's gonna try out the suggestions in an article he read in Cosmo (yeah, that magazine lol) titled "6 Ultimate Steps to the Perfect Summer Fling" ... cue, ME laughing a lot thru this book!One thing I want to point out is the age of these two. Remember they are college students. So when you read this, there is gonna be a lot of corny things said and a lot of cliches going on, but if you read it in the right context, you WILL enjoy it. So read it for what it is and enjoy the corniness that is Ryan and Jules! And yes, it IS predictable, but it's supposed to be. This is not a drama filled angsty story. It's two kids on a summer fling that end up ..... (read and find out) HAPPY READING EVERYONE!

I love historical reads. There's something about them that always put a smile on my face. This one was no exception. As a matter of fact, it put more than a smile on my face, I was truly happy while I read this story.From their first introduction, Catherine Malboeuf and Nicholas Adair kept me captivated. The sparks that flew between these two were palpable. They flew of the pages and made me want to read more and more. Catherine's personality was irresistible. She was witty and bold and smart and just beautiful. Nicholas was strong and aloof and standoffish at the beginning, but with each passing turn of events he became more heartwarming and quite likeable!This wasn't just a romance story. Quite a few things happen throughout the book that allowed it to be a mini mystery alongside a romance story. There are twist and turns to this story and even though you know we are headed to a HEA, it wasn't an insta-love or even insta-attraction. It was a growing story and I loved every page!I am REALLY glad I finally took the time to read this wonderful story and am now looking forward to a lot more from Ally Broadfield!!ARC provided by Entangled Publishing, LLC via NetGalley for an honest review

.This book is my favorite so far of the Santini series!Elena is a force to be reckoned with and JT was her perfect match!Elena happens to be the younger sister of his best friend. That puts her off limits. Until it doesn't. They're both attracted to each other, and clearly the way to solve that issue is to have one night of unbridled passion and leave it at that. Because that always works (lol)There's a lot going on in this story and it makes it a page turner you just will not want to put down. From misunderstandings to family butting to a little bit of suspense but most of all, the chemistry these two produce will burn the pages of your reader! #TRUST

And again I say ...... hooraaaaayyyyyy for Historical smuttiness ! LOLLavinia Kent managed to tell us a funny, loving tale of romance and HEA along side a hugely erotic and kinky tale!This is the story of Bliss Danser, Lady by day, kinky sex-kitten by night (lol) and Stephan Perth, Gentleman by day and kinky dominant by night. Put them together and you have absolute perfection !Sounds too easy, right? Maaaaaybe ..... you see, Lady Bliss doesn't exactly want to be married. She wants to be free of the constraints marriage brings. And if she DOES have to marry, it most certainly will NOT be to Stephen Perth! Why you ask? I'll say this and only this .... Because she knows he's the only man capable of breaking down her resolve and she just might fall in love! But Stephen has other plans. He's waited what seems like a lifetime for Bliss. And nothing is stopping him from having her. And as soon as Stephen figured out the other side to Bliss .... that was all the ammunition he needed to force her hand and show her love and marriage weren't the devil!I had a really good time reading this story! Truth be told, this whole series has been fun for me. The story is light and easy and fun to read. The characters are witty and fun and it's HOT!ARC provided by Random House Publishing Group - Loveswept via NetGalley for an honest review!

This is a story of two people, Robert Edwards Jr. and David Gregory , who found each other when neither knew they were lost :)Robby is pretty happy with his life as it is. He owns his own coffee cart, lives with friends who don't judge his lifestyle choices and every day at 11:50 am, there's a bright spot to his day. That's when David comes to his coffee cart to have a coffee. Every day. Same coffee. Same time .... bright spot :)David is not so happy with his life, or so it would seem. The book is told in Robby's POV so it is difficult to nail down David's feelings and thoughts. However, it's painfully obvious that he is closed off and the reason why. I would have loved a dual POV to this story so I could be inside David's head and know the true trial and tragedy of the past, but it was still an excellent book as is.SO David and Robby do the dance. You know the one ... a smile here, a touch there ... and while they danced, they became fast friends. So in reality, this was more of a friends to lovers story, but it just happened instantaneously. And that was perfect for these two. It was a beautiful blossoming to read. I loved every minute of this story. From building their friendship to becoming lovers. It was all very endearing.There are a lot of societal issues in play in regards to their lifestyle in this story and they were all dealt with care and finesse and very true to life.ARC provided by Kensington Books via NetGalley for an honest review

This story is not about a 'story'. It's a quickie! Kinda like watching a YouTube video. SO, please don't expect something that is just not attainable in a few chapters. You're just setting yourself up for disappointment. It's not like it doesn't tell you how long this actually is.....Anywhoooo, it's quick. It's dirty fun. It's a menage. It's sexy and it's hot ..... any questions? LOLCopy provided by NetGalley for an honest review

ARC provided by Patchwork Press - Cooperative: Amazon via NetGalley for an honest review.Well this was another wickedly fun story :) The story definitely lives up to the title ~ Hard & Fast !! Not only do Rose & Cole fall hard for each other, but they fall fast!Rose Weatherston is an out of work actress. She was top in her acting class, but can't get a decent job. Cole Dean is an international movie star on the cover of every tabloid!Opposites attract, right?! ;) Well they do here .... lolSo the story goes like this ... it's quite simple really (but really cute), Rose needs a job and Cole needs a live-in assistant. And there begins our journey to HEA ...This story was short and quick, but it was funny and sexy and had quite a few smutty moments. It was an overall sexy witty read that you shouldn't miss!

.Every once in a while, you read a book that really stands out in your mind. It stays with you after you finish reading it. THIS is one of those books.Two more opposite people could not have been brought together but what a beautiful thing it was to read! Their connection and chemistry was instantaneous and jumped off the pages. They had great wit and banter and kept me entertained throughout the book.This book made me laugh and smile and just gave me an all around good feeling. It's not one to miss!ARC provided by Gallery, Threshold, Pocket Books via NetGalley for an honest review

This is not your typical second chance story. THIS is a story of a second chance at first love.Eve Grayhawk and Connor Flynn have known each other their whole lives. They've also secretly held each other in each other's hearts their whole lives. But what you wish is not always what you get in life. Things happen. Life happens. Basically, Eve's best friend was in love with Connor and because Eve's family and Connor's family have been mortal enemies since the beginning of time, it was easy to hide their feelings for one another and let Connor ride off into the sunset with someone else.,,,But that was then and this is now .....Today, Connor finds himself a single dad in desperate need for help. He's had to battle the system for custody of his children and really needs stability for them. Cue our lovely Eve .... What starts out as a friend helping a friend turns into one of sweetest most heart-warming romance developments I have read in a very long time. Couple that with all the hilarious family feuding and one ridiculous 'incident' after another and you've got yourself the PERFECT read.This was my first read for this series and I didn't feel I had lost a single thing even tho it is a #13. Joan Johnston does an excellent job of making sure you get the back story you need and now I'm hooked on all things Bitter Creek!ARC provided by Random House Publishing Group - Bantam Dell via NetGalley for an honest review
