First, when I chose Adjust Photos tab, then chose Suggested Settings, the prog radically improved most pix.  Second, and most important, the lighting in the room was patchy, but within the Adjust Photos tab, there is an applet called Fill Light/Clarity  that within the most badly lit areas will increase brightness and reduce shadows, while leaving well lit areas alone, so that there is much more even illumination throughout the entire picture.  In very little time, I was able to rescue a number of shots that had good content but poor lighting, and out of about 40 shots got 11 really good pictures.

I found the Kona French press to be very well made - the pressing function was smoother than others I've used - perhaps the quality of the mesh is finer or more flexible.  Also the plastic frame enclosing the glass provides more strength - others I've used do not have this support.  I used it to make coffee and found the quality of the coffee excellent - the press did its job well - no grounds escaped into the coffee, and the pressing action was very smooth against the glass.I especially wanted to try it with tea as well - because I thought that a French press could be applied very well to make good quality spiced tea.  I added my usual spices (a stick of cinnamon, some crushed cardamom seeds, a few cloves, sliced ginger and about three teaspoons of loose tea (given the size of the press).I really liked the result - the tea tasted very good - spices came through and balanced well with about 6-7 minutes allowed to brew before pressing.  And the big plus over using a regular teapot is that clean up is faster and the French press strains the tea as part of the way it works (no need for extra equipment - strainers etc).This product has the advantage of having an exceptionally small footprint  compared with a drip coffee maker. Definitely a plus for a  crowded kitchen.COMMENTS TO VENDORI would like to see markings on the side of the flask showing volume in fluid ounces and in metric, to aid in getting proportions right, but this would be hampered by the plastic cage surrounding the flask, but a good designer might find a way.  Maybe put the markings on a diagonal of the cage.Unlike my one cup French press, the flask of this product cannot be removed from its cage for cleaning (or, to be totally accurate, I tried to remove it, and did not succeed). Our other 4 cup coffee press has no cage at all. It has a bottom plastic stand, to provide a stable base, and no cage at all, and a top plastic assembly that is glued to the flask and provides a pouring handle and a bit of extra strength to the unit. Which makes the sides easy to clean.  Being a utilitarian, I prefer this kind of simplicity. But for the stylistas, the product being reviewed has much more pizazz, and I guess cleaning is not much of an issue.  And, more important, the plastic cage no doubt imparts greater strength and reduces the likelihood of breakage of the glass flask.  Might it be possible to surround a glass interior lining with a lexan shell that is unbreakable, allowing a cageless design ?The Amazon ad states a capacity of 34 fl oz.  Filled to the brim with water the flask contains a volume of 38 fluid ounces. However, in practical terms, given the fact that boiling water is a hazardous substance, I would not want to use more than about 28 oz of water. Which still would yield four 7.5 oz cups of black coffee.The product was supplied for free by the vendor with the understanding that I would provide an honest and unbiased review.

I compared this headset with the one that came with my I-phone.PROS== A great big fat plus is that the product comes with 3 sizes of earpieces that cover the speakers,  which allows a better fit to my ear than the headset supplied with my I-phone, that has no sizing option.  In my experience, the earbuds felt more secure in my ears than the original Apple earbuds when I changed from the pre-installed medium size earpiece to the small size. Be careful when changing the earpieces or they may fly off and be hard to find.== The sound is definitely as good as the sound from the original I-phone headset.== Stylish design and well finished.== Nice case for cord storage.== Cord does not tangle as easily as the one supplied with the I--phone.== The product is an inexpensive replacement for the original I-phone earbuds if these are lost or damaged, or if you just want a spare pair, or if the original buds do not fit well.CONS== None yet.UNCERTAINTIESCannot judge durability as yet.  The headset supplied with the I-phone that my office gave me six months ago for work purposes are still working.  I have just now started using these buds.NOTESThis item was supplied to me for free by the vendor with the understanding that I would provide an honest and unbiased review.  The review above  is based on comments made by my wife, who listens to music on her I-phone when going to and from work.  For simplicity, the review is written in the first person.

I have given this product a provisional 5 stars, because while I like it very much so far, I have used it only for a short time.  If my opinion changes I will revise this review and my rating.I switched to this product from Norton 360 (2013 version), not because I disliked Norton 360, but because Eset got a much higher rating by Consumer Reports than Norton Internet Security 2014, and cost about the same, on Amazon.  I always stay a year behind because I have the impression I get the same level of protection as buying the latest version. If any reader knows better, I would appreciate if they would correct me on this.I relied on Consumer Reports in making my purchasing decision because  end users such as I typically do not have the time or technical savvy to test and compare the different internet security packages, so that a Consumer Reports review in my opinion is of very high value, since they have strong resources to conduct proper testing,  and a strong reputation for objectivity.I deployed Norton Removal Tool to dismount Norton, and then installed Eset, on four workstations.  The installs were fast and easy with only a few options and questions.PROS:== When I looked at Consumer Reports online, I found ratings for 14 security software products, updated to September 2014.  Eset got the highest score, of 65. G Data Internet Security 2014 got 64, F-Secure Internet Security  2014 got 60, and all the other 11 products scored below 60.  Kaspersky Internet Security 2014 got 59,  McAfee Internet Security 2014 scored 52, and Norton Internet Security got 50, and Panda Internet Security scored 42.== One can download a 30 day free trial of this product, then license it if you want to keep it.== A great big fat pro in my book is that this product says it covers Windows 2000, XP, Win 7 and Win8.  Why do I like this ?  Because I have Win XP on 2 of my 4 workstations, and Win7 on the other two.  The fact that a reputable company like ESET will cover Windows XP is great news for me, because I know XP inside out, while I am a newcomer to Win7, which I installed only because of Microsoft's threatening behavior vis a vis XP, saying it would cease "supporting" XP in early 2014. I liked XP. It never let me down.  So I am delighted that ESET is supporting XP.  Actually, I also have a semi-retired workstation running Windows 2000, because Win2000 supports some software I wrote using Visual Basic Version 6, but I almost never go online with that machine.== Eset does not slow down my computers, but on the other hand I don't notice any significant improvement over Norton 360. But I should also note that I am running very fast quadcore desktops that rarely slow down for any reason, except when online and encountering slow websites or bad scripts.CONS:== Lacks some of the bells and whistles that my Norton 360 had, like computer tuneups and backups, and password vaults.== Eset wrongly identified a piece of Firefox loader software as a potential threat.  I got on the Firefox user forum and reported the identification.  Several Firefox MVP's scoffed at this and said the Eset database clearly is not totally up to date, and is flagging the Firefox stub as a threat purely because it is not yet in the Eset database of safe software.  So... even Eset is not perfect. In any event, Eset flagged about 15 pieces of software as potential threats, a lot of them freeware that carried dubious companion adware or unwanted toolbars.Most users of Eset will not encounter this, as most Windows users have learned to avoid freeware, since "free" usually means there is a catch, like adware.  I, on the other hand, am somewhat adventurous, downloading all kinds of interesting freeware, which cost me dear in the old days, with several serious virus attacks, the last time being in about 2008.  But recently I have not had any apparent malware attacks.

The volume button on the remote control to my Onkyo home entertainment receiver has become intermittent, requiring heavy pressure, and sometimes not working at all. Today I fixed it by dribbling a drop of Stabilant around the button and rocking the button back and forth. It worked like a charm.An extremely valuable property of Stabilant is that while it enhances electrical contact between conductors, it does not conduct electricity across insulators, so I did not risk creating a short circuit by dropping stabilant into an enclosed space that I could not access.

I got this from Target for $18.On the plus side, this item is beautifully built, stainless steel, highly polished.On the minus side:== It is hard to get all the food out of the jar.  When I filled it with chili, and tried to eat it with a spoon, there were areas of the jar that the spoon could not reach efficiently.== A very major defect is that the mouth is narrower than the base. You will note that eating bowls never have mouths narrower than their bases. There is an excellent reason for this.. the food would be hard to get at.== Another major defect that makes the jar even more difficult to use is that just below the mouth there is a neck that expands outward, as can be seen in the photo, creating a zone that is even harder to reach.== A third major defect is that the threads on the cap are covered so you cannot access them for cleaning.All in all, this is a beautifully built but atrociously designed product.NOTE TO MANUFACTURERS:Nearly all the advertisements for insulated food jars on Amazon have a giant defect. They do not show the jars with the lids off. They do not show what kind of threading is used. The photos should show the inside of the lids so one can tell whether the threading is exposed for cleaning, or obtusely hidden away.  I would also like to see a cross sectional photograph of the jar, cut in half from top to bottom, clearly showing the shape of the interior of the jar.
Superb design. Slim and small. Good clip that does'nt lose its grip. Writes very well. Ink lasts a long time. Best inexpensive ballpoint I've ever had.

I found this item in the Patio, Home and Garden department when I searched for bins, which caused me to assume they are suitable for storing items in wet conditions outdoors. Not so. These are not rainproof.  During rain the lid collects water because it is not sloped enough to allow water to drain, and would allow mosquitoes to breed.

This is good stuff but at this Amazon price it is costing $1.33 a bottle.  Costco sells something just as good for 75 cents per 8 ounce box, namely Kirkland Complete Nutrition.  I always keep a couple of containers in my car just in case I start feeling drowsy (and dangerous).  The Ensure version is in a more convenient container, however.

From the photo in the ad, I expected a water receptacle that was round and wide. Instead, the box contained a receptacle with a very narrow footprint, 1.5" wide by 7.5" long.This design is obviously appropriate for collecting rain droplets, that fall fairly randomly.But I suspect it is inappropriate for collecting water droplets distributed by a water sprinkler of the type that I have, which is likely to contain strong biases in the pattern of water distribution.  My [ASIN:B000TZ716M MELNOR Turbo Oscillating Sprinkler] squirts water through 18 nozzles located on a rotating bar using an aiming process that traverses the nozzles up and down like the guns of a battleship elevating and descending.  If there were no wind, the droplets would fall on narrow tracks, with wide spaces between the tracks. So the distribution of droplets is uneven and not random.For these reasons, I need a collector with a larger surface area than this one.One could check the accuracy of a small footprint rain gauge like this through comparing it with a large footprint item like a 5 foot diameter wading pool.

DID NOT WORK FIRST TIMEI purchased this item about 11 weeks ago. Did not use it until just now.  I inserted this battery pack into a SKIL SC118C-LI 2.6AHR Dual Chemical Charger also ordered 11 weeks ago.  The green light on the charger started winking, indicating it was charging. About 15 minutes later I looked at the charger and the green light had stopped winking and turned to a continuous green. I inserted the battery pack into my Skil XDrive 18 volt drill model # 2887-B2 / F012 2887 02.  I squeezed the trigger. The drill ran just fine.About half an hour later I went to the worksite, took out the drill, and pulled the trigger.  Nada. Nothing. Nichts. Drill did not even rotate. So, I am giving this one star.  Could be either a dud charger (that undercharged but indicated full charge) or a dud battery (lost charge in 30 minutes).WORKED WELL SOME WEEKS LATERWhile it did not work the first time I tried to use it, I gave it a last chance a few weeks ago, because otherwise I would have tossed it.  And lo, and behold, it surprised me and worked very well and has held a good amount of charge up till now, providing good power to the drill.

FIRST CUTI purchased this item about 11 weeks ago. Did not use it until just now.  I inserted a Skil SB18B-LI Slide Base Battery Pack  also ordered 11 weeks ago.  The green light started winking, indicating it was charging. About 15 minutes later I looked at the unit and the green light had stopped winking and turned to a continuous green. I inserted the battery pack into my Skil XDrive 18 volt drill model # 2887-B2 / F012 2887 02.  I squeezed the trigger. The drill ran just fine.About half an hour later I went to the worksite, took out the drill, and pulled the trigger.  Nada. Nothing. Nichts. Drill did not even rotate. So, I am giving this one star.  Or maybe I got a dud battery that lost its charge in 30 minutes, and the one star is quite unfair. In any event, I sure am glad I have a deWalt corded drill on hand.UPDATEA couple weeks ago I retested this item to give it a last chance before tossing it. And, by golly, it worked this time.  I suspect the battery has a first use problem... namely it doesn't work the first time you use it, then mysteriously works quite well the second time and subsequently.

I've been using these 8 of these crystal clear bulbs for about two years arranged around the frame of my bathroom mirror in movie star dressing room layout.  Yesterday I replaced them with four 8 watt  LED bulbs Feit LED Dimmable G25 Decorative Bulb - Uses only 8 watts which give just as much light but consume only 32 watts, as compared to the 320 watts consumed by these incandescent bulbs.

Recently we remodeled a bathroom, with nice fixtures and nice tiles.  I was dissatisfied with the light cast by the floodlight located in the recessed can above the wash basin.  After trying four different floodlight bulbs, I came to the following conclusions.[1]  Dispersion angle of the light beam is very importantIn my opinion, my bathroom looks much better when the beam dispersion angle of the floodlight leaves the walls above waist level in relatively low light, and the wall sections below waist level in a relatively bright light. In the case of my bathroom, I found that the ideal beam angle to achieve this would be about 70 degrees (see Footnote 2 for the method to calculate beam angle).The beam angles of the lights I tried are as follows:== Polaroid (the light reviewed here):  About 65 degrees by my calculation== Bioluz LED Br40 Smooth 17w 2700k 1400 Lumens --  110 degree angle, manufacturer's calculation.== Philips model 429035, 3000K, 1200 lumens  .  25 degree angle stated in Amazon ad== G7  Power Vegas BR40  .  180 degree beam angle.Unfortunately, many manufacturers neglect to state beam angle.[2] LumensI found that between 1200 and 1600 lumens gave pretty bright light.[3] Kelvin color temperatureLight with Kelvin color temperatures between 2,700K and 3,000K is considered to be "warm".  Warm is more flattering to humans, and more pleasant.  I found that temps between 2700K and 3000K worked well for me. Quite possibly a bit higher up to 4000K would also work. See Wikipedia for discussion.[4] The recessed overhead light does not properly illuminate the face of someone using the bathroom mirror.  To accomplish this, we installed an actor's style array of lights around the edges of the mirror./------------------------------------------------------------------FOOTNOTE 1: PROS AND CONS OF POLAROID FLOODLIGHTPROS:(a) it is bright with 1600 lumens ;(b) has a beam dispersion angle that is better for my purposes of illuminating my 5' x 8' bathroom(c) has the best guarantee I have seen, 15 years;(d) very important for my purposes, it has ventilation slots surrounding the light source, so that the exhaust fan which is part of the light fixture can draw more air out of the room (none of the other three bulbs I tested had this type of ventilation slot);(e) it is rated as suitable for damp locations, which is exactly where the lamp will be located, in a recess in my bathroom ceiling.CONSNone that I have yet identified./-------------------------------------FOOTNOTE 2:  If you want the brightest part of the beam to cover the wall below waist height (about 30"), do the following measurements to find the correct beam angle: [a] Measure the distance between ceiling and waist height, and call it D1. So with a ceiling 96" from the floor, D1 will be 96"-30" or 66" (I assume a waist height of 30"). [b] Then measure the distance between the center of the light and the furthest wall, and call it D2.  [c] Then construct on graph paper a right angle triangle where D1 is the perpendicular side, and D2 is the side horizontal to the ground.  Then use a protractor to measure the angle at the top vertex of the triangle. And multiply that angle by two.  If you remember your trigonometry, you can do it that way too.

Edits at the end below:I loved this phone at first and wanted to use it several months before writing a review.  You can read all the technical specifications in the great reviews written by other Amazon Customers.  For $99 at the initial Amazon Price, I was giddy when the package arrived.  I paraded this in the faces of my iPhone-loving fan people.  After all, the package had a working unlocked phone, a screen saver, headphones, a case and a charger - all for under $100.  But wait, there's more!  There are two sim slots and an expandable memory slot.  Too good to be true, BLU?Verdict: Yes (see below).After four+ months of using this several times a week as a secondary phone, the microphone works intermittently and cuts-out in the middle of conversations.  Moreover, sound volume levels are low compared to other phones (please see other reviews with this issue).  I've constantly had to move apps. to the storage card due to space constraints.Problem: some apps. will not move to a storage card; therefore, if you have a lot of these, you will run-out of storage space quickly.  The concept of a cheap unlocked phone with the bundled goodies is good, but due to all the issues, I sadly can't recommend this product due to poor execution. I'd like to see more storage space and a better microphone in future BLU phone iterations.  I would consider purchasing an upgraded version (even if the price is slightly higher) to give a US-based company a second chance.Oh, many months ago a the Lollipop operating system upgrade was promised.  Google just released Marshmallow.  This phone doesn't have Lollipop as it still runs KitKat which is ancient by now.  What's up with this?  Blu - too good to be true.Edit: It's now November 21st and Lollipop is still not available for this phone.  I'm troubled by this.  If a company can't keep promises, why purchase?  Deduction of one more star from the original review above.

This is NOT CNET's pick as depicted on October 24, 2015.  HooToo seems to be misleading potential customers which I find to be less than ethical and makes me question the company's trustworthiness.One CNET columnist mentioned this router and an associated Amazon coupon code.  He didn't review the router; rather, he mentioned other customer reviews on Amazon.  I've read through the reviews and some seem to be paid - consisting of one word like "excellent" or "perfect" or one sentence like "this is the best ever."  Some reviews are written by reviewers who have one or two reviews published with one word and a five star rating.  I wish Amazon would fix this since so many of us rely on customer ratings before making a purchase.I've had this product for a few months and it works, but doesn't always hold a connection before dropping off.  The travel router needs to be reset occasionally by powering off and then on again.  I do like the product, but don't like what appears to be deception.

I like these headphones.  They pair with a phone easily and sound quality is adequate for the gym.  While noise isolation is not active, the on ear headphones do a pretty good job of blocking-out sound.  Others had issues working-out and keeping these on their heads.  I wore a baseball cap underneath the headphones and they remained on my large melon throughout workouts on the treadmill.  What I don't like is that the charging cord frayed after two months and is inoperable.  Therefore, I can't charge the headphones.  I have to purchase a new headphone to get a cord as I can't find the right manufacturer cord (actually in stock) separately.  Emails to MEE (the manufacturer) have gone unanswered.  A bit frustrating to what otherwise would be a good product.  If you get this product, protect the charging cable at all costs.

Got this on a lighting deal for around $40 and that's all it's worth.  For that price, I'll keep the shoe.  I don't like that the toe box is too long, but the shoe width is far too thin. I had to stretch this pair width-wise to even get close to a size D (the shoe is stamped size "D").  The footbed is not removable to accommodate orthotics.  Cushioning is fair to poor so you don't want to walk in these for hours at a time.  Arch support is average, at best.  The shoe leather is soft and requires little break-in, but is not top grain.I recommend the saddle tan for pairing with nice dress jeans and the shoe center seam seems to highlight a long-sophisticated look.  These may be too casual for wearing with a suit.

Perfect shoe and not stiff out of the box.  Size and width are perfect.  I'm a 10.5 in other brands and the 10.5 in this shoe is perfection.  No need to size up or down.  The leather is soft and buttery requiring little break-in time.  The sole appears to be slip-resistant.  Cushioning is average: not too thin so you can wear for a night out on the town, but definitely not something you can walk in for hours upon hours sightseeing without your feet hurting.  The shoe dresses up with a suit or down with blue jeans and constantly gets compliments.  If you wear orthotics, the footbed is removable to accommodate an orthotic!  This shoe is made in Italy (Not China) Hooray!  Pull the trigger on this one before it sells-out; you won't be sorry.

In a quest use natural products, this was purchased this in a local health food store on a whim expecting to reorder on Amazon.  The product cleans OK and eliminates germs naturally due to the Thyme; hence, three stars.  I don't smell the Lemongrass as the Thyme is overpowering and pungent.  This smells like a precise mixture of unwashed underarms, dirty laundry, bug spray and kerosene.  After 36 - 48 hours, the smell seems to dissipate and guests want to come into my home again.  Can't wait until the bottle is gone if it does not land in the recycle bin sooner.I'd purchase again if it smelled better.This is not on the re-purchase list in my household.

I bought four scents of Primal Pit Paste stick and spray sight unseen from the manufacturer's website.  As a man, I don't want to smell like a woman.  The Lavender isn't for men and makes me smell like a floral bouquet.  The Thyme and Lemongrass scent is simply awful and causes stains on all my shirts that will not come out in the wash or at the dry cleaners.  The Royal and Rogue is fine for men (thus, I recommend for men), but it also stains clothes. The Primal Spice scent is also nice for men and seems to stain clothes less than the other scents.All products eliminated underarm odor well; hence, a three star rating.  The Thyme and Lemongrass scent seems to overpower everything so it may simply mask scent rather than eliminate it.  I didn't break-out with a rash like others on here and tolerated the product well.  My hope is the manufacturer reads these reviews and changes the formulary to not stain clothes (minus one star for the staining).  The price point is also high compared to other products on the market which, in my opinion, deducts another star from the rating.PS - I can use the spray on "other areas" of the body to eliminate odor and can report the product works well without presenting a skin rash.

Purchased this from a local pharmacy.  This is the only cream that will help persistent and embarrassing eczema all over the body.  Not bad since I've tried everything on the market (including bleach baths to help the eczema): both prescription and over-the-counter.  My doctor's office has the 42% Urea Solution for the same price, but I can't find that online, so this is the next best option to purchasing from a doctor.  Combined with coconut lotion, all eczema signs disappear within two weeks.  You don't need to use the coconut oil with this product - it simply takes away the light stinging Urea causes and has numerous other benefits you can find with a web search.One warning: be careful not to get urea on your nails as it thins them considerably over time.  I learned the hard way when a finger nail peeled away.  Apply sparingly because the product dries and leaves a white film with something other than your fingertips.

This is a nice shoe, but once you take the inserts out to add orthotics, you see the lousy workmanship on the sole (inside the shoe).  The sole isn't sewn or glued to the upper well.  Attention to detail is lacking.  There tiny pin needle spaces between the sole and the upper where stitches were missed or glue was not added uniformly.  Glue is missing from some parts of the inner-sole or is applied too abundantly in other parts.  I question how long these will last, but they are comfortable for all-day wear right out of the box with no break-in period.  Nothing horribly wrong, but attention to manufacturer detail is lacking.As for fit: perfect.  I'm a size 10.5 in other shoes then these are spot-on.  Width is a perfect "D".  Shoes do not provide good arch support; hence, the addition of orthotics after removing the factory foot bed.  If the glue were uniform and the stitching was better, I'd rate five stars.

This is a long and narrow shoe with built-in arch support.  If you have flat feet, these most likely aren't the shoes for you.  Rather, someone with medium to high arches could benefit from this model.  I have bum legs/feet from various injuries over the years and need comfortable shoes with arch support .  This "fits" the bill from the comfort perspective.  The leather is a bit hard at first, but loosens and becomes buttery with neutral shoe polish and a few wearings.  Allen Edmonds Walnut Shoe Polish make these look too dark; so, neutral is your best bet.The insoles are NOT removable unless you peel the glued-in inserts off to place your own very thin orthotics.  I recommend Superfeet Black as they are one of the thinnest orthotics available.  I don't suggest thick orthotics (like Superfeet Orange) with these shoes unless you size-up.  Even then, the shoes may be far too long.I'm normally a size 10.5 in Cole Haan and the 10.0 fit well with a little tightness over the forefoot.  This loosened with three days of walking and patience.As for aesthetics, the shoe is very good looking and well-made in Vietnam (hence, not China).  Amazon does not list the country of origin at time of this review.  The color is fantastic, but I would not recommend these with a suit unless you are in your early-20s and can pull-off the look without your co-workers thinking you're a complete tool.  I'm older and can't wear what I used to - so won't wear these with a suit.  However,  these look awesome with khakis or jeans even being middle-aged.  I don't think you can resole these so they are basically throw-away shoes when worn-down.If the worthless insoles were easily removable, I'd rate five stars.

This is a beast of a knife and is easier to sharpen than any other Buck I own.  The handle is grippy and the blade comes very sharp and deploys quickly and easily.  Edge retention is superb.  A nylon belt sheath is included.  The knife handle is a little too thick and heavy to make this an EDC.  I'd welcome a smaller version for my daily pocket carry.

I'm writing from the perspective of someone middle-aged with mild hearing loss.  Hopefully this review will help if you are in a similar boat.  I purchased this from Sony almost a year ago for a far higher price than is offered for now.  I've used this daily since primarily for playing music and listening to Umano - a smartphone application that reads news to you.  As an aside, the Umano application is just awesome.  If you don't have it, get it - it's free.  (Note: see update below - voice and music sound far crisper on the Bose Mini purchased a year after writing this review).Some great reviews already tout the technical merits of this Sony product which I will not repeat.For listening to music, as long as you don't turn the volume too high, there is virtually no distortion.  For voice, sound is clear and when turned-up, there is little distortion; although, there seems to be a lot of bass.  I'd like to hear less bass and more treble. However, voice sound is still very good and easy to distinguish when you turn the volume all the way to the top.Using this as a speakerphone is decent, but not great.  Distortion is noticeable when volume is increased, halfway to the highest sound setting, and people on the other end of the phone say it sounds like I'm talking from the inside of a tin/metal tunnel.For someone hearing-impaired who needs to listen at a higher volume; just expect a little distortion.  Nothing too bad and for the current $99 price point, go ahead and push the purchase button.  I just feel it does not warrant a five star rating because of the distortion.  Four stars is still very good in my opinion.  This product seems better for listening to background music at a lower volume - a little less than halfway up to the highest volume setting.A few other reviewers note the unit can fall-over a lot.  I also find this as the side legs don't lock to hold the speaker upright.  They fold-down to make the unit easy to carry when travelling.  I'd like to see the side legs actually lock to hold the speaker firmly in-place.Alternatively, I also have the Sony SRSBTX500 Portable NFC Bluetooth Wireless Premium Speaker System which costs twice the current price of the SRSBTX300 and yields far less distortion when playing music or listening to voice at higher volumes.  At higher volumes, voice seems clearer and far more distinguishable with the Sony SRSBTX500.*****Update:  After owning this for almost a year, it has fallen-over many times.  Does not stay-up for long. Has damaged walls due to it being heavy and the stand (arm) being flimsy.  I do not recommend purchase and am downgrading the rating from four stars to three stars.********Update 2: After this unit fell-down (again) and ruined my baseboard, I purchased the Bose Mini and it blows this speaker (and the Sony SRSBTX500)  out of the water in voice clarity and music depth.  At half volume voice is clearer.  Recommend you purchase the Bose.  It's also smaller, sturdy and does not fall-over like this does.  Gave the Sony units to charity and am in the process of purchasing another Bose Mini for a different room.

So nice, someone stole it from my deck.  This holds grill accessories and doesn't leak.  I can (could) sit on this and sip a bourbon as my steak simmers on the grill.  It's (was) easy to clean, as well.  Alas, I have to purchase another with a camera this time.

Remember what they used to say about Weebles?  This product holds my large Galaxy Note 3 with a case, but wobbles and shakes all over the place due to road vibration.  I'd like to see this product with a stiffer "no wobble" (vibration) arm.  The wobble makes me a little dizzy when trying to use the Note 3 as a GPS unit.  Other than that, great product I'd purchase again. If the arm didn't move due to road vibration, I'd rate five stars.

I like this, but you can't fit a 11" Macbook Air with a thin hard case in this.  You need to take the Macbook Air out of the case for it to fit without getting stuck.  I'd like it if the Gauntlet were a little bigger and fit a Macbook Air with a thin plastic case to protect from scratches.  Other than that, great product!  I'd purchase again.

Very nice watch for the price of $270 (price fluctuates on Amazon).  The dial (face) looks better in-person than on the Amazon picture which doesn't do it justice.  The band is made for a very large men's wrist so I had mine adjusted for a men's medium-sized wrist.  If you have a thick wrist, you should not be concerned that the band is too small.  The face will fit all wrist sizes as it's just the perfect size.  Fit and finish are excellent and all sub dials work flawlessly.  You can dress this up for use with a sports jacket or down as a weekend watch.  Would not recommend for formal events as it's a little too casual.

I'm not going to repeat the other awesome reviews with regards to steel used, pocket clip, etc...  I own a lot of knives (kind of a knife nut) and this is by far the deceivingly sharpest out of the box blade I've ever received. It doesn't look sharp out of the box, but will scare the hairs off your arm before you can shave them. I'll use it to open other boxes containing other knives.The build quality is superior to most knives on the market.  Fit and finish are remarkable and the knife handle does not scratch in my pocket easily or collect pocket lint.  The blade is much harder to deploy than most Spyderco knives, but that is remedied with a torx screw adjustment.  Blade retention is excellent - if not the best I've worked with.This knife is not large enough to get a decent grip with all five fingers.  My pinky finger can't fit on the handle.  If you expect to get a five-finger grip, purchase another knife.  This knife is NOT built for lefties as the locking mechanism will get in the way of left-handed blade deployment.  I'm not going to deduct a star for this; just be aware it may bother some people.However, what I love is that the knife fits perfectly in the fifth jeans pocket.  The fifth pocket was introduced to blue jeans around the turn of the century and its original purpose was to hold a pocket-watch.  I feel this knife has singly created a new use for the fifth pocket.  Sure, there are other smaller knives out there, but this product seems at home in the fifth pocket.  It is used as my back-up to larger EDC folders kept in the front jeans pocket.You can also use this as a gentlemen's folder as it looks outstanding with a suit or more dressy clothes.  It looks classy next to a titanium or pewter flask.In summary, push the purchase button before Spyderco chooses to discontinue this model.

WOW!  This ranks right up there with my Benchmade knives for quality and that's my highest compliment.  The S30V blade color looks like a clowns knife in the Amazon picture and looks fantastic in-person.  Blade deployment yields a wonderful sounding "thwack".  Jimping is on the top of the handle - just before the blade and on the butt of the knife.  Blade is perfectly dead center and came moderately sharp out of the box. I'd like a sharper blade from the factory, but this is adequate and can be corrected in five minutes. The grippy G10 handle feel in the hand is ergonomically as good and well-designed as many Spyderco knives.The knife rides deep in the pocket, tip down, right-handed carry.  Can be adjusted for left-handed carry.This is made in the USA.What I love are the aesthetics as this is a gorgeous knife with elegant flowing lines. Push the purchase button.  You will not be sorry.  This is a knife your friends will want no matter what age.

I've purchased Anker batteries for two other phones including the AT&T Note 2 and have been happy.  This battery arrived nicely packaged with a 62% charge and fits into the AT&T Note3 well.  However, it doesn't last as long as the original Samsung battery.  I conditioned the battery by letting the charge run down to 10% as the manufacturer instructs and then charging to 100%.  Full charge time was two hours and ten minutes using the Samsung supplied charger.  Over several weeks, I get a little more than a eight hours moderate usage (talk, text and occasional YouTube video) out of the Anker product while the Samsung battery yields a full day (12+ hours) of similar moderate usage.All-in-all, this is most likely the best replacement battery on the market and I would recommend purchase.  While the Anker product does not come with a travel charger, the Caseology competing battery (at time of writing this review) comes with a charger. However, the Anker product comes with NFC, which when I tested, works.  The Caseology battery does not yet support NFC.I wish this battery lasted as long as the OEM battery and had an external travel charger like the Caseology battery.  I'd like to rate five stars as Anker products have been very good purchases in the past, but can't given the shorter usability factor.  I know people view four stars as being a negative review; however, it is not in mind.  While this product works for me, it's not working as well as the OEM product.

This is a nice knife for opening medium-sized boxes open or for removing thread from clothes.  It's not meant to be used outdoors.  More for an office setting.  It will not scare your co-workers, but is a little too large to be a keychain knife; too small to be a hunting knife.  I like that it rides low in the pocket rather than sticking out for the world to see.The knife does NOT have jimping of any kind on the blade which makes it more prone to your hand slipping down the blade when using wet - food prep, etc....  The handle is grippy, has a little jimping on the top for your thumb, and has indentations for your fingers.  It has a brown and white color with small pictures of what look like deer heads.The blade is a bit off center, but not too much that it hits the handle sides.  You can't adjust the blade because it's fastened to the handle with pins rather than screws.  The blade is not easy to flip open with one hand.  In fact, it drags when opening.  Nothing mineral oil didn't solve, however.  It came sharp out of the box, but not sharp enough to scare the hair off your arms.  Edge retention seems decent.All-in-all, a cool knife to show your friends or use around the office or give as a gift to someone who just wants a casual knife.  For the low price point, three and a half (rounded to four) stars seems appropriate.

We received our LeapPad about two weeks ago,  We have five grandchildren in the recommended age range for this device, and they all love it.  I am amazed at how easy it is for the kids to figure out how to use it.  After I show them a couple of things, they are ready to play.  The older ones(6 &up) have been very helpful showing the younger ones what to do.They have enjoyed playing the pet app, Paw Patrol, the cooking app, and they love the camera and all the fun things they can do with it. The LeapSearch has a wide variety of entertaining videos and educational items.This device will keep the kids busy for a long time, but it is best to set a time limit when they play with it.  The parental controls lets you set a time limit, but I just tell my grandkids when time is up.  The only problem I have with the device is that it only lets you establish three profiles and I need five.

I am delighted with this set.  I wasn't aware of the education sets until I saw this while shopping for Legos for a gift.  I love being able to buy a box of Legos and knowing exactly what I am getting.  Having extra small building plates is so helpful.  I shared this set with one of my grandsons.  We split the box between the two of us.  He selected 11 pieces and I added 11 pieces to my tote of Legos that visiting grandkids play with.  The only problem I now have is that I want to get more education sets as do the kiddos.If you are looking for a great new Lego set, we recommend this set:LEGO City Town Starter Set. And, every kid should have The LEGO Ideas Book.

I have been avoiding conditioners since they make my hair limp and/or oily.  I tried this conditioner because of the Nexxus brand name that I associate with quality products.  I am delighted with the softness of my hair after using this product, and my hair still has body.  The fragrance is pleasant, and the bottle is stylish.

This is another great game from LeapFrog.  If you have a young child or grandchild who is learning to read, this game is a great help.  We have three young grandkids, who are enjoying learning while having fun.  I like that the cards come in a brightly colored tin container to keep them together, but if you lose one they are also available digitally.I think LeapFrog is one of the best companies I have ever dealt with.  I had a problem (my fault) with the download, which they quickly fixed.  I had trouble a couple of years ago with a LeapFrog product and also received great customer service at that time.

This hand cream has a light, pleasant scent.  After I used it, my hands felt a little greasy.  It seemed to take longer for my skin to absorb this than the hand lotion I usually use.  Patience pay off with this product.  The greasy feeling went away after about ten minutes, and then my skin was very soft.  This tube is small enough that you can carry it in your purse if you carry a fairly good sized purse.

My grandson received this bulldozer for his birthday and loves it.  I am very impressed with the Lego vehicle, the details are incredible.  I was surprised and pleased to see the constructions workers in this set are not both men.  One of the workers is a woman!The tracks, made of 42 pieces each, move freely with no sticking.  It works on hard surfaces as well as carpet.  The adjustable blade can be used at various angles, which makes it very realistic.  The building that comes with the set for demolition comes apart easily for good playability.  My 10 year old grandson had some difficulty assembling the bottom of the dozer, but was able to complete it with a little patience.  This dozer is as tall as two story Lego building.

I gave this to my grandson for his 10th birthday.  He told me about a number of great Lego sets, and I chose this one.  He absolutely loves it!  He put it together as soon as he got it.  I have to say that I too am impressed with this set.  The detail that the Lego designers give to these sets is amazing.My grandson loves the floating hulls on the boats.  He also pointed out that the back blades on the helicopter spin freely and that is cool.  The quad in this set is 8 studs long, and his other quad is only six -- that too is a positive!He did point out that he wished the helicopter was larger, and the stretcher smaller, so the stretcher would fit inside the helicopter.  All in all, this set includes everything a starter set should have.

I have fine, thin, straight hair and always use products for extra volume.  I like root-lifting products for a little extra boost, and have tried several.  Tresemme Root Lifting Cream does a good job, but is a little too strongly scented for me.

I have watched this show many times with grandkids, who love the Octonauts. The Octonauts Gup-s Polar Exploration Vehicle splits into two pieces, the Octo-Sled and the Octo-Shuttle.  This makes it great for two kids to play with at the same time.  I couldn't resist pushing the try me button before we took it out of the package so I could hear the fun messages.  After hearing the messages numerous times, you might not love them quite so much after hearing "Activate warming tank now" over and over.

I always use parchment paper when baking cookies.  This is  good parchment paper, but the box is driving me crazy.  The smaller the roll of paper gets, the flimsier the box gets.  At this point I am over halfway through the roll and can no longer use the cutter on the box.  I have resorted to using scissors because the box collapses every time I try to use it.  That results in really crooked paper.  Please make a stronger, sturdier box!

I have never been a Star Wars fan, but my sons were.  This is a very cool Play-Doh set for the next generation of Star Wars fans in our family.  Be ready for a little Play-Doh mess when they start flinging it.  This might be a good set to play with outside.

I'm afraid I won't be able to share this glass since I love it!  It keeps drinks cold and the best feature is that it does not sweat.I am always looking for a coaster when I have a cold drink, but no more.  I can drink water, iced tea, pop and it stays cold.  Later, I can switch to an adult beverage for the evening, and no one will even know.  This truly is an amazing container.

After many years of using the old style Victor rat traps, we were happy to get this trap.  It works as well as the old ones do.  Thankfully, we don't have rats, but we do have a lot of chipmunks running around outside that we don't want inside.  We used to have a number of barn cats and kids running around the yard all the time and this combination seemed to keep the critters away.  Gone are the kids and the cats, so now we use traps and we stake them down.

This polyester tablecloth is a pretty basic tablecloth so you can use a lot of different color dishes, centerpieces, and napkins to dress it up a bit.  The polyester fabric makes it an easy care tablecloth, which is very nice when I compare it to some of my other tablecloths that always require ironing.

We have a covered porch on our old house, but even with the roof our furniture sometimes gets wet.  I have always been hesitant to invest much in furniture, but now that I have this great cover I intend to complete my porch furniture set.  I like the click-close straps that keep the cover in place as we live in the country and there is a lot of wind.

My last hair dryer had an ergonomic handle design, which I loved.  Since I got used to that, this hair dryer feels a bit awkward in my hand, like I don't have a good grip on it.  It does a good job of drying my hair, and I love the color.

This is a very nice sleeping bag.  Since we don't plan on camping in cold weather, I am not concerned with staying warm at low temperatures.  This bag is great for our needs.  It is warm and comfy.  We have grandchildren, who are outgrowing their kiddie sleeping bags, and this is a great addition to our camping supplies.

Why are so many men's products so heavily scented as this one is.  My hubby's deodorant has a strong scent and I think these two clash.  One of my young granddaughters walked into the bathroom the other day, and said it stinks.  I went in to see what the problem was, and the only thing I could smell was the strong scents from the products that grandpa had used when he showered.This product lathers up nicely and does get the guys clean, but I prefer a good old-fashioned bar of soap that leaves you smelling "clean", not like you have on too much cheap cologne.

First, this toy's packaging is overdone.  It took me 15 minutes to remove the pieces from the box.  I will say that everything is very secure, and will definitely not come loose in shipping.Sofia's arms and legs are poseable, but the elbows and knees do not move.  Her eyes do not open and close. Her hat is removable.  Minimus is stationary, and the wings are easy to insert.  The instructions state that the batteries included are for demonstration purposes only.  I find this rather odd.  I wish they would put in decent batteries, or just state batteries are not included.  It takes 3 button cell batteries.  The batteries in the toy I received seem to be working okay.When you press Sofia's amulet, she talks and sings quite loud.  When you place Minimus near Sofia, you are supposed to hear them chat.  The one I received doesn't do this.  Sofia and Minimus talk and music plays while they are flying.  This feature works well, and is the kids' favorite part.  The instructions also state that when you award Sofia the trophy included it will activate phrases, ours doesn't do this.This toy is cute, but I really think it is overpriced.  I plan on contacting Mattel when their office is open in hopes of getting some answers as to why all the features are not working.  I will post an update.Update:  I spoke with a very nice customer service representative from Mattel today.  She was not able to find an answer to the problems we are having with the toy. but is forwarding my questions to another department.

I have been using eb5 products for more years than I can remember.  I got a free sample of their facial cream from the company many years ago, and have been a satisfied user ever since.  This product softens skin without leaving it greasy.  I need this especially in the winter when my skin tends to dry out.  This product may be a little more costly than other similar creams, but believe me it is well worth it.

While I have not seen any dramatic changes in my skin, I do like the feel of my skin after applying this lotion.  It is not heavy or oily, rather nice and light and gets absorbed very well.  I'd love to try the line of skin care and see if it makes a difference to use the whole line.  In the past I've used a few different skin care lines and have always liked it best when the correct products are used together.  Overall, this is a great serum.

We have had a lot of fun with this enclosed copter toy so far.  I think it would be a bit more stable if it was a bit bigger, but given its size it is a blast to play with!I've had no big issues with control, it really does follow your basic wishes when using the remote control.  I do however feel the size gets in the way in that it is a tad small, if it was slightly larger and heavier I think control would be better.  BUT, that is where the slight bumpers on the outer edges of where the copter blades are come in handy.  If you bump only slightly, it is possible to maintain control without disaster. (this is more for indoor use).Overall, it is VERY fun to play with and has caused hoots and hollers to erupt from family and visitors alike.

While I have not seen any dramatic changes in my skin, I will say that my skin has felt nicely hydrated for much longer than usual when using a light lotion.  I'm quite impressed.  Normally, if I put some lotion on before bed, I can't feel it on my face in the morning.  When I put this on in the evening, I wake up and my skin still feels nice and moist in the morning.  I love it!

We love Battleship - we have electronic, regular and now Star Wars.  I will admit I have reasons to love and hate each one.  I love the electric and how it helps and interacts when you tell it what to hit.  I love the simplicity of the regular.  And I love the floating ships of the Star Wars (plus, it is a favorite family theme anyway!)This game was easy to set up.  Clear instructions, stickers were easy to put on, pieces easy to get ready.Play was easy too - same as usual.  I think there was one less ship in this version - there was a 2 hole, a 3 hole, a 4 hole and a 5 hole ship.  There are little tabs that fold down, otherwise, they hold the ships and make them look like they are floating above the game board.My one and only complaint was that the floating ships made adding the red "hit" pegs a bit hard to add to the ships in a few places.  Otherwise, this game was great - the whole family loved the Star Wars theme and the length of the game.

Growing up, I have fond memories of loving caramels because my Dad loved them.  Now as an adult, I love them, and enjoy trying new caramels and twists on them.  This tin arrived at my house and first off, I was shocked at how large it was.  Sometimes when it says the weight in the description, it can be hard to tell just how bit something will be.  This is a really good size.  You really could pull this tin out at a party and likely (if it isn't a huge party) have leftovers.These caramels are oft and chewy, and there are three different flavors:  regular caramel, butterscotch caramel and vanilla caramel.  I liked all three, but preferred the vanilla caramels the best.These "soft cremes" are similar to a saltwater taffy in consistency, but really do taste like caramels.

These are very effective make-up remover wipes.  I like the feel of my face after using them, and they do a really good job of cleaning makeup off my face.The only thing I don't like is that the smell is a bit off for me.  I wish it was a tad pretty smelling.The Simple Brand claims that you only need one wipe across your face to remove the makeup, and for the more stubborn waterproof makeup you simply hold the wipe gently on the area for a few seconds and swipe, it will remove the makeup with no issues.  This is the case for normal makeup, I only use waterproof eye liner.I am very appreciative that there is no alcohol used in the wipes, as that tends to be so harsh and drying on skin.  I also like the clean light feeling my skin is left with, instead of the feeling you can get from some wipes that feel like they have left a layer of something behind.

I'm a huge fan of Baby Wipes, they aren't just for wiping cute baby bottoms... we take them on hiking trips, picnics, outings, teachers use them in class for easy clean ups...My only requirements of baby wipes are that they are effective and don't flake apart.  This are a winner - they are strong, don't pull apart, do a good job of cleaning up, and are gentle at the same time.

I've used quite a few laminators over the year, some easier than others.  I was excited to see just how easy this one is to use.  Not only is it nice an compact and portable, it is easy to set up anywhere with enough room to feed your project in on the one side and for it to come out on the other (even the floor works great).I love the auto-shut-off feature.  I haven't needed it yet, but I like the knowledge that if I start something, walk away and forget it, it will automatically turn itself off.The machine does have a button to choose between 3 mil and 5 mil laminating pouches, which is helpful and gives us some options for the pouches we can use.Out of the box, the laminator comes with 20 letter size laminating pouches.  I've used a few for some ABC flash cards that we are using daily and they turned out GREAT!This is a great laminator for home projects, saving artwork, creating projects with the kids, and saving important documents.

This is a fun and interactive castle that was fun to build with the kids.  It had 786 pieces, so we started by sorting them by size and basic shape.  Then we followed the instructions.  Our 5 year old enjoyed helping until the guys were put together (the set comes with the three main Minions), at which point he started playing with them while my 8 year old and I followed the instructions.The end result was great.  Not only does the castle look neat, it has some fun features.  The castle is basically a center section with two towers, and each of the towers has hinges that allow them to open up for play.There is a jail section, a crown/throne room, and a lookout section, all with neat booby-traps and fun interactive pieces.  Once put together, but boys have had a great time playing with it.  It has proven to be pretty stable, and the pieces are staying together pretty nicely so far.

Our family has been a huge fan of Leap products for years.  The kids find them both entertaining and educational, and as a parent, I feel good that they think they are playing a game when they are getting learning skills reinforced.This new card system is kind of neat (assuming your kids remember to put the cards back into their tin so they aren't misplaced), and make already interactive games much more interactive.This set of Imagicards works with letters and sounds.  The fun thing is after one of the kids is done with the game, we have learned to spread the cards out and work together to spell words together.

I love the concept of this cold roller ball - sometimes you have a muscle or area that really needs to be massaged and the cold helps reduce swelling.The ability to put this into the freezer, chill it, and use it to roll out knots in sore muscles is great, and it does a great job.I've found after using it a few times, that if I'm feeling lazy and don't want to take the grip off, it is just fine to put the whole thing in the freezer - it just chills your hand a bit when you are using it.I really have only one concern, and that is how to clean the roller ball.  The roller ball sits securely (as in, I can't get it out no matter what I try) inside the hard yellow base.  The rubber grip comes off fairly easily, but I don't think the yellow plastic can be removed from the ball.  And the  way the ball works is like a roll-on deodorant, and I have a very fancy expensive rose roll-on deodorant, and I do notice a bit of build up under the roller where you can't get to it, so I make sure to only use it after a shower... same concept here.  If you use this after a workout, before you shower, you are going to get sweat buildup under the rollerball, and I don't see how you can clean it.  Soaking it in rubbing alcohol might do the trick, but I'm just not sure. And, after reading the pamphlet it came with, I don't see anything about cleaning it at all.

I have been married for almost 15 years - in fact, this August will be our 15th Anniversary.... and ... we were high school sweet hearts prior to getting married.  We dated for 7 years... so after being "together" for the past 22 years, I've noticed that our idea of LOVE has changed.  When we first met, it was the sparks flying kind of love, and it has evolved into a deeper love filled with respect, trust, commitment, etc.There are times when you do have to think about your relationship and realize that you've chosen to marry the person you are with for wonderful reasons, that you have built a great life together, and that each and every day you get to make the choice... to say "I choose you!"  Whether you say it in your head, or out loud, it is something we all want to hear, or at least I do.  I want to hear that I'm wanted and chosen. AND, I want my husband and kids to know that each and every day, I choose them.  Even when I wake up grumpy, or feel overwhelmed, I still choose them, and after reading this, I see that it is important to not just think about the fact that you are choosing to live your life with your family, but that it gives you empowerment.The book is based on Faith, and choosing to place our faith in God and the scriptures that support his teachings.  Each chapter in the book looks at different ways we "choose" and how the choices we make empower us and empower the people in our lives (especially our significant other): I Choose to.... Pursue You, Love You, Bless You, Honor You, Keep My Commitment to You, Be Loyal to You, Trust You, Forgive You, Be Adaptable, Submit to You, Share Your Burdens, Serve You....Now, I will be the first to admit that I really need to work on quite a few of the topics within the book.  For example, I have been known to hold a grudge for a long time... and a choice that was made over 20 years ago should not be in the forefront of my mind now, which it isn't (yes, I'm thinking of something specific LOL, that hubby thinks I still hold onto from our early years and a major purchase decision, but I see that I need to find a way to reverse what happened then and show him that the Trust, Forgive, Adapt all apply and I've gotten beyond that incident...)I have come away with a newfound feeling of empowerment, that the choices I'm making are biblically supported, and are good for my family and myself.  Honestly, I plan to re-read this a few times to really let some of the topics really sink in, and I want to practice telling others that I'm choosing them.  I also want to go beyond and show them that I'm choosing them as well.After reading Deb's book, I can see that we are all in the same boat, or at least in a similar boat, and that is inspiring.  I'm planning to suggest this book at our next book club, as I feel that it can improve our relationships both in the home, and in friendships.

I like to keep some of the fiber one bars and snacks on hand for the mornings when I manage to wake up a little late, get the kids fed and ready for school, but manage to forget about myself.  These are easy to grab on the way out the door, and will give me just enough energy to keep me going through school drop-offs and a few errands.I like the flavor as well.  While it does not replace a real brownie in my mind, it sure beats a grainy, tasteless breakfast bar for my purposes.  Just enough chocolate to make it enjoyable, but not so much that you get a sugary rush.

This K-Cup works perfectly in our off-brand K-Cup machine.  It fits just fine, and brews without any problems.The flavor is a nice black tea with a hint of creaminess.  My husband and I have been drinking more tea and less coffee/soda respectively, and this is a nice tea to have on hand when you don't want to brew an entire pot.I realize that the price seems a bit high, but when you compare the price to loose leaf tea, it isn't so bad when you consider the convenience of tossing your K-Cup into the machine and pressing a button.  If you are comparing it to a general tea bag you buy at the market, it is a bit pricier.Overall, both hubby and I enjoyed this tea although it is not a favorite.  His favorite right now is the Hartley and Sons Paris tea in a K-Cup (he likes it so much we also have it in the loose leaf tin).

My boys, ages 8 and 5, have just discovered B-Daman toys (one won the original set with a field and two characters at Chuck E Cheese).  It is basically a marble shooting game.I love that they are playing something in an arena style with sidewalls, targets, and goals.  They are working together to play this game, and having fun.This Thunder Leo figure has been a fun addition to their set.  The core is nice, and the parts are slightly sparkly, so my youngest has started switching the arms and legs with his other figure.The red thing is a target, but it also holds 2 marbles.  The brown thing is a plastic type screwdriver that allows you to undo the screws holding the arms and feet on the core - you can then swap them with other pieces.

Ok - so this product is used in your hot tub to help get organic particles (sweat, lotion, oil, etc) out of the water that are too small for the filter to grab onto.  You squirt this into the water and run the jets for a few hours, and it clings to the particles allowing the filters to grab onto them.  LOVE it!!  it works great.We tend to get into the hot tub and soak/visit for longer than usual (we also keep our hot tub at about 98 degrees so we can stay in longer than 15 minutes) - so I like to add 2 ounces at least once a week, more if we are in daily or have company over.
The boys have been playing with this wrestling ring and wanted extra pieces to customize - so we got this.  It was a lot of fun and has given them a lot of possibilities when putting guys together.

Fun to assemble with the  boys.  This comes packaged similarly to a snap-together model.  You take the parts off the plastic holders, file any rough pieces (boys were too excited, so we put it together and I went back later with a file and got rid of the rough pieces).  You assemble it according to the instructions, add the stickers and go play.Note:  no special tools are needed unless you want to file the edges where they were connected to the molding plastic (not needed).  The toy comes with the tool needed to twist the little screws for the arms and feet (the yellow screw on this toy's shoulder).Instruction note:  The instructions are in Japanese, but with the piece numbers clearly printed on the instructions and on the plastic molding plastic, you can figure it out with very little frustrations.Final note - this toy does not come with a marble holder (we are new to the toys, so I'm not sure what it is called), so it can only hold 2 marbles at a time, which is just fine.  You take the back piece from his helmet, fill the 2 marbles, replace the piece and aim/fire.The boys LOVED being able to build this character like a model!!

I've used this Olay Purifying Micro Peel for two separate 5-night sessions with about two weeks in between.  I've got normally combination skin that leans more toward slightly oily, so that may affect the results I was able to see.  My skin does feel softer after the first few days, but I don't see noticeable exfoliation ie skin sloughing.I did not experience any pinkness or tenderness, but I was also careful to not be in direct sunlight as your skin will be more sensitive when using products like this (which is not uncommon).When using this, I feel like I'm pampering myself, so it is worth it for me.  My skin feels nice, soft and clean.  While I can't speak to how well it is actually working to bring up new layers of skin, I do feel my skin feels fresher after using it for a few days, which is nice.I don't see myself using this all the time, but rather, when I want to pamper myself and spend a tiny bit more time on my skin in the evening (really, a few extra seconds as it is really easy to use!!)
I love these scents - for me personally, a little goes a long way, so I use just about a tablespoon for our 500 gallon hot tub.

I'm not sure what I was expecting with this Minecraft Blockopedia, but I expected.... MORE.  While it didn't quite meet my expectations, the information it does have is great.  It is pretty much an encyclopedia of block types.  It tells you how they are made, where to get them, etc.My 8 year old gets to occasionally play Minecraft, and he likes to read the smaller Minecraft books and build intricate things into his designs.  This book gave him additional resources to build more.  He LOVES it.I'm glad I purchased this book via Prime and was able to save about $15 from the cover price.  I MAY have been disappointed if I had paid full price.

I really, really like the Philips PureRadiance Cleansing system.  For the record, I also have a Clarisonic.I love the color, and how easily it charges.  It sits upright in the charger and takes very little space on the counter.I also love how my skin feels after using the PureRadiance.  It is literally squeaky clean and makes me feel refreshed.In reality, the PureRadiance and the Clarisonic are very similar - both do a great job with cleaning skin, are easy to charge, can be used in the shower, brush heads are easy to replace, and both hold a charge so you can take them for a weekend trip without taking the base.The only criticism I have is that the rotating brush can pull skin, especially when you are closer to the eye area, otherwise, it is great!

In a household with young boys, this is a great feature... not only is it a cool toilet seat (their words), but it lights up in the dark which they love.I know that Kohler is a quality brand based on past experience.  This seat was easy to install, and it replaced a wooden seat.  I actually prefer wood seats in general as white eventually stains, so I'm waiting to see how this white seat does.I am impressed with the extra fluffy features - the charcoal, the scent, the light, and the slowly lowering lid.As of now, with only having had this installed a short time, I'm not able to talk about the length of use for the charcoal or scent.  First of all, it is easy to install, both the seats, the batteries and the extras - they are all easy - really just took a few minutes - I really expected it to be harder.Honestly, the night light is now a favorite feature - we usually have a small night light in the bathroom so the bathroom isn't scary at night for the kids (and so we don't really have to turn the light on if we don't want to), and the night light burned out.  The nice thing was that with the lid closed, the light from the seat was enough so that the burned out nightlight was not an emergency situation.  When you lift the lid, the light moves to the toilet bowl - again, the boys have chuckled about this and find it really fun.I like the light scent, but if the replacements are expensive or hard to get, I won't be replacing it.

My feet are very dry and I get callus build-up pretty fast.  This electronic pedicure file is the perfect FINISHING touch to my heel/foot routine.By itself, I don't know that it is aggressive enough to really make my feet feel great (my feet will actually hurt when my calluses get too bad around my heels).  So, here is what I do: when my feet are really bad (not often, maybe every few months), I use a heel razor to get a good portion of the callus off, then I use a European Foot File in the shower.  This works wonderfully on a regular basis, but doesn't leave my feet smooth (even using the smoothing side isn't perfect), so now I use this electronic foot file last to get the slightly rough skin that is left that will catch on my soft sheets.I've never been happier after doing a self-pedicure than I am now!!!Note - this comes WITH the 2 AA batteries needed to use the foot file.  I do wish it was a plug-in file so I wasn't going through batteries, but so far, I'm still on the first set of batteries and it is going strong.It is pressure sensitive and will stop if you are pushing too hard.  Some people may not like this.Dead/dry skin just comes right off using this - you can actually see it!

I tend to like firm pillows, but my husband likes fluffy, so I knew between us, we could see what we thought about this pillow.  First off, if the technology really does work (how do you test for dust mites if you are at home?... I'm sensitive to dust, so I am careful with our bedding, but even I can't really tell if pillows or bedding is getting dust mites) I like the idea assuming the chemical applied to make it anti-allergy isn't harmful for us in the long-run (need to do more research in this area myself).Let me explain something about the fluffy vs firmness of this pillow.  I consider soft pillows to be those that don't give a lot of support, but kind of form around your head and you can REALLY form them how you want them, while extra firm is heavy and will barely move if punched (think the really expensive memory foam pillows).  Then you get the medium, which provides support without the filling moving all over, and is still fluffy so you can sort of get it more comfortable.I do consider this pillow to be medium firmness - it provides a lot of support for how light weight it is.  It is also very fluffy and compresses some when you use it.  I really like this one for a medium firmness pillow.The cover is nice and seems to be made out of good quality fabric.It says it is 100% washable, but I have not washed mine yet.
Really enjoying this game!  No issues so far

So, we've had a chance to make a few blended drinks so far with this amazing machine, and my husband who was skeptical as to how much this would actually get used, now thinks it is the answer to EVERYTHING... well, not everything, but all drink-related slushy type drinks!We call it our "Smart Drink Mixer"... in the past, when making milk shakes, or blended drinks, we've always had trouble with separation of the icy and liquid parts, and with ice chunks.The designers/programmers of the Black and Decker XL Blast Party Blender did a great job.  It blends ice into drinks perfectly, leaving no annoying chunks, and the directions are easy to follow.Additionally, I love the pour feature in the lid (the lid fits very tightly with a rubber edge), and the chilling sleeve that keeps the blender bowl cold when it still has drinks in it.We've used it for a few football get-togethers and it is PERFECT!  I've since gotten rid of my two other blenders as this has the versatility and usefulness I need.Dishwasher safe.

I really like the concept of this Door Anchor for exercise straps.  When I've gotten exercise bands in the past, I've basically had to buy each piece that I want, they don't usually come as a bundle.  So, I've got some great handles, and a great band, and I'm able to do basic exercises with it.  This anchor allows me to attach the band to the door to do additional exercises.To set this up, you need to be on the side of the door so that when you pull it closed, you pull it toward you.  Make sure you are pulling the door shut (not pushing it shut) so that the door jam is between you and the door (this gives the door strength so that you can't pull it open toward you while exercising.This anchor will only work on door jams that have a bit of space between the door jam and the door itself as the nylon strap needs some space to get between the door jam and door.  In our house, it works on our family room door (which is where I prefer to work out), and on our bedroom door, but that means I'm working out in the small hallway, which is not great.The wide part at the end of the strap goes behind the door while you are closing it so that it locks the anchor in place and does not allow it to slip through the door jam when the door is closed.You then attach your workout band (does not come with the door anchor) to the anchor with the included carabiner ring.I like the ability to change the height of the anchor by sliding it, or moving it.  I can do it above the door, below, and from various heights on the side of the door.

My just-turned-5 year old loves this game.  He is familiar with the cartoon, so he knew the characters when he started playing the game (Millie, Geo, Bot).The game is really great - it uses the familiar Umizoomi characters to help kids learn about patterns, measuring, numbers, shapes, and basic problem solving.Kids will help the Umizoomi team to fix the town.  Some challenges call for your child to show which way to go on a map of the city based on the number that comes next (1, 2, 3...).  I really liked that the game keeps things easy enough for kids to understand and learn from, but challenging enough for them to learn from.Another thing I really liked was that my son learned about measuring using non-standard things... example: we tend to use a ruler to measure everything, but when you don't have a ruler, you can use something else.  In the game, Millie uses her hair to measure how long items are.  My son turned around and started using his Build-a-Bear to measure his bed and a few other things around the house.  I LOVED THIS!

For my everyday eye makeup, I typically use a mineral based pearlish peach color on my lids, and a mineral charcoal for the outer edge over waterproof eyeliner, blended to look nice, finished with mascara.  This shade of Japonesque Velvet Touch Shadow actually matches my current favorite Smashbox color perfectly.I will say that my Smashbox covers my eyelid a little better than the Japonesque, but this one does look nice and covers well, it just seems to be not as fine as the Smashbox shadow (so it seems to take a little more for the same coverage).Once I get the right amount on, it looks great, and it blends nicely with my other shadow to finish off my daily look.I use this with my eye brush (it does not come with a foam or brush, so you will need your own), and generally use it dry, although it is fun to change it up a bit by getting the eye brush wet first.  It makes the color a bit brighter, and changes the look just a bit to stand out a little more.Overall, I'm very pleased with this color and coverage.  I will certainly use this shadow going forward.

After taking these for about two weeks, I can say that I've experienced nothing negative while taking these, and they are easy to store (they don't need to be refrigerated).They claim to aid with digestion and boost your immune system.I make a point to add probiotics to our diet any time someone in the family has been on antibiotics or had a bad stomach virus.  When you take antibiotics, you kill both the good and bad bacteria in your system, so taking a probiotic afterwards is important to add back in the good bacteria your system needs to stay healthy.This is a good option as it does not need to be refrigerated like other common probiotics.  This makes it easy to take on trips, keep in a desk, or simply have on hand.As with most supplements, short of scientific experiments, it is hard to judge if a product is working.  The only thing I can say is that I have not experienced any negative affects from taking these.  Plus, while the cold (stuffy, sneezy, etc) has made its rounds in our household a few times already, I seem to have had it less than the rest of the family.

I love LeapFrog learning tools, so I was really excited to give this new LeapTV a try.  We got to test out the PAW Patrol learning game.  It is aimed at kids ages 3-5 and is gender neutral.I love how interactive the game is.  It tracks motion via the controller (held in child's hand) and the LeapTV camera (similar to a Kinect or Wii sensor - it can see your child's movement, and in some cases, it can add your child's image into the game).  Your child works to help with six rescue missions.My 4 year old followed the game really well.  He understood what he needed to do pretty easily, and seemed to pick up the movement and theme of the game quickly.The game kept his attention really nicely, and captured my 8 year old's attention for about 20 minutes.I like that the game is youngster friendly as opposed to the older games that are played on the Xbox and Wii.My only complaint is that the dogs talking actions (mouth moving) seemed to go on about double the amount of time the dogs were actually saying something, so on occasion there was a bit of confusion as to if he was done talking.

We are using this H-Ligature and cap on an older Alto Sax that is used for occasional use.Not being a sax player myself (it is my husband's alto sax), I can't speak personally to using it other than to say that it fit well.  The ligature is adjustable using two screw adjustments, so you can get it to fit just how you want.  My husband says it was easy to use, and that the cap happened to fit well.
