I love light Christmas books, especially romances, so I LOVE to find new holiday themed books.There is a lot going on in this book in a short amount of time, so it kept my attention really well, and it was hard to put the book down.Meredith aka Jane has come to Twilight, Texas to hide from her ex-husband with her son.  She and her son are living in a house with Ashley and her daughter (the house is actually Ashley's brother's home).  Ashley has gone on a cruise and has left her daughter with Meredith, and when Ashley's brother unexpectedly turns up, Meredith has to deal with a lot!Meredith is dealing with fears of her ex showing up, making Christmas special for her son and Ashley's daughter, and now living with a strange man in the house, Hutch, who has returned from active duty injured and unable to speak due to trauma and a throat injury.I loved reading this book - it was both complex and fast-paced which kept my attention and made it so I didn't want to put it down.  This story is part of the Twilight, Texas series, but works great as a stand-alone story.  You don't need the background from the other books, but I did find that I want to go check out the rest of the series now.

After watching family-friendly action/adventure movies like Indiana Jones, Tomb Raider, National Treasure, etc., it is really fun to find a fun new series of books that centers around adventure.  This book is aimed at approx. 4th-6th graders per the Scholastic site, and it is around a 5th grade reading level book.  I've been reading this book with my 2nd grader, who is not quite ready to read it on his own, but who enjoys the book as an adventurous family story.The story centers around Alex and his best friend Ren.  Alex is terminally ill, his mother is an expert on Ancient Egypt, and she uses a spell from the Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead to help Alex.  Unknowingly, she also unleashes five Death Walkers when she uses the spell.  She also disappears, and so do the Lost Spells, so Alex and Ren have to try to find his mom.  While trying to find Alex's mom and save the world, the kids run into Mummies, scorpions, and so many more challenges.Kids will be able to read the book and then go online (with parental permission) to play the game online, build an Egyptian tomb, hide treasure, set traps, and challenge friends.  Note - you will need a code from purchasing the book.  My advanced copy of the book does not have the code, so while the kids and I explored what we could of the site (which looks very fun), we could't play the game.I especially love that this book will get boys and girls interested in Ancient Egypt.  (Alex is a boy, and Ren is a girl, so both boys and girls will enjoy the book and enter the adventure)

We've been replacing brakes and pads on our vehicles recently, and this really helps speed the job up while working with the lug nuts.Having not owned or used an Impact Wrench before, I can't really compare it, but it is sturdy.  The only criticism I can point out here is that it is a very heavy tool.  To me this says, quality, and solid equipment, but is also translates into something that causes muscle fatigue faster than necessary.  So, for a home/shop use where it will only occasionally be used, this may not matter as much, but if you own a shop and are going to be using it all the time, make sure you consider the weight.The switch makes it easy to switch from untightening to tightening.One thing I've learned over the years is when it is good to have a battery vs. when having an electric tool is nice, and in the case of drills and similar tools, I'm finding it is really nice having a wired component you can always count on to have 100% of its power instead of a tool that could wear out the battery mid-way through a project.Over all, I'm really pleased with the time we saved instead of using a hand wrench, and I'm looking forward to seeing what other projects we can use this for.

I have a Kenmore canister vacuum that I love, and finding good bags that are sturdy are important because I go through at least a pack per year if not more.  At less than $1/bag these are great bags!!!They are sturdy (I can fill the bag to the point there is no room left, and they don't break open when removing them from the canister - yes, I've had that happen with cheap bags before).They fit well.  I've never really had a problem using C bags of any brand as far as fit - slide the holder into the part that holds it securely, and kind of squish the bag in.  Done.Chemically treated?  While I'm not sure about long-term health affects of using chemically treated bags, I LOVE that they are coated with something that prevents bacteria from growing and spreading - this time of year, cold season takes over and the last thing I need is my vacuum spreading more germs.I had to dig through one bag for some Lego pieces that accidentally got vacuumed up, and it is pretty amazing to see the tiny particles of dirt this bag holds in.  It makes me feel good about getting fine particles of dust and dirt out of my house.After giving these a try, I will be ordering them from now on instead of the more expensive Kenmore bags.

Upon first glance, this necklace looks like the center lighter portion is floating, but when the necklace arrived, it is actually a solid piece.  There is a row of darker Swarovski crystals on the outer heart shape, a thin silver ridge, then a domed heart of lighter Swarovski crystals.This necklace really shines and sparkles.  It is very pretty, and I've received quite a few compliments when wearing it.It is a nice gift, and comes in a nice velvet-like fabric draw sting bag inside a black cardboard jewelry box.I only have one suggestion.  While the necklace is just fine, I think it will look even nicer with a better, slightly longer necklace.

My all-time favorite water bottle is my Contigo, it has a screw on lid, flip spout, and uses a plastic straw.  I really like the plastic straw as opposed to having to squeeze the water out of the bottle.  That is why I didn't give this bottle 5 stars, so if that does not bother you at all, kick it up a notch and ignore my 4 stars.The Water Bobble Sport water bottle is easy to use - basically, unscrew the lid, fill the bottle most of the way (I am able to fill it more than my husband can fill his Brita Filtered Water Bottle), replace the lid and squeeze the water into your mouth to drink.Prior to the first use, you are supposed to fill the bottle and squeeze the entire bottle of water through the carbon filter.  At first, the water did come out with a black tinge, which the instructions mentioned.This is not my daily-use water bottle as I fill my Contigo with filtered water from my refrigerator.  BUT, this water bottle came in really handy when we went on a trip - I don't like to drink tap water, so instead of going through a ton of water bottles from a store, I was able to take this water bottle with and I used it to filter my water - loved the convenience.Note:  to replace the filter, you buy a new filter/cap piece - I initially tried to unscrew the filter to clean the mouth piece, but couldn't get it apart.  After looking online, I found out that they are one piece and are not meant to come apart (I didn't see anything about that on/in the packaging).

Wore this for family portraits and date night - after 2 kids and lengthy bedrest for one, it was a nice supportive slimmer.  BUT - I've got a bust that is a healthy DD - and instead of providing me the space to feel comfortable, this really pushed at the sides.  When I took the straps off my shoulders and tucked them down, they were a bit lumpy but the slimmer fit much better.  So, if you are busty, try this on before removing the tags.Otherwise, this slimmer worked really nicely.  It fit well, provided support and did make me feel slimmer.  I planned my outing and avoided the bathroom because I really felt it would be easier to remove the whole thing rather than use the hooks at the crotch of the slimmer.By the way - this is made extremely well.  The fabric is nice and the seams are excellently finished.In all - yes, I will wear this for special occasions when I want to look a bit slimmer, but it will not be worn often.
Bought this for a Christmas gift.  It arrived quickly with great communication from the seller, and it looks even nicer in person!  Well constructed.

This is a great little purse - not too little - can definitely put a lot in this little purse.  The quality seems really good so far.I bought two- one as a gift and one for me.The grey handle cover part over the thick rope moves, so you just pull it back up to the center.

This is a great humidifier.  We previously used a cheap medical supply one I had received at the hospital when our first child was born.  This is SO much nicer!!!!!  It is whisper quiet, has an auto-shut-off feature and it allows you to adjust both the amount of output and the direction of the moisture.Easy to fill - just take off the top white spout (so it does not fall away when you turn the main container over), turn the blue part over, take it to a faucet and fill it up.The base does fill with water, so the first time I fill it when we are using it, I fill it, and attach it, let the base fill up then go refill the main portion - but it lasts a long time, so I don't really need to do it.  I'm just picky about filling it.I use this along with a small digital thing that measures the humidity of the air so I don't have it too moist or too dry when the kids have a cold.

Easy to follow instructions, quick to snap together, sturdy.  The shelves are adjustable and allow you to store a lot of things inside.  We use this outside, against the house to store our bbq, fire pit and outdoor play things.  LOVE that it has allowed me to organize the jumbled mess that used to live on our patio table.

We use this for white noise in the kids room - you can hear even little tiny sounds from outside and the boys would stay awake and jump at the odd noises, when we started using this, they go right to sleep and aren't woken when a neighbor shuts their car door.We've only really tested the white noise feature, but it is easy to switch between the sounds, and to adjust the volume.

These are my favorite dryer balls!  I don't like to use fabric softener because of the build-up in the dryer of the chemicals used to make fabrics soft.These function to help dry clothes faster, make them softer and remove static.My towels easily come out of the dryer more fluffy in less time than when I don't have them in the dryer.  These are great!I have 2 other sets - the kids sometimes play with them or they come out of the dryer inside a load of things to be folded, so I always have enough to throw another in to keep things going.

I use this together with a humidifier when someone in the family comes down with a cold.  It shows me what the current humidity and temperature is so I can adjust the humidifier to get the perfect moisture in the air for the room.I love the guide along the bottom.  It shows the ranges for too dry, just right, ideal for when you have a cold and too moist.  SO helpful and easy to read!

This is a fun toy, but one that didn't keep the attention of my 4 or 7 year old for long.  They still go back and play with it, but it isn't a favorite.I do think the way this is designed is awesome.  It serves as a car launcher so you can race the cars that work with it.

I found this lotion while on a trip to the ocean with friends.  It has quickly become my favorite!  Not only do I love the scent, but it soothes dry skin and lasts a while without being greasy!To me, it is a medium lotion, doesn't go on too thick, and fully absorbs into skin fairly quickly while leaving skin feeling moist but not greasy.  I consider a light lotion to be almost watery when you rub it in, so this one is not runny.LOVE the scent - to me it is kind of grapefruity - in fact, that is what I thought it was until I read the bottle and saw Orange Honey.What else to say - a little goes a long way and it feels GREAT!

Please note - if you have ever installed those vinyl stickers to a wall, they tell you to wipe the wall down with rubbing alcohol ahead of time and give it time to dry.  This removes dust and dirt that you don't notice and lets the sticky side adhere better to the wall.  I did this at home for this too.This is an awesome board - not only is it huge - you can cut it to a specific size (it can also be used to resurface an existing white board).  I wanted a way to make lists on the refrigerator, and also on the kid's bedroom door.  I also thought it would be fun to give them a section to color on themselves.  It wipes cleanly with the included eraser cloth, and it is easy to write/draw on with dry-erase markers (not included).Tips - it is easiest to place this level on the wall by marking the wall ahead of time (use pencil if it won't show, or use tape to create a level line to follow).  Then pull back a few inches of the backing to line it up.  For larger pieces, tape the entire thing up when you get it lined up, then start at one side and start peeling the backing back - fold it and place the edge on,  once it is where you know you want it, you can start pulling more of the backing off and removing the tape holding it to the wall as you need to.Post-It has made optional accessories that can help - a pen holder tray and additional eraser cloths.  We are using generic dry-erase markers with it and they work just fine.Use this at the office or at home - on the fridge door for lists/menus/reminders, front door for reminders, kids bedroom wall for drawing, kids door for a chore chart checkoff list or reminders (you can use vinyl chart tape to make lines and customize a board, but it does not always remove cleanly, so make sure if you use it, you get it put exactly where you want - once it is left on for a while, it will leave a mark if you try to remove it and the board won't cleanly erase from where it was), use it to make fun dry-erase gifts (cover the front of a board or clipboard, add a frame, place on a jar or container and update the contents... but keep it dry,, etc)

1:57 Mins These are designed for children but they will fit an adult when they are fully extended.  They are simple to use if you are familiar with bluetooth and they look and sound great too.  When using the bluetooth connection they limit the db level to 85 to protect you kid from turning them up too loud and causing ear damage.  If they you use the audio cable you will not have this protection.Check out my video for more details.  If this review was helpful click "yes" below!  I received a promotional product from Brainwavz for an honest review.

My favorite thing about this sleep set is that it is very compact.  I have a memory foam neck pillow that is quite the pain to haul around and although it is more comfortable than this blow up pillow, this one can be deflated and stuck in the side pocket of my suitcase.This is not the most comfortable neck pillow in the world, but it does the job.  The mask is cheap but works as well as the ear plugs.  If you need a compact solution for traveling and aren't too picky, this could be for you.  Don't set your expectations too high and you'll be happy.

2:37 Mins This is a great little drone and is a lot of fun.  The cage make is SO much more durable than other quad-copters of this size.  You can see in the video how it just bounces off of everything.Due to it's small size it can seem a little squirrely to control at first, but once you get the hang of it, it flies quite nicely.  You don't have to worry about the kids flying this and the dog LOVES it.The battery is removable with allows you to replace it if needed or purchase additional ones for extended flight time.Comment below with questions and click 'yes' below if this review was helpful!  Thanks

5:33 Mins I was very impressed with this track slider.  I have always wanted one to get those great moving shots and this one did not disappoint.  It is super easy to setup and with its case is easy to transport.  I was also very impressed with the build quality.Out of the box it took me about 3 minutes to set it up.  There are no instructions included but none are necessary.  This track works by itself but I would recommend a couple things to go with it that will make you experience and video better.  First, you need a tripod head.  I would recommend one with pan/tilt functionality.  This will make shooting the video much easier and give you more flexibility.  Second, I would recommend a tripod to mount this on.  You can see from my video and attached pictures how I used the tripod.Overall this is an impressive product at a great price.  I would like to thank Imorden for supplying me with a sample product to review.  You will not be disappointed.  Check out my video!

Right out of the box I was very impressed with the quality of this hydration belt.  The stock picture does not do the quality justice.  This is a product you really have to feel to appreciate.  The water bottles hold 10oz each and are very secure in the belt so there is no worry that they will fall out of flop around while running.  The main pouch is very spacious and would pretty easily hold any phone.  It does have individual dividers with in the main pouch to keep things from rubbing on your phone.  It also has sweet access hole that you can put the headphones though.I typically don't run/jog far enough on a regular basis to need to carry water with me, but on those super hot days this would be a great thing to have.  I received this product on promotion in exchange for an honest review and I would highly recommend it.

This is a great alternative to an arm band while running or jogging.  It is very comfortable and light weight and great for a minimalist.  I can easily fit my iPhone 5s although I'm not sure how easily the bigger phones like the iPhone 6s Plus would fit.  I imagine it would be VERY tight or they would not fit at all.  The front pouch is even smaller, but would hold a few credit cards or cash or even a few keys.  I also really like that it has a small whole to pass your headphones through.Overall I was very pleased with this runner belt and I would recommend it to anyone.  Woogwin did sent me a promotional product for an honest review.

Great classic story with a great moral lesson:  "Never give up.  Don't lose hope and keep pressing forward.  You will find people to help you and sometimes they may bring you harm.  Be smart and you will find a way through your problems."It had been a long time since I'd heard this story and my kids loved hearing it for the first time.

8:44 Mins This GoPro bundle has just about everything that you'll need to put your GoPro about anywhere!  All the attachments are decent quality and seem like they'll last a while.  While I really liked the bulk of this bundle I had 3 complaints that caused me to drop it to 4 stars.1. The "Selfie Stick" piece doesn't really work with the GoPro.2. The vibration reducers don't fit in the attachment after it is clamped in place.3. The case has odd shapes that didn't really fit much.I go over these in more detail in the video.  Thanks for watching and if you find this review helpful, click "yes" below.  I did receive a promotional product in exchange for an honest review.

3:41 Mins Of all the Selfie Sticks I've used, this one seems to be best so far.  It is very comfortable and works well. It's compact and extends and contracts very smoothly.Check out my video review for more details and a demonstration.I received a promotional product to give an honest review.

I have tried a lot of different cases and some of my favorite are the most simple.  This case fits that category.  It is only one piece and super easy to install.  It fits snug and will protect the back and sides from any reasonable drops.  The bonus to this case is that you get a tempered glass screen protector to keep your screen protected.  The screen protector is comparable to the others on the market but is great to have it thrown in with this case.There are cheaper cases out there but given that this includes the tempered glass screen protector I think it is a fair price.  I was sent a promotional product for an honest review.

Aside from these arriving in a brown box that's not quite a pretty as an Apple box they appear to be the same cable. The ONLY difference I could find between these cables and the Apple cable that came with my iPhone is that the Apple cable was about 3/4 inch longer.  Other than that they were identical in look and feel.  The connectors were also identical.  The wall charger also looks similar to the Apple ones.  I did notice that it got pretty warm but not hot while charging my phone.My only complaint would be that the wall chargers are only rated at 1 Amp max output so they are really designed to only charge phones.  Other than that they are great and the price is right!  If I do experience any problems in the future with durability I'll update my review.I did receive a promotional product in exchange for an honest review.  If you found this review helpful please let me know by clicking "yes" below or if you have any questions please comment below.  Thanks!

3:16 Mins These sunglasses seem to be quality made.  They are comfortable on my face and look stylish too.  I don't know how often I will really change out the lens on the go, but it is a nice option to have.Only the tinted lens is polarized which works well for me.  Take a look at my video review for more details and an overview of the product.  If you find it helpful, please click "yes" below. This armband is the perfect solution to spotty bluetooth connection I've had when my phone is in my pocket while running.  I've run into bluetooth issues where it cuts in and out because there isn't direct line of sight between the phone and headset.  Now with the phone on my arm I don't have any issues at all.  I don't yet have my iPhone 6s but my iPhone 5s works fine in this case.What I like- Quality materials- Easy to put on- Feels comfortable on my arm- My pockets can be empty now as this hold anything essential that I need for running.What I don't like- Due to the nature of phone sizes, these cases are getting big to fit them.  I've got pretty skinny arms so it looks HUGE on me. :)Overall its a great armband at a good price point and I would recommend it to a friend.  I did receive this armband at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review.  Hope it was helpful!

When I first took this out of the packed I noticed right off the bat that it is not made of cotton.  It is more of a nylon/polyester that is super stretchy and feels just like a skirt my wife has.  I ordered a Large and I am 5'9" 165lbs and it was quite baggy especially for a slim fit.  I would go a size smaller if you want the slim look.  It is made from a very thin fabric and is very comfortable.My complaints are that the sleeves are way too long.  They hang down past my hands and have to be pushed up to about my elbow to stay up.  The neck is also a bit big for my taste.  Take a look at my pics to see how it fit on me.  If you are a V-neck person this could work for you but take note of my complaints first.  I received this item on promotion in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

First of all I thought this shirt felt a little big for a Large slim fit which I was fine with.  I was worried that it might be a little small but it fit about like how I like a shirt to fit.  It did not feel slim fit at all so if you are looking for that, I'd go a size smaller.Second, it says it is made of cotton, however it does not feel like cotton at all.  It feels more like a performance shirt than a cotton T-shirt which was a pleasant surprise.  It is stretchy and super comfortable.My two main complaints come down to the 3/4 sleeve that are just awkward.  Pushed up I thought they looked fine but all the way down did not look good.  Also the neck is a little wider than most of my shirts and I prefer a more crew neck.Over all this is a high quality shirt that is very comparable.  I received a promotional product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a pretty nice plaid shirt.  I typically order L size shirts but because it is classified as slim fit, I went a size bigger and it fits about right.  It is a little baggy in the mid section, but I really don't want anything that's tight so it fit very well.  I'm 5'9" and 165lbs so you can see from the pictures how it fit me.  I does seem to be high quality and well made.  I would recommend this plaid shirt.  I received this product on promotion in exchange for an unbiased review.

First of all, I'm 5'9" and about 165lbs.  When I saw that this was slim fit I decided to order an XL where I would normally order a L as I prefer a little room in a hoodie than a snug fit. I just recently got a bunch of little solar lights and these were a great addition!  They came will packaged so the glass globes didn't break.  They are actually quite solid and heavier than I thought they would be.  They are nice and bright and fade through different colors.  They also have an on/off switch so you don't have to have them on at night if you don't want.I did have one little issue when trying to put on the glass globe of the second light.  The little metal clips are pretty tough to bend back to slip the globe on.  The first one went on nice and snug quite possibly never to be removed again.  When putting on the second one, one of the prongs stayed a little bent rather than returning to its original position so that globe is not on as snug but is still secure and doesn't appear to be going anywhere.All in all, I really like these and they liven up our front yard a little and go great with the other solar lights I purchased. This insect killer is awesome!  Every summer we have an issue with TONS of flies in the garage.  I had to battle a swarm of flies just to get into the house with this box after it arrived on the door step.  I quickly set it up and took it to the garage.  I put it off to the side on the shelf and turned it on.  The next day there were significantly less flies.  I didn't see any swarming the door, just a few on the ceiling.  48 hours later I took the pictures that are posted below.  It was a fly grave yard.  They are nearly all gone after 2 days. If you've never tried one of these electric fly swatters, you are missing out.  I've had two other brands of electric fly swatters and they are all pretty much the same in functionality.  You put the batteries in and then push the button down when a flying insect is near.  All they have to do is touch the wires and POP they are history.  Sometimes it even makes a cool spark and loud popping noise.  It is truly spectacular!The reason I only gave 4 stars is because the price for this is a quite high.  You can pick one up at Harbor Freight for $4 and I've seen them a lot cheaper than $20 else where and there doesn't seem to be much variance between brands.Overall this is a good product that should help reduce the amount of flying pests in your vicinity.I received this for free in exchange for my unbiased honest review.

This is a stylish case that really does protect your iPad Air 2.  It actually also fits my iPad Air 1 however the top flaps don't sit flush on the screen. First of all this is not designed to put your phone in and leave it like a traditional "case".  It was designed to be a temporary housing for your phone in situations where you phone might get wet or you want to take your phone in water.This waterproof cases performed as advertised. It will fit a phone up to an iPhone 6 however anything smaller will also work. I put my iPhone 5s with battery case in it and it worked great. It fits easily in the case and the touch screen still works through the front plastic.It keeps your phone dry but be careful when opening it after getting it wet. This cable is great! I've got a lot of micro usb cables and so far this one has had the best performance that I have tested. I did a test to check the performance of this cable vs one of the regular mirco USB cables that came with another device.First of all, typically you get better results out of a shorter cable and in this case I'm comparing a 6in standard cable to the 6ft Crabby Digital premium cable. As far as the device I was charging for the test, I tried several different devices and settled on a 20000mAh power bank as it was getting the highest throughput. The images speak for themselves. The standard cable only gave an output of .25 amps while the Crabby Digital premium cable gave an output of 1.44 (up to 1.58) amps to the exact same power bank. That will give you significantly shorter charging times.The flat style cable has its advantages and disadvantages. It doesn't knot up as easy but you pretty much have to coil it back up the way it came or else it looks like a mess.Overall, this is a great cable with great throughput

This is a great little keyboard/case combo for the iPad Air.  The keyboard is very easy to pair with the iPad and the keys are very responsive. I wish they could control the heat as it charges as that is my main complaint, but I would still give it 5 stars.

Delightful, sparkling scent. While I would happily wear Oyedo any time of year, it reminds me of the holidays in New Mexico - sweet but not cloying, bright citrus topnotes with cedarwood basenotes. Imagine peeling clementines in a room decorated with fresh evergreen garland.
Nice design in cool colors. Sturdy and folds flat. Stable - works on a variety of surfaces. I use this to stream tv on my iphone in bed.

Soft, cozy, and warm. But this blanket definitely sheds - a handful in the dryer lint screen plus lots on dark pajamas (even with sheets between). If that's not a problem for you, then it's a nice blanket. I much prefer the completely shed-free blankets from American Blanket Company, but this was the only soft/loft fleece that came in pure white. Purchased as a gift, and conducted a side-by-side comparison.

I've had mine for a couple years now. They still work great and hold a seal even when re-used multiple times. I've heard a few complaints about them, so I wanted to mention a few things in my review that worked for me.Here are some tips to getting the bags to work really well. Use the proper size bag and do not be tempted to overfill them - use fewer items in more bags and use the proper size bags. For instance, fold bulky bedding fewer times (so they're flatter) and place them in large bags rather than in smaller bags with a bulkier fold/stack. Place the items deep into the bag, and leave plenty of space near the seal. You don't want anything pushing the walls of the bag apart near the seal. When closing, pinch the clip firmly and go over the seal a few times, making sure to go all the way to the edges. Do not try to bend or fold the bags once they're collapsed and don't cram them into snug spaces (in other words, be sure to store them in such a way that if they do happen to break their seal and expand, that won't cause a problem).
Not bad quality. A little thinner than I like for hot beverages, but it's very hard to find the long sip stirs! Wish they came in white!
Oh, just heavenly.
Nice and tiny - fits in my over-crowded studio tools drawer. Works perfectly. First glue gun I've had that doesn't overheat the glue, causing drips.
These cushions are exactly as described. Fit my rockers nicely and the color is a nice chocolate, as described. They'll be outside, so I'll edit this a few months from now for fading.
Worked perfectly! Color camouflaged against my house for an elaborate lighting display - excellent length. Not too long, not too short. Very high quality, flexible cable.
Well made, launders and fits nicely. That part gets five stars. But knocking off a star for the fabric. I'd love it if these came in a bit better quality fabric choices such as fleece, bamboo, etc.

Very nice little set for small projects or introduction to acrylic painting. Decent amount of pigment saturation for a beginner's set, though you may want to supplement this set with an additional tube of titanium white. Overall, very impressive!

BIG. This tray can serve all sorts of utilitarian and decorative purposes. Currently mine is in use holding a stack of rolled bath towels for my summer guests. It would be perfect for storing hobby supplies or cosmetics. It's very sturdy, so it can be used for caddying meals/beverages. I think if you spoil your pets rotten, it would even make an adorable portable cat or dog bed with a little memory foam mattress tucked in it.
Exactly as pictured/described. Sturdy little plastic scoops to tuck into your bulk jars and bins.
Always perfect. Coarse ground nibs, cinnamon, and coarse sugar. Perfect for hot beverages, but my favorite new thing is to grate this over vanilla ice cream. Try it - you will not regret it!

Really delicious. Tastes like a summer day - ripe peaches with a hint of cinnamon. I was expecting more of a "spiced" peach butter type of spread because of the name. But honestly the peaches are perfect without the extra spices. I'm a total jam/preserve/spread snob. If you are too, you'll love this.

Very bright. I love that they're cool to the touch and no bigger than a standard incandescent bulb. They fit in my antique light fixtures no problem. The one drawback for me is they are quite bright - if you don't have a shade to diffuse them they can be difficult to look directly at and give a slight harsh cast.

Really cute and fun. Gorgeous, saturated colors. Great for a nightlight or creating atmosphere. Not bright enough to read by or anything, but perfect for some fun effects. I have mine in an antique boudoir lamp which requires small bulbs that don't get too hot. This is perfect.

It's great for most applications, but the adhesive feels less tacky as well as a little more "gooey" compared to standard duck tape. Looks great but doesn't feel like it adheres as well as standard duck tape.

Let me start by saying I really dislike LED bulbs. They typically have an artificial greyish color and hazy glare that really irritates my eyes. The Ledare LED has a warmer color  - very close to incandescent bulbs. I have the little IKEA clamp lamp that these fit in, and it works perfectly in the guest bed corner of my studio where I don't have room for a full size lamp or table. It works well for task lighting, and I don't have to worry about it getting hot.
Nice size. Not super powerful, but perfect for wildlife spotting, sporting events, etc.

Super nice wire. Strong, but with a supple, kink-resistant drape. A breeze to work with. A nice bonus is the finish - having a neutral color and slightly dull surface it's nearly invisible strung through transparent beads. But where it does show, it blends beautifully into antiqued brass and gold components. Love it!

Should have read the reviews before I ordered. I have purchased other Richland candles and they're quite good quality. These "votives" don't seem to be anywhere near the quality of their pillar styles. They're made from crumbly, aerated wax, and they're less than half the size of most votives - more like a tea light than a votive, really. Also the approximate burn time of 10 hours is way off. I tested them indoors and it was more like half that - less than 6 hours.
Very well made. Was easy to mount inside my pantry and came with mounting hardware. I use this in the kitchen for disposable latex gloves.

it's difficult to find unscented poured pillar candles in beautiful colors. If you can find them, they are usually poorly made, with aerated wax that burns too quickly and smokes. The Richland candles are proportioned correctly, made with solid creamy wax and a thicker wick to prevent wick-drowning or core-burning. The colors are rich and gorgeous just like the photos, and the color runs all the way through - not white with a color dip. They're long-burning and nearly odorless. Whether you just decorate with these or actually use them (as I do), they're a very high quality candle for a really good price. I'll be ordering more!

These candies are the real thing. Real bing cherries (not those flavored jellies in other candies). Real chocolate (quality chocolate with cocoa butter - not that partially hydrogenated vegetable oil in other candy). Real vanilla (not artificial vanillin). If you know the difference and care, you will appreciate the quality of this product. Plump, chewy, sweet dried bing cherries dipped in a thick layer of chocolate. What's not to love? These make a wonderful treat to spoil yourself or the perfect gift for someone who loves chocolate and cherries. They're even gorgeous in a fancy dish served to guests.Editing to make a confession. I ordered more of these to give as gifts this year, but I raided them as they sat in the pantry - and now I have to order them yet again. I was treating myself to "just one" as a reward for getting all my chores done, or doing a good deed, etc. But now I find myself digging into the bag for "maybe two" to reward myself for future chores and good deeds that I may get around to doing someday. It's a sickness.

These candies are the real thing. Real bing cherries (not those flavored jellies in other candies). Real chocolate (quality chocolate with cocoa butter - not that partially hydrogenated vegetable oil in other candy). Real vanilla (not artificial vanillin). If you know the difference and care, you will appreciate the quality of this product. Plump, chewy, sweet dried bing cherries dipped in a thick layer of chocolate. What's not to love? These make a wonderful treat to spoil yourself or the perfect gift for someone who loves chocolate and cherries. They're even gorgeous in a fancy dish served to guests.

This beautiful yarn is really soft with the slightest luster. The color is very rich, neither artificial nor muted. I purchased the tangerine to make pompoms, and they came out absolutely gorgeous - plump and velvety-soft. Placing another order for a bunch more.

This is a very clever device. Super easy to use - no learning curve whatsoever. I've been using cardboard donuts forever to make pompons... never again! I ended up wasting so much yarn the old way - tediously trying to get my pompons consistent sizes and perfectly shaped and trimmed. The Clover eliminates that process entirely! Your pompons come out exactly the same size and perfectly round every time. Only a few snips required for a perfectly round ball with a velvety-smooth surface. No more tedious pom-pom haircuts! You can make them as plush as you like, and they're still a cinch to tie. I'm gonna buy a bunch more yarn and cover my house with fat, plush, colorful pompons! Wheee!!If you like ultra-soft, plump, velvety pompons, I recommend Red Heart E728.4422 Soft Yarn, Tangerine. Easy to work with!

I'm disappointed in the quality of this wicker box. I purchased some of these a few years ago, and the old ones are great quality, with evenly woven, strong, flexible wicker, square corners, lids that fit. THIS file, however, is barely better than junk - not really worth the money, in my opinion. Just unwrapping it out of the thin plastic bag broke off several pieces. It's very lopsided and loosely-woven with the same chunky, stiff, brittle wicker they make cheap baskets out of. There are big gaps all over and the lid doesn't even fit. It's been coated with some sort of varnish that gives it an even cheaper appearance. The finish is a glossy, darker orange-y stain... not like the photo, and not what I would call "natural" wicker at all.

I store a lot of tools in my utensil canister, so I like my tools as streamlined as possible. I don't quite understand the current trend of kitchen tools with fat, padded grips and heavy handles. This Gourmac utensil is sleek and easy to hold. It's molded in one piece (nowhere for bacteria or moisture to hide). It slides quickly and effortlessly into/out of my utensil canister. Its cheery color is perfect in my kitchen, which I'm also picky about. I'm certain this tool was designed by someone that actually uses kitchen tools on a regular basis.

Ordered three. One was already half dead and needed new battery. These are much dimmer than the 16 LED terminals for the same price on Amazon, and the batteries are much more uncommon and difficult to replace. They'll work fine, but I'm not super impressed.

Lovely, affordable panels with that expensive raw-silk sheen. Not too shiny, not too dull. But if you're picky about matching colors, keep in mind the variations in computer monitors when ordering stuff online. I ordered the truffle panels, which look peachy-tan on my screen. They're much more of a warm-neutral tan in person. Happily, the color looks beautiful with my hardwood floors, so I'll be keeping them.

My house has the heavy metal Restoration Hardware rods on all the windows. I wanted to approximate that look in the art studio without spending a lot of money. This rod is perfect. Gives the look without costing a fortune. Plenty sturdy if installed properly. Took me 20 minutes to get the freakin' box open and about 5 minutes to install.
Nice, sturdy little turtle case for your removable drive. Well made and compact.
A thousand plastic forks? Yes, please.

Unusual. The flavor sort of approximates caramel and chocolate, but is much, much stronger and slightly artificial. In my opinion, these would taste better with a more subtle, buttery flavor. One single candy left my mouth with the most bizarre aftertaste for hours. I've never eaten sugar-free candy that made me wish I had a toothbrush with me. So many other more satisfying sugar-free treats out there for a fraction of the price.

Sharpie makes some of the best markers out there. I've used so many brands of markers in my design work, even some very high-end brands, and none are as juicy, pigment-saturated, and long lasting as Sharpie. A few things I like about Sharpies: The color saturates the paper evenly so you don't get as much stroke/overlap marks as with other markers. The solvent base does not destroy paper like many other markers - even thin or delicate paper. Sharpies contain a lot of product. Other marker brands are fat, so they look like they hold a lot of juice. But side by side, in identical jobs, my Sharpies outlast even the most expensive brands of design markers.They're not really intended for pro illustration/design, so they don't come in a wide variety of colors (yet). The cap colors don't really match the pigment very well. But what they lack in that category they make up for in quality and price. I wish all markers were this good. Go Sharpies!

This is a really lovely lantern in person. It's bigger than I imagined. The color is a vivid Chinese red with golden characters, tassel, and bands separating the chambers. It seems to be made of nylon, not paper as in the description. So it's quite a bit sturdier than I was expecting and it should withstand a bit of weather. I lit mine with a short strand of mini lights tucked down inside. It looks spectacular! Really great price on such a pretty item.

This snake is *very* realistic looking. I even scare myself when I see it out of the corner of my eye. The paint colors are naturalistic, and it has a subtle glossy topcoat that gives it a lifelike sheen. Pose the neck and head up a bit, and you'll swear you see it move. Supposedly it keeps cats off your deck or porch and out of the garden. I'll edit this review down the road to let you know how well it works. If cats get spooked by this as much as I do, they'll want to use someone else's property as their nocturnal toilet.
Exactly as pictured, lovely colors. The frames are made of nylon or plastic, so they won't rust and discolor outside.

To all of you who say this is way too small, one serving of cereal is only 3/4 of a cup.What it can hold:Description says the milk container is 5.7 oz which is .71 cups or almost 3/4 of a cup.  It only holds 1/2 cup of milk.Description says the cereal container is 12 oz which is 1 1/2 cups (1.5).  It only holds 1 1/4 (1.25) cups.I use one serving size which is typically between 3/4 to 1 cup of cereal and 1/2 cup of milk (yeah that is all it holds) and it is just enough milk for one serving.Complaints on milk freezing - place the gel cup in the refrigerator instead of the freezer to get it cold and the milk will not freeze and it stays plenty cold.The spoon is not sturdy.  I discarded mine and use a real spoon.No leaks.Cleans easily.Happy cerealing.

I've used Otterbox with several Apple devices over the past five years and this was my least favorite.  I actually returned it for a refund.  Here's the deal...Description says it has a portrait viewing angle but it really does not.  Sure, you can sit it in a Portrait viewing angle but the cover, which turns into the stand, does not have any feet or pegs or slots to support that angle.  So, unless you are completely still it falls down.  Landscape mode is much better but you really only have one option for viewing/typing which is an awkward angle for my taste.  There is a second landscape viewing option which is completely upright, which is designed for movie watching but it falls forward if you aren't completely still.  I watch movies laying in bed so when the dog jumps on the bed it falls out, etc., you get the idea.I bought the Speck Candyshell after many iPad2 case trails and tribulations and absolutely love it, FYI.

I did a lot of research before I purchased this and I'm glad I bought these strips.  My teeth were significantly whiter after just three uses and I stopped.  I didn't want to appear as if I had gone and bleached my teeth, that's not my style :).  So, I still have a lot more when I want to freshen up.  Great buy.
This isn't what I expected at all but it was very good.  There are lots of historical aspects to the movie.  I'm a native Virginian and I found it entertaining and very interesting.

I purchased the white one and now I wish I would have bought a different color but it is a great case.  I feel like I have the protection of an Otterbox Defender (which I have used for three years) but without the bulk.  I highly, highly recommend.  I am using it with the Moshi iVisor screen protector and the case fits over it perfectly.

Some reviewers said the smell was off and questioned its authenticity.  I've used Mountain Rose Herbs rosemary oil and Young Living rosemary oil brands and this smells and works just like both of those.  If you're not familiar buy a dram instead to make sure you like it.

So I bought it because I thought it was for iPad 2 and it wasn't.  Womp womp.  I should have read more carefully and not relied on the search results.  Amazon please fix this so it is not queued up when someone searches for iPad 2 cases and you may want to add first generation somewhere in the product description (not that anyone will ever read this).

I've tried many - I'm talking at least 15 different iPad cases which I either sold on Craigslist or returned for a refund.  All of them had something wrong - mostly design flaws, some construction flaws.This is very well made and so incredibly versatile.I love hanging it from the knobs on my kitchen cabinets when I'm cooking and referring to recipes.  I sometimes hang it on my door knob to remind me to take it to work in the morning.  The best part is the portrait viewing angle.  Most cases are in designed for landscape viewing which behooves me why the designers and manufacturers haven't figured out a lot of programs are in portrait only - especially note taking apps and journaling apps.  The portrait mode allows you to move the device from almost completely flat to completely up right and every angle in between.  The landscape viewing is less versatile but very convenient and sturdy nonetheless.  Perfect viewing angles for watching movies.I use a Speck case for my iPhone 5 as well which I absolutely love.  I will be using all Speck products for my Apple devices from here on.Very happy customer.

The grooves on the bottom portion are not deep enough and therefore the screen tends to fall flat.  This is both in portrait or landscape modes.  Very frustrating.  I returned mine for a refund and bought Speck handyShell which I love, love, love.

Seriously.  I first experienced the Moshi iVisor when I purchased one for my iPad in October of 2011.  It really is a completely different user experience.  No glares, no concerns with scratching the screen and the same responsiveness as no screen protector.  It seems pricey but well worth it.  I have taken mine off several times and washed with dawn soap and water.  Let air dry - do NOT use a papertowel and do NOT use a towel to dry it with because the sticky parts will pull fuzz which is difficult to remove.

This is a good quick refresher to get you into the correct mind frame before going into an interview.  The book retells of tricks and trades we've heard before but it is mostly solid advice.  For the price, it is a great pre-interview prep.

I gave this to my two mixed breed dogs and two cats.  It made one of my cats throw up every day I gave it to her and one of my dogs threw up after every meal I gave it to her as well.  My other dog did not physically get sick (that I saw) but he was coughing and hacking a lot which is very unlike him.  I contacted Amazon and I'm returning for a refund.
Nothing to e-mail or text home about.  Has a good smell but you need to use a lot to get a lot of bubbles.

This is a great price considering how much you get.  I use this on my face, under my eye area and on my lips.  I do have to re-apply often but I like it.  I sometimes use under my eyes at night when I'm too lazy to get my vitamin c serum out of the fridge :).
I got these glasses because they just looked fun and for $7 you can't go wrong.Every time I've worn these someone says how much they love them and want to know where I purchased from.  Very fun.
I wasn't impressed with this at all.  It is very small as well.  Better off going to your local artisan shop and buying home made soap from there.

This is absolutely perfect for my needs.  I'm a young woman who owns my home on about an acre of land surrounded by trees.  Often have tree limbs come down during storms, etc.  This has been the perfect size to cut everything I need cut.  I've even cut some larger sized trees and it has worked very well.  It stays charged for several uses and it is easy to add oil.  I highly recommend.  Highly.

My recently engaged co-worker was sharing her frustration with not being able to find a great wedding planner.  I went online and found this and ordered it for her.  She absolutely loves it and says it has everything and more she was looking for.  Great price.

I've boycotted the $150/month TV service and have gone "no TV". I have internet only and watch free movies/tv shows using my Amazon Prime Membership and I have a $7.99/mo Hulu account. That's it. So, this is nice having my Roku where I can access Hulu and Amazon Prime right on my large screen TV at home. It also has Angry Birds, which I haven't been able to figure out how to throw them because I'm so used to playing it on my iPhone :). There are a lot of other channels you can download that give you free news feeds, etc. Highly recommend, especially for those of you going "no TV". Happy couch potato.

Hey guys.  I'm a Comcast business class customer and this works great for me.  I have a stronger signal in my bedroom (opposite side of the house) than I did with my Comcast modem, I can even stream movies in my bedroom on my iPad now, something I wasn't able to do before.Regarding Comcast device protocol - I was told by their tech department that even though they could "see" it was working, it wasn't one of their two approved devices for replacement of their modem (and subsequent $7.00/mo modem fee being waived).  However, I called back the rep who opened my account several times and I spoke with several people in customer service and now they have removed the monthly modem fee from my account and gave me a credit back to the beginning of my service (several months back).I definitely recommend this for Comcast customers.  You might have a little resistance but be persistent.

It was crazy easy to put together.  For that, I give it five stars.  But I never felt like I was getting a good workout.  I never felt it in my abs or was sore and I used it a lot.  Wasn't the right fit for me. I returned it.

I absolutely love this little guy.  It works fabulously and diffuses/mists approximately 6-7 hours before it needs a refill.  If you use it with the light on, your water evaporates much quicker (3-4 hours), I'm guessing because of the heat from the light.  I bought this on August 26, 2012 and have run it constantly, day and night and it has been wonderful.  Its a pleasure coming home and my house smells like lemons and oranges.  I use 5-10 drops of organic lemon essential oil and sweet orange essential oil both which are anti-fungal and anti-viral.  If I could afford it, I would buy one for my bedroom and the office of my house.  I highly recommend.  I can't remember the last time I was more satisfied with a purchase.UPDATE JAN 28, 2013:Ok.  So I decided to give my unit a thorough washing the beginning of January (I purchased mine Aug 2012).  Afterwards, I couldn't get it to cut back on.  I figured I got water into places that shouldn't have received water.  I called the manufacturer to get some advice they never called back.  Amazon was less than helpful (one of the few times this has happened).  So, I began messing around with it and behold!  It DOES work!  Its crazy... sometimes I have to hold the "on" button down for 10-20 seconds.  Sometimes I have to hit the on button several times and then hold it down for a few seconds but it DOES come on every single time.  So, to all of you out there who say your until stopped working, if you still have it in a closet somewhere, break it out and mess around with the on button.  You never know.I still use mine every single day 24/7 and its great.Happy essential oil diffusing!  Oh, and if you haven't already, try some grapefruit oil.

This is a very versatile oil and my first time purchasing it.  I have used it a lot - everything from an eye make-up remover to making my own anti-aging serums and creams.  There are a lot of DIY recipes that call for this.  I highly recommend.

This does not behave like a normal diffuser.  I don't think plugging it in even does anything.  If you put essential oil on the insert, you can smell it for a day or two but that's it.  You would have the same result just putting essential oil on a tissue and leaving it in your car.  I wanted to return it but by the time I remembered, the window had closed.

I've written these reviews before on Zeel (Heal Zeel / Traumeel) and I'll continue to write them to let all of the animal lovers out there know that a safe, non-toxic, all natural way to relieve your pet from its arthritis pain exists.  This is it.I give my husky mix one pill twice a day with his meals morning and night.  He's been on this for over a year and I can absolutely tell a difference in his activity level, jumping, movements, attitude, etc.  He is approximately thirteen (13).Since my dog is arthritic, I also give him Flex-A-Min joint supplements (one (1) two times a day with meals).

This was overwhelming with the smell of lavender even though it is one of the last ingredients.  Way, way too "perfumy" for me to even use.  If you are sensitive to essential oils that are not made properly and are too "perfumy" don't buy this.
This is just OK for me.  Nothing to write home (or anywhere else) about and it is very pricey.  Just o-k.

This took awhile to receive since it was shipped from Hong Kong but worth the wait.It works as described and really unleashes a whole new world for your iPad and iPhone.  The possibilities are endless with this little device.  Can't beat the price.  Period.

I was really hoping the people who wrote the bad reviews were just numnuts and the people who wrote the good reviews were the techies who knew what they were doing :).  Well, the keyboard keys started popping off after one week.  It was GREAT up until then and had lots of comments and inquiries as to where I purchased it.  I will keep looking.

I upgraded one of the windows computers in our office with this RAM.  It installed seamlessly and there was an instant difference on the performance of the computer.  Great stuff.  What a low-cost way to improve the performance of an old computer.  Highly recommend.

I bought this for my new laptop. I've always used cooling pads and I needed a new one after my old one died.This one was just fine and not too big since I have a smaller laptop.The fan is quiet, and like how it can "prop" it up. The blue light is always nice.I had to send mine back due to the fact that the charging port seemed to have been damaged through transport.I will be ordering another of the same brand/style.

I bought this particular case for my Dell XPS 13 (2015). It is about 1/2" to about 1" bigger than my laptop, but as a protective case, it serves it's purpose. (So, I basically use it as a hard sleeve.) It definitely looks like an old book and already received a few complements on it. The librarian thought I was walking away with one of the old books there. :)The zipper is a little sticky, but that was remedied with wax.The brown "leather" I received looks good, it's lightweight, is stiff, and the case is not flimsy. The inside has the flaps for all corners of your laptop, and has a "suede" like lining. It's a unique item and looks good for both men and women to have as their laptop case.Hope that helps.
Found this one here on Amazon after some research.It looks like a sturdy plain eyelash curler and it's just what I was looking for.My hunt is over and I will definitely recommend this product.

Purchased this item to get a lot of stuff off of my (one and only) trusty old laptop. It runs such an old operating system and its set up was being bulked up over the years. Which is why I needed this item for eliminating a lot of pictures and school projects and documents. It helped to get my PC running better and I have my things backed up as well.It is small and it's size is approximately that of one of those bigger cell phones out there, but smaller than a small tablet. I purchased a case for it (here on Amazon) to keep the dust and dog hair away from it.Short USB cord included.
Suits well for my Canon 60D SLR camera. No issues with slow writing speeds. Does its job for my needs as an general amateur photographer.

I received the thinner (female) ring and it's nice and shiny. The "precious" ring is just what I wanted for my fan girl needs to wear as a wedding ring. I also have the thicker "silver color" tungsten one but this one is more feminine.The inscription is not very pronounced but it's not faint. You can see it.The tungsten shines is great because it doesn't get dull.If you plan to wear this around your neck, perhaps get the thicker male ring, not this female thinner ring.The inscriptions are also in the inside of the ring.

Even though my husband is the Lincoln historian, I bought this hat for myself in medium. I have a "medium" sized head and the hat is just snug enough. If you don't like that, I suggest you go up a size.The fabric is thick and it's lined on the inside. The brim is stiff and not cheap looking. The buckle is simple.It would seem that it will be too warm to wear on hot days, but I plan to use this as a general hat.

My last diffuser had recently died. (I also bought it here on Amazon, and it was a great little thing.) I used my last diffuser everyday and it eventually wore out. (I was careful and maintained it often.) I plan to use this one just as much. I came upon this one due to the good reviews and different type of design.I use every night with my Doterra essential oils. Depending on the oil, you'll need to add a few more drops or less. The mist is great and I find it suits my needs. I use this in a decent sized apartment bedroom and it works well. This product is also easy to operate and quiet. (My last diffuser had a beep when it shut off.) It's not completely quiet though, I find the gentle water bubbling sound quite soothing.It has a large basin that accommodates plenty of water. The one setting is continuous and the other has 20 second diffusion intervals. The lid/top does not screw or latch on, so be careful with pets or children. The light also has two settings: alternating bright to dim, and continuous light. (And off, of course.) One of the main features that I had researched was the fact that it shut off when water was low. This one does just that, so I am pleased with that feature.The grey color I ordered was fine for my decor. The size is taller than my older one, but that's because of the design. (See my picture for approximate size reference.)I recommend this product for your essential oil diffusion needs.

I  pull this thing out every late Autumn and place on our bed, and now in early Spring, I have to now remove it because it's too warm to have it on our bed now, even when shut off. Here in Southern California, we don't get year-round use of this blanket but it works for us in the "colder" days of the winter months because we do not have any central heating.Before we retire at night, we turn the thing on and go brush our teeth. By the time we're done, we get into a nice warm bed. I suggest you plug this directly into a wall and not a power strip. Unless it's a "heavy duty" power strip, you won't get the same kind of power output. My side wasn't as "warm" as my husband's and I realized that it was on a power strip. Plugging it into the wall solved that problem and now we enjoy the same warmth.It's great that you do not feel the wires, unless you really look for them. It's also nice enough to leave on your bed for the rest of the year if you live in a cooler area. I've had this for a few years now and I wish I get more months of use out of it, but that's okay. I love the adjustable setting (we have the Queen) and can set it to what we want. I also love that you can set it and it shuts off after 8 hours. (I can't count how many times I've forgotten to shut it off after running out the door in the morning for work. But it shuts off automatically.)This isn't your "grandma's" heating blanket but I'd definitely get this for grandma as a nice and toasty gift. ;)

I'm a fan of both the books and movies and decided upon this decal. I wanted it for my car at first, but decided to place in my laptop so it gets more views. (Especially at school.) It's a great size for that and have no complaints. I'm opting for another one for my car and will acquire the "Hobbit" company soon.

These were a Christmas gift on my Amazon wish list and I got them.These boots run slightly big, however I use thick socks with these and those cushion inserts. They don't run huge, just your size with some room. They are great for walking your dog in the rain and not having to worry about stepping in puddles. These are stiffer than your regular boots but don't hinder me on my walks. They do make some noise but I don't use them everyday (in Southern California) and I still need to break them in.Had them on my list because they are unique, had a cute design, and the color goes with almost anything.

The last flash drive i had was only 1gb in size and used for class documents. But as time went on, I've used this for other things. So through the years, things had piled up in there. To avoid this, and buying yet another one, I went to the 32gb so that I won't have to worry about fitting things in there. (And as a geography student, this is perfect for all my huge GIS map documents, etc.)I was lucky to grab this on sale here on Amazon, so I got a good deal for this size. (Too bad you can't pick the color. If I was a guy, I might have a little problem with it.)

Got this in Beige and Black. Both are nice and I use them often. Great for use in the heat as it is lightweight and ventilated. It is lined a bit in the crown, so that's a nice plus. It is your standard "paper" hat, but it is my no means "cheap" in quality. It's is of decent quality and is made well. (It's not a cheap costume type hat, if you know what I mean.) The price is just right, so if you happen to take this with you on vacation, and happen to lose it, it won't be as painful in your wallet.-->My only gripe: Both of my hats were shipped in an opaque plastic bag, with a Styrofoam hat insert. It my all means, did not do much good. My hats were shipped with a few deep creases in the brim and crown. But I knew this may happen during transport. I simply put my iron in a low setting and ironed out the wrinkles in my hat. The lowest setting was not enough, so I gradually increased the heat of my iron. I used the styrofoam insert, and covered the insert with a cotton t-shirt, then stuffed it into the crown. I was able to iron out all the creases in the crown too. My hats look great and good as new.Oh and the other thing was that it took almost a month to get to my house in Southern California, from the seller. So I suspect that given the cheap price of these hats, they come from overseas. So keep that in mind when ordering.

As a geography student, this fits the bill because it has what I need for on the go. I suppose it can fit into your pocket, but it's a bit smaller than one of those "mini" tablets. (Or think "pocket-sized" Bible or dictionary.)This 2008 edition isn't the most updated, however it's the one I refer to the most.The size is just perfect, and the maps inside are broken down in sections so that I am able to look into each country/region in more detail.For now, this has been my constant companion for my needs. Maybe in the future, I'll be able to look into acquiring myself the larger, more updated Oxford edition.

This is a lightweight hat. It feels cool and airy enough to wear in the hotter months.It's got nice coverage, especially in the front. If you're looking for a shorter bill, this isn't it. This is a bigger "fedora" yet it's not huge, by all means. It feels more like a Panama hat. I can see somebody using this on vacation and not worry if you lose it. (The price looks great too.)The khaki color is great and goes with almost anything. This is made of "paper" but it's not what you think. It's a cheap, nice looking hat. It's like a stiffer straw hat, but with more sun coverage. (No huge "holes" in the brim.) The hat does have some stiffness to it and is not flimsy at all. It does have a sweatband, and the crown is thinly lined, but the brim is not. The fibers in the brim is thick enough to give you some adequate sun coverage.-->My only gripe: It was shipped in an opaque plastic bag, with a Styrofoam hat insert. It my all means, did not do much good. My hat shipped with a few deep creases in the brim and crown. But I knew this may happen during transport. I simply put my iron in a low setting and ironed out the wrinkles in my hat. The lowest setting was not enough, so I gradually increased the heat of my iron. I used the styrofoam insert, and covered the insert with a cotton t-shirt, then stuffed it into the crown. I was able to iron out all the creases in the crown too. My hat looks great and good as new.I look forward to using this hat since we are still going to have heat well into October here in Southern California.

I've been looking for a long-lasting eyeliner without having to get the gel kind, etc. This one is great. I've used the ones from Avon and also others in the drug store and found that this one lasts much, much longer that ones I've tried before. I use eyeliner everyday, and I can't seem to find a "waterproof" one that lasts even for a few hours.I use on my waterline and on my lash line. I only need to apply once, and maybe another time after about 5 minutes. (Because blinking seems to always thin it a little, right?) I find that it lasts all day. Usually, by the end of the day, my eyeliner is non-existent on my eyes. With this one, I can see that I still have it on and don't need to re-apply. (That's unless you feel you need to "re-freshen" all your make-up to go out or something.)I don't use the smudge part at the other end, so I won't comment on that further.I don't think I will look any further than this product.

This is a nice fashion piece. Simple, yet really adds to your wardrobe. I find that this dark grey color is great because it's not black, yet not light grey. The felt/wool fabric is a bit more flexible and more floppy-ish than other hats I own. Like most hats, it isn't lined inside, yet it has a black ribbon "sweat band" inside. This is a nice light-weight hat, but won't feel like it will blow away.It is definitely crush-able and compact, however I do not recommend it. The one thing that I did not like about this hat is the way it was shipped. It was folded into one of those mail-able, plastic, opaque, mailing "envelopes." So this caused my hat to acquire a noticeable bend/crease in the brim and the crown part. I was unable to use it that day for an event I was going to attend. However, since I understood that wool/felt could be ironed, I did so under the proper low-iron setting. I was able to iron out the deep creases and it seemed to come out better than new.I also didn't like that it took longer than usual to arrive, possibly from the seller's destination. I do like the hat enough to try in different colors. The difficult part is which color(s) to choose.

This bag is a little darker blue and more of a dark navy blue. I still love the color. I got complements already. I can see this as a great school bag and easily fit my book and notebooks. I can also see your laptop fitting in this. It came with a shoulder strap as well. The decorative tassels on each side didn't seem to have a function other than fashion. I chose to remove those.The hardware is not a deep brass color and from far away, you can't tell if it is silver-ish or golden brass. It's no biggie, I like it just the same. Inside it has two "cell phone" pockets and the classic zipper pocket. There is a zipper pocket on the outside at back.It also came with a NutriChart which I have not used yet.

This personal mister works like a charm and is compact. Was great in our recent trip to Disneyland during our recent heat wave. It fit in my purse and didn't take up much room at all. No leaks and holds enough water for personal use, and to mist your friends as well. I got a few envious eyes during a long wait time in one of the rides under the full hot sun.The instructions are clear, and you only need up to 7 pumps to get this going for a long time. It also helps to do what they say and when you want to open the top, you need to de-pressurize first. (Mist upside-down for 10 seconds or so.) Filling with water was easy and quick.I had no problems misting, opening the top part, and filling with water. I also had no problem or difficulty using the top button. The water seems to last a long time. I plan to use this again and again.

I have a small bridge, but I love the style of my glasses. I found this here on Amazon to help "close the gap" where it needed to be. My glasses look like the picture, the plastic "un-adjustable" nose bridge type.(I have turtle-shell plastic wayfarer glasses. So I used the black silicone pads.)The sticky part of the pad does not last. I knew this from other cheap ones I've used in the past. But since these were silicone, I simply used scissors to trim a bit, and used super glue, and I've had no problems.Update June 2015: The pads are still going strong. The superglue has kept them on and no problems experienced.

Right out of the box, this ring is nice-looking. When I don't want to fuss with wearing my older double ring, I now use this one. (The other one shifts too much and I'm constantly shifting it all day.)Anyway, it has some heft and it is thicker than I'm used to. I like how it feels solid and sparkles. It has the word "Titanium" engraved in the inside which is fine. The stones don't move and they are pretty bright for CZ's.I already have some wear and tear on it because I'm hard on my rings but it doesn't detract from the beauty of it. It's also great that the CZ's are all the way around the ring. Now I don't have to think about shifting the CZ's into view when it shifts. This is a great ring for those of you who don't want to fuss with other fancier rings.I haven't taken this ring off. When I use a piece of jewelry, I use it for a long time. (So I only own a few pieces.) My only regret is that I didn't find this ring 9 years ago when we got married.

I've ordered the brown one. It looks great and smells good. My iPad 2 actually fits snugly. I've conducted a "shake test"...I've placed my iPad into the case and tried to shake it upside-down to see if it would fall out onto my bed. No, it stayed in place. I did notice that it shifted slightly. I may place some thin craft foam between my case and iPad to create some more thickness. OR I may simply add (sew)in another thin elastic going vertically. (I may be paranoid but I'd rather be safe.)The elastic was NOT loose as previous reviewers have stated. I did not see any "warping" either but then again, I've only had it one day. The knob there is pretty flat so it does not look like it will interfere with anything. I don't see any interference with the zippers anywhere. (I'm thinking some previous reviewers here have the misfortune of receiving a defective one OR that the company has improved their product.)The outside of it already has some leather "scratches" that I will assume will increase as I use it. I can't wait until the normal wear and tear adds to the character of it. I like how the inside of it is soft and almost plush. It definitely has some sort of soft layer for cushioning.Overall, I know I will get lots of use out of it. As a student, this will provide added safety since it could blend in with my other books. I have the awesome ClamCase and I use that a lot but it would be great to use this for bed and school.I will post some pictures up.If I encounter any problems, I will be very sure to update this review.

I found this cup at a local BB&Beyond store. I like to use it with my iced sodas or iced water. I love how it rinses or cleans easily. It doesn't stain or retain any smells. It's sturdy but light and insulates better than those plastic cups you get at the coffee shop.I love how I can hand this to the local coffee shop and they'll fill it for me with my favorite iced brew. I do wish it was double-walled so that it wouldn't bleed so much or wished it was better insulated. The plastic scratches easily if you forget and scrub it with the rough side of the sponge, so don't do that. From far away, it looks just like the fancy coffee cups from the coffee shops. It's great that the straw has a fanned edge to keep it from lifting out (with soda) and from easily losing the straw when washing.It's not the "environmental" mumbo-jumbo that has me using this cup. It's just that I like to use this sturdy cup instead of the flimsy plastic stuff they give you at the coffee shops. It insulates much better and it doesn't freeze my fingers off because of the brown rubber on this cup. The baristas give me an extra big smile when I use this cup and the 10% discount for using it doesn't hurt either.I've frozen it and washed it many times and it hasn't failed me yet. I love to use it with the iced teas, coffees, soda, punch...of course this isn't for the hot stuff. (See the Copco travel coffee mug for the hot stuff.)

I bought mine for about the same price from BB&Beyond. I wanted the tan colored one so that it will look like a paper coffee cup from a distance like the ones you get from the coffee shops, but they had no more in stock.Anyway, the cup does it's job. It's light but sturdy, it's functional and good looking. The brown part helps keep your grip on the cup as well as keeps your fingers cool. It cleans well and I haven't had a problem yet. I use it almost everyday, even for my cold drinks. I love that I can take it to the local coffee shop and they fill it up for me without having to use a paper cup. Sometimes the the coffee tastes like the paper cup and this plastic cup eliminates that "paper-coffee" taste. I don't care about the "environment" mumbo-jumbo but I don't like to be wasteful either so using this cup helps prevent my trash from filling up quicker and again, eliminates that dreaded paper-coffee taste when using paper cups.I like that when I'm done with drinking my coffee at work, that I can re-fill it with ice water or soda and it keeps my drink cold for a long time.This cup cleans well and the coffee doesn't stain it. It's comfortable to hold and it fits well in my car cup holder. My boss thought I was buying coffee everyday not knowing that I was re-filling my cup with my own coffee at home. She saw my cup and wanted one for herself. I think it would make a great gift.

Somebody gave me this bottle when cleaning out her fridge. She doesn't use syrup much but it was brand new and had a long way from expiring. Well, she gave away a great tasting syrup!Compared to the store bought brands out there, this one knocks them out of the water. You can taste that it's much more natural than the preservative laden stuff out there. The sweetness is just right and it's nice and thick like you want it. I kept mine in the fridge so that it'd stay fresher.I was sorry to see that we've finished it and I even rinsed out and kept the bottle. Now that I've seen it here, I may purchase the bigger bottle. Looking at the price, I'd say it is worth it!

Pros:-Very useful.-Bounces the on-flash light.-Lightweight.-Sturdy construction.-Not flimsy. The plastic feels nice and thick.-Fairly good in size. (I thought it was smaller.)-Comes with a small black drawstring pouch for storage.Cons:-Bulky. It won't really fit in my camera bag.-The black drawstring pouch isn't as good in quality as the Lightscoop itself. The pouch seems to be good for keeping dust off of it.I wasn't impressed with simply diffusing my pop-up flash so I bought a Lightscoop. Really, the light from this is nice. I am able to place this on my hotshoe and it doesn't look funny compared to other diffusing methods I've used. When I want to keep "low key" at a gathering or not bring my big strobe, I'll use this. People seem to find the pictures more pleasing that what they're used to with only using the harsh on-camera flash.I've also followed the instructions and have been to the flickr group site for techniques and even some inspiration.This is a fun product and experimenting with the light/reflectors/mirrors/walls give you different effects. Whatever you do, the results are fantastic.

I did not buy these cards here on Amazon. I found them at your local famous named "dollar" store. (You never know what you'll find there!)The quality of the cards are what you'd expect from playing cards. They seem a bit more smooth to me but maybe it's because they're new. They don't feel flimsy and I expect to get lots of playing time.And it's great to get lost in a few memorable scenes from the movies. Every card shows a scene and also has a quote from that scene. For example, on the King of spades it has: 'Temple of Doom: "Cover your heart Dr. Jones!"'If I had found these here, I'd have definitely picked up a set. And yes, there are scenes from all four movies.

My Tamrac (sub-compact) bag JUST for my Canon XSi (kit) wasn't cutting it. It's a nice little bag but it didn't have much cushioning and only an itty-bitty pocket in the front.
